Again *a different lady* confirmed, after I specifically asked about fish sauce and shrimp paste, that ALL the dishes on the vegetarian section contain animal products. Some dishes have to be specifically ordered without fish sauce and shrimp paste, and some such as the Pad Thai and All of their curries CANNOT.

Let me make something clear: If your restaurant labels a section in the menu as "vegetarian," I expect those dishes to contain NO MEAT. This is FALSE ADVERTISING and extremely misleading for those who want to avoid eating meat.

A mistake on labeling is one thing, but to know that the food contains animal product and blatantly misleading customers into thinking otherwise is NOT OK. 

* AND TO THE WORKERS AT THE RESTAURANT WHO REQUESTED THAT MY REVIEWS BE REMOVED SO YOU CAN HIDE THIS WELL-DESERVED ONE-STAR REVIEW* Stop ratting out to Yelp about my review being consistent across all three of your restaurants, as I did call all three restaurants, and all three gave the same lies. I'M DONE WITH THIS PLACE AND SO SHOULD EVERYONE WHO IS ETHICAL.
author: Vegans Eat 2.

description: Friendly good food quick and excellent service. We had pad Thai and pad Khing both a great deal and tasted fresh!
author: Paul D.

description: My date and I were seated at a table squeezed in with another party of 4, it doesn't seem that there are any tables for 2.  Unfortunately our main dish wasn't served after 35 minutes of waiting, and we had to ask about it 2 times after that before it finally showed up - 45 minutes after we got our soup. We had a show to get to, so this pretty much meant no main course for us -- we had to take it to go. The food was, in my opinion, OK but not that amazing. The place gets a star for reasonable prices, but don't expect good service.
author: Zach B.

description:
They should rename this place Le Rude Thai. This is your classic Asian place--great good but rude customer service:

My favorite part about the rudeness at this location is their hours. The website states open at 10:30AM. Their door states open at 10:30AM. You call and they say we are open. You get there and the rude girl says, "We closed. We cleaning now. Chefs never cook until 11am."

I do love the pad seeuw here and it is tasty without fail every time--a little scary that it comes out two minutes after you order.

The service here is awful every time though. They can't wait for you to leave. If you need to be in and out, and don't care for politeness, this is your restaurant.
author: Michelle N.

description:
BEST THAI FOOD I'VE EVER EATEN

SERVICE & PARKING / parking is a bit of a challenge at night, but not impossible. Waitress was nice, she scooped our rice hahah. Food took a bit to come out, but not too bad either. Overall decent.

FOOD / overall and all around the best

- the pork shoulder in the appetizer section, i forgot what it is called, was something new that i never thought I'd try but my brother's girlfriend said it was really tasty. And she did not lie. It was SO delicious. The sauce was also a really yummy addition. Try not to get lost in it because it's so good.

- the pad thai was also really good. Probably even better than the one I order from my local thai place in Torrance.

(I can't remember the other dishes we got)
author: Kacey A.

description:
I stopped by Lers Ros Thai to meet up with someone for dinner on Friday and had a great meal!

My dining companion is OBSESSED with Lers Ros Thai (apparently he goes at least once a week), so I let him take the reins on our order, and he did a great job. We shared a papaya salad with prawns, Pad Kra Prow (pork + an order of rice), a chicken pad see ew, and mango sticky rice. I thought most dishes were good but didn't necessarily set Lers Ros apart from my own neighborhood Thai places.

The papaya salad with prawns, on the other hand, was where Lers Ros really shone. It was so fresh, flavorful, and delicious (albeit messy if you try to wrap everything up in lettuce like I did). The prawns were so well-prepared and took the dish over the top. Don't miss this dish--it's incredible!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Didn't come here for a while. I ordered the following:

Drink:
-Thai Iced Tea (OK)

Appetizers:
-Kra Duk Moo Tod (fried tender marinated pork spareribs, served w/hot sauce) - No good & too dry

Lunch Special: (choose 2 items)
-Pad Kra Prow (Chicken stir-fried w/Basil leaves & house special sauce) - Good
-Kang Keaw Wan Pak (Green curry w/vegetables, tofu, Thai Eggplant, bamboo shoot , red Bell peppers, kaffir lime leaves) - Good

*All servers were nice!
author: Wendy L.

description: Ever since I've had their Lek Tom Yum Haeng, I've been coming back for more. Basically a dry tom yum noodle with ground pork, slices of fish cake, and crispy pork belly. Portion size is huge! They're definitely not skimpy on the ingredients. I loved how their crispy pork belly in this dish wasn't oily nor fatty. It was cooked perfectly! When all ingredients are mixed together, it creates a unique flavor. A little bit sweet and spicy, but still very delicious. Prices are a bit higher, but you get what you pay for. Highly recommended. :)
author: Philana C.

description:
I love this place! It is so delicious. I haven't had good Thai food in so long. 

-Raw garlic shrimp-pretty big pieces and it's pretty spicy
-Pork cheek-tender and great flavors
-Shrimp Pad Thai-super good. They do it right
-Duck curry-thumbs up. Can't ask for better. 

Must come back again!

Service was good, parking wasn't bad, but I came for lunch on a weekend.
author: Karen H.

description:
Overall review is 3 stars. The Thai food and the service here is average. We ordered the Pad See-Ew, green curry chicken, minced chicken with basil and chile, crab rolls, mixed vegetables and the Rad Nah. Some of the dishes were very good like the Pad See-Ew and the Rad Nah but green curry chicken was just average. The dish that really was disappointing was the minced chicken with basil and chile; this dish had a smell and taste that was just off. I would give this dish a one star. 

The restaurant was packed and the service could be much better. I think the restaurant is understaffed; I have had much better Thai food in the US than Lers Ros.
author: Michael C.

description:
Pro:
-Would recommend the Prawn and Asparagus dish! It had a delicate balance in taste and nutrition.
-Had options for brown rice
-Takes reservations

Improvements:
-It was rowdy and hard to hear my party
author: Linda K.

description:
Chicken Curry - 4.0
Beef Pad See Ew - 4.0
Nuer Pad King - 3.0

Open to trying other items. Overall had an enjoyable experience, would come back.
author: Will H.

description:
Best Thai food I've had in SF so far.

One of my friends had recommended this place to me so I decided to give it a try on a Saturday night. Came with 7 friends - made a reservation the day of and had no problem at all. We made a reservation for 8:30 pm and I was honestly a little surprised there were openings but definitely not complaining. 

We were all seated around 8:45 pm and ordered beer and wine (it is a beer and wine menu only...no cocktails). 

The menu itself is ridiculously large and overwhelming if you've never been there before (which none of us had been). We chose to do family style and share a bunch of items so we could try a little bit of everything.

APPETIZERS
Chicken Satay - delicious chicken skewers served with amazing peanut sauce and sliced cucumbers 

Tom Kah Kai soup - split among 4 of us = perfect amount and so tasty! You can also choose the amount of spice you want which was nice

MAIN ENTREES
Beef Pad Thai - SO GOOD! We actually ordered chicken but somehow beef came out which was not at all a problem, we ended up being very happy with the mixup since we were eating mostly chicken dishes anyway. We ordered this item from the Vegetarian section of the menu, since the tofu pad thai looked better than the meat one (this one included eggs, peanut sauce, cilantro, etc. and just substituted the tofu for meat)

Kang Keaw Wan (green curry coconut mil dish) - super spicy but so so flavorful and delicious. We ordered jasmine rice to go along with it and that made it even tastier! 

This was honestly one of my favorite meals I've had here and would highly recommend trying it out! I will be back and need to try the other locations as well.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Came here for a dinner with my roommates and we loved the super cute mabiance.

We waited 40 minutes for a party of 3 on a Saturday night.

The food was decent, but not mind blowing. I got the Papaya Salad with prawns, medium spicy. My salad came with 4 pieces of shrimp, but the papaya tasted like shrimp shell for some reason. 

My roommates got the Pad See Ew and Pad Thai which were decent but I don't think it was anything particularly special. 

Would come here more for the venue+ambiance than the food!
author: Anna M.

description:
My coworkers and I came here for a healthy and filling lunch and were delighted by the menu and quality of the food. I had pad thai with tofu with a side of peanut sauce - smooth and scrumptious. We also got the papaya salad, which was fresh and flavorful (with a slight kick). My coworkers enjoyed the curry as well and said it tasted richer than most. If you're looking for more of an adventure, they also serve alligator, frog, raw shrimp, and other exotic meats. (Or just ask for the meat to be left off of anything!) 

Protip: order in advance and pickup - it can turn into a bit of a wait at lunch.
author: Sally B.

description: One of my fave Civic Center eats! But pack a spare tongue, the food is very spicy!  Some favourites include the yum pla duk foo (catfish salad), green curry shrimp, and rockfish special.
author: Andrew L.

description: Let me come out straight away and admit that I do not particularly like Thai food. Coming to "Lers Ros", if anything, justified my opinion - all other Thai restaurants in Bay Area simply do not do it credit. But "Lers Ros" exists on a different plane. I have not been to Thailand, and cannot vouch for its authenticity, but simply based on a gut feeling (no pun intended), I strongly suspect that this is real stuff, and everything south of it is a Thai version of what "chop suey" used to be for Chinese. I was especially impressed with the special dish (not on a regular menu) of "skinny" noodles, ground pork, fish cakes and pork belly. The noodles were light and chewy, the pork belly perfectly crispy, the ground pork flavorful. As far as service, had no problems with it, either. The waiters do not fawn over you with obsequious smiles, but were fast and efficient. We told them we were going to the symphony - the food arrived in a jiffy. Also, let's not forget dessert of sticky rice with Durian. Did my neighbors in the Symphony Hall enjoy smelling it on my breath as much as I enjoyed eating it? Probably not...
author: Alex T.

description: Yum!! I came here based on the recommendation of my friend. This place is super good with the standard Thai food as well as some interesting dishes you won't find at a standard Thai restaurant. The green papaya salad was delicious, pad Thai was delicious, but what stood out as the star of the show was the pork shoulder. It was so tender and went great with the sauce on the side. I would highly recommend getting that dish for the table. The price was normal and wasn't pricey at all. New favorite Thai restaurant in SF!
author: Nicole Y.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Lers Ros but the one on Larkin is my favorite. I swear, their flavors beat all the other locations, hands down.

But, I still would take food from the Hayes location.  

Kao Mun Kai!!!!!   One of the best thai dishes I've ever had. 

I love the garlic rice and chicken, the spicy sauce and the hot broth.  I'm not even quite sure if there is a proper way to eat the dish but I eat it in a way that makes me happy.  A little of everything in each bite.

There is a spicy pork dish that comes with sprigs of spice balls that was really good too.  I wish I remembered what it was called, but some spicy pork.

The Pad Thai was just ok from here.  It was really wet and had way too much bean sprouts and peanuts for me.

The Tom Yum stuff was ok too.

Street parking on Hayes or around the neighborhood.

Make a reservation for dinner. Lunch is pretty empty.
author: Traci H.

description:
Food = good.

Kuay Tiew Moo Look Chin Pla (Special house boiled soup with noodle, pork and fish balls. Also comes with fish cake. Choice of thick or thin flat rice noodles.)  $9.95

Service = a bit slow but then again it was probably due to the lunch rush. 

They were quick about giving me the check but they took a while to finally run it. Surprisingly, the food came out quickly.  However, they gave me only a pair of chopsticks but no spoon nor napkins.  

Prices = moderate. Soup with tax & bag charge, $10.93 for take out lunch.
author: Fannie S.

description:
During our stay in San Francisco we visited this restaurant on a Thursday evening around 9 without a reservation and were seated immediately. The first thing that we noticed was the loud chatter of the other customers. Not per se a deal breaker but it is not a place to have a quiet conversation.
We ordered the green curry and red curry which arrived to our table 5 minutes later. The dishes were tasty and plenty but also extremely spicy,so much that it made us cry.
Lastly the rice was charged separately although it was not mentioned on the menu.
After orders the receipt both our credit cards were rejected, apparently the waitress was not familiar with credit cards that require pin entry.
Overall not bad
author: Kris L.

description: Nice menu selection.  The rock fish eggplant was excellent.  The green curry was a bit too spicy and noodles were okay but I've had better.  Like the small restaurant atmosphere, service was good and food came out quite fast!
author: Linda C.

description: I ordered a simple take out of 2 pork belly noodles and requested they put the pork belly meat on the side, they said sure. When I came to pick up, it was not placed on the side; asked the "professional waitress" if she could do it for me. She rudely said no. I went home open the food and THERE WAS NO PORK BELLY MEAT , only the skin . I think they need to reconsider their staff before claiming themselves upscale restaurant.
author: Phi N.

description: By far my favorite delivery in sf! Brings me back to my travels in Thailand. It's always super fresh and flavorful. I love to order a bunch of things especially the beef salad, grilled shrimp and papaya salad and mix it all up. It is spicy, which I love but if you don't enjoy spice maybe ask them to tone it down. For me personally though it's perfect. I've had all their locations and they are all great ! Highly recommend
author: brittany g.

description:
Review on service-
We got there and was asked if we had a reservation, although the place was rather empty. 
We were seated and waited a good 10 minutes before my dinner mate literally got up and asked for water and service. 

The food came in reasonable time. The food was average nothing great. I've had better I've had worse. 

I had to flag someone down to get a to go box. What was the kicker was that a male waiter picked up my bill, however after waiting another 10 minutes I had to flag him down to ask for my card back. He said another waitress was taking care of it and pointed to a girl at the register. However she handed a bill to another table. A group bigger than ours and came after us. I ask her for my card back as I was really ready to get the hell out of there. She blankly stared at me and said I'll go and find it. WHAT?!? She needs to find it??  They got no tip from me, and I'm personally a big advocate for tipping. 

All in all it took us a little under an hour and a half to get in and out and the majority of it was us waiting for service. 
Awful!!!
author: Maritza C.

description: Good Thai food, great price and friendly service. Only serve beer and wine, unfortunately. Ordered soup and shared 2 vegetarian entrees. Sauce was a bit sweet for my liking, medium spicy was quite bland in my opinion. I would try again if I was in the neighborhood but not go out of my way to eat here.
author: Sam L.

description: This place is so fricken good! I've been a few times and it just keeps getting better. The staff is fun and friendly and the food is super delicious! Try the Larb Kai salad and if it's still there, the scallop special!
author: Lucey M.

description:
This is the first time I went to Lers Ros's Hayes Valley location. It is the exact same as the Nob Hill location, but they have an outdoor patio. It is located right beside The Grove, another great restaurant. 

We had takeout at 2PM on a Friday.  The restaurant was still full of people. The order took about 10 minutes to prepare and tasted great. I recommend the Pad Thai, comes with tofu and prawns and costs $9 - great price!
author: Aletta B.

description:
NO LONG WAIT on a busy night in the city.
GREAT SERVICE. 
GREAT FOOD.
What more could you ask for? :)

We saw a Aziz Ansari's comedy show recently one weeknight and we had a group of about 8 of us. We were hoping to stop into Brenda's French Soul Food for dinner after the show but we already knew the wait was going to be horrendous, especially for such a big party like ours. So we basically ended up trekking it back and forth up and down Hayes Valley to find another spot to eat but every place, even the crappier lookin' restaurants were PACKED! People who live in the city truly do have that nightlife mentality. So crazy!

Luckily, one of the guys in our group found this spot on Yelp and called and made reservations with them for our big group and we trekked it all the way here in the cold. 
When we got there, the host was kind enough to hand us menus to look at while we stood outside as they waited for another table to finish up so they could set up ours.

As we got seated, the waitresses were kind enough to ask us if we wanted separate checks. Yes, that's BEFORE we even ordered. How nice! 

My friend Christine L. and I decided to order family style for just two of us. We got the Red Duck Curry with an order of brown rice and the Tom Yum soup. I thoroughly enjoyed every last drop of the curry. It was delish! The duck was cooked so perfectly too. Now, about that Tom Yum soup. It was flavorful, sweet and also really really really SPICY! There was definitely some kind of hidden pepper in that broth! Wowza!

My friend decided to also order mango and sticky rice for dessert and "forced" me to help her finish it. I basically licked that plate clean too. 

All in all, a very pleasant experience here at Lers Ros. I'd definitely come back for more if I'm in the mood for Thai in this area of SF.
author: Michelle V.

description:
I had take-out delivered from here and thought it was solid Thai food. The Kao Mun Kai (steamed chicken with garlic ginger rice) was a winner. Rice was very flavorful and the chicken was also tasty despite minimal sauce and no frying. It's probably one of the best I've had in the city for Asian chicken and rice. 

The Pla Koong was way too spicy and much less of a salad than I thought it'd be. The prawns were nicely cooked but it's basically on top of a pile of spice and onions next to a small cut of lettuce. I probably wouldn't get that again.
author: Victor W.

description: My group of friends ordered take out tonight. We emphasized we wanted the minced pork, not the pork belly. Then mistakes happened. This is not the first time so please the management team, get your things together. It's really not hard work.
author: Kandice Z.

description: DO NOT COME TO THIS RESTAURANT UNLESS YOU WANT THE WORST FOOD POISONING!!! Last night, Sunday April 22 my boyfriend and I came to Lers Ros Thai to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. We waited around 20 minutes for a table. Once seated, I ordered a Chicken Pad Thai without prawns and my boyfriend ordered the Pad Woon Sen with beef. Around 10-15 minutes after finishing our food both of us started to have extreme nausea and stomach pain. We spent the rest of the night with horrible gastrointestinal symptoms. The food poisoning was so bad I had to leave work this morning because I still feel sick ~18 hours later. I also learned that this was THE SAME THAI RESTAURANT  that gave a co-worker of mine horrible food poisoning about a month ago. She had eaten the green curry. I have yet to hear back from this restaurant for this horrible experience.  I will never go here again and will continue telling people in my various social circles to never go here. Save yourself, and find another restaurant. Also please to warn others never to go here!
author: Maddy A.

description:
The food is good! The service however, is not. Our waiter was rude to us on more than one occasion, and brought out the wrong food. To be fair, Pad See Ew and Pad Thai sound similar, but are totally different dishes. He offered us no apology for the mistake, and in fact decided he didn't like our table anymore and completely ignored us after that. Another waitress helped us for the remainder. 

Unfortunately Les Ros is my friend's favorite restaurant. This was my first time visiting and I have been hearing her rave about the food for months. The food was good, but the waitstaff ruined it for me.
author: Krysta S.

description: Amazingly fast service for prime time Friday. Fresh food, plenty of flavor. Had the wontons, Chicken Pad Thai and Tom Kha Soup - which came served over a flame.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Some of the most flavorful and delicious Thai food I've ever had with great service!

Pad ped with short ribs - unique dish served with peppercorn and a curious vegetable we couldn't name (pomelo? No.)

Chicken pad Thai- exceptionally delicious.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Thai Time.

In the months before our recent SF trip, my brother was exploring ins and outs of the Hayes Valley neighborhood.  In time he discovered this part of SF has a great many bars and restaurants.  And thankfully, one of those eateries was Lers Ros Thai.  

NOTE:  Though we had to change our reservation at the last minute, we appreciated that the restaurant was accommodating with our request.

FOOD:
1.  Kang Keaw Wan (Green Curry):  THIS dish was extremely delicious.  My brother had looked thru a few reviews before dinner, and this dish appeared to popular with other yelpers.  And truly, those reviews with accolades for the green curry were right on point. This was our favorite dish of the 3 that were ordered.  Full of flavor and appetizing.  We finished the entire portion.  Recommended.

2.  Koong Pad Pak (Prawns stir-fried with mixed vegetables and bean sauce):  Our 2nd favorite entree we ordered.  I think we all appreciated the generous helping of vegetables that was served with this dish.  I would order this again on a future visit.

3.  Kai Pad Pa (Stir-fried chicken with mixed vegetables and bean sauce):  It was ok.  I didn't care for the chicken.  It wasn't very tender in my humble opinion.  We were all in agreement that this was our least favorite order.

SERVICE:  Very attentive.  The friendly server helped us select 1 of the dishes we ordered, as well as recommending a sake to accompany our dinner.  He checked on us throughout our meal and made sure everything was ok.  

BOTTOM LINE:  Wonderful meal paired with terrific service.
author: Michael C.

description: The service was okay. They didn't pour us more water. The interior looked classy and it was quiet around 3pm, so a great time to sit and chat with friends. The fried salt and pepper rabbit had a lot of bones, which was hard to eat around. It tasted like chicken, but better. The alligator meat was well seasoned with spice and Thai vegetables. The alligator was worth it, but the rabbit not really.
author: Jie-Yun C.

description: This place is cute and quick.  The food came fast.  I had a sweet and sour tofu plate, it was very good.  Vegetarian/vegan options are abundant and good.
author: Mickaylah P.

description: Very good Thai food! This is my favorite Thai food in the city. I have had several other Thai places in the city and this is my favorite. I have been coming here for about 5 years. The place is reasonably priced. I usually get green curry, Pad Thai, pork belly, and Tom ka soup. Fantastic and I will always come back.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
Fancy ambiance, attentive service, and good portions of food. If you're looking for a good Thai restaurant to eat at for a dinner or date, make sure you make reservations! When my friend and I got there at 5:30pm, the restaurant was basically empty, but we were told the wait would be 45 minutes for a table otherwise we'd have to sit at the bar. (Ain't nobody got time to wait! So we sat at the bar.) I was going to be annoyed if the place didn't fill up 45 minutes in, but it was completely full and there was a lot of people waiting to get seated!

- Pad Thai ($10): decent dish
- Kang Phed Yang - red curry with roasted duck, bamboo shoots, red bell peppers, tomatoes and chunk pineapples ($14): very flavorful, and the duck (although a bit fatty) was so tasty! 

Our server did kind of have a RBF, but hey, my water was always filled and service was top notch. Definitely can't complain!
author: Christine S.

description: Beyond and below my expectations. I ordered the Black Pepper & Garlic Rabbit last evening after laughing my ass off at the Norse Theater with Whose Live Anyways. The rabbit was listed as a special/entré. It came quickly to my table. I was not expecting a roughed up chopped deep fried nugget nibblet popcorn bites pieces of "meat" and more bones placed over lightly sautéd/fried chopped garlic on a piece of romain lettuce leaf. I was thinking of it grilled or sautéd, add some flat noodles and Thai chili peppers and cracked peppercorns. I got a "meal" I would find more over a wood stove cooked on a cast iron pan out in the frontier.
author: Christopher V.

description: I've eaten here twice now, and the food is mediocre at best. I wanted to try it once more to make up my mind but I regret that now. The prices are pretty high but considering the location, that's expectable I guess. However, I'd think that the food would at least be worth it. Both times, the food I got had a weird after taste. The restaurant smelt of old food and the waitresses either ignored me or were rude. I don't think I'm going back again.
author: Vaish R.

description: I only ever get take out from this place, so I can't comment much on the space or service. I can say that they always have my order right. They are always very couteous, even when the restaurant is packed, and fast. They always have my food ready in twenty minutes. Portion sizes are good and the food is solid Thai. One of my go-tos for game night.
author: Gary B.

description: Always on my list of places to go eat when I'm in town.  Always delicious. Tends to be a wait. Best to make a reservation.
author: alex g.

description:
Awesome Thai food if you are sick of going to another Osha + Convenient Location + Great Prices for Hayes Valley

Food: everything is awesome, huge fan of the (beef) YUM NAM TOK, the rice is awesome quality if you're a picky Asian & the peanut sauce warrants multiple orders of chicken skewers to start

Location: Conveniently in Hayes Valley so the basic b****es don't need to walk through the TL... double edged sword because you do get crowds when the old women come in from the burbs for the symphony 

Pro-Tip - I like their Pad Thai more than their Pad See Ew (too oyster-y),would rather get Chow Fun at a Chinese takeout joint + get dessert next door at the Grove!
author: Roger L.

description:
I love good thai food.  There is nothing better than having a rich creamy curry that can completely turn your day around.  I dined here with a friend for a quick lunch eat.  It has been one of my more enjoyed meals here in San Fran!

Their Gaeng Kew Wan (Jungle Green Curry) was very delicious.  It had a rich complex spice to it with lots of delicious eggplant and other vegetables.  My friends Pad Thai looked great (though I didn't get get to steal a bite to try).

Well worth a visit, it looked very busy so I think we were lucky to dine here without reservations.
author: James O.

description: It is a Monday afternoon and the lunch rush is over, but why is there still a reason to give horrible service? This is my second time I've been here and it will be the last. The food is good, but you would think that since this restaurant is in Hayes Valley, the staff would hold themselves to a higher standard of service, but I guess not. The staff is rude; they won't check on you, neither take your order in a prompt manner, but when I'm ready to pay, the staff is quick on their feet? Sorry, I refuse to give my business to a restaurant where staff treat you like a nuisance and have a bad attitude. This is the last time I'm coming here for lunch.
author: Jia A.

description:
Thai place gone wrong.

Thai themed intricate decor that was lost to dominant, contemporary, modern American, Ikea-like design.

We ordered up their special of the day Stir-Fried Vegetables with Scallops and it clearly was not spazzing with Thai flavors.  All too bland and no uniqueness to the presentation and specialty of making the dish.  As for Pad Thai - every Thai restaurant has to make it up to par.  That is the typical dish to order up at Thai restaurants.  It was disappointing.  I mean it was good, but again, the flavor was not oh my goodness, it is delicious.  They didn't offer any side condiments too.  I had to ask for plenty of lemon wedges to cancel out the under flavored Pad Thai. 

Service was mediocre.  They saw us, seated us, took our orders, served out the entrees and we left.  

I just wasn't feeling the rich, warm Thai energy in their ambiance, food and service.
author: Tiffany D.

description: This place is absolutely delicious. I love to come here when I'm in town. It's very conveniently located by War Memorial and Davies hall, so a good location for concert goers! I definitely suggest the pad thai or Tom Kha. Absolutely delicious!!
author: Isabella I.

description:
We enjoyed Lers Ros Thai.  Apparently my sister in law is a regular because the place lit up as soon as she entered the door.  

The place is nice, small but nice.  It can be a little loud with the dinner crowd.  I ordered the Pad-see-ew, my wife had the Beef ball soup, My sister had a rice dish and pork skewers and my brother in law had a noodle dish. We ordered a nice Red wine which went well with our meal.  The food was good. The service was very good and our water glasses remained full.  

This is clearly a place where the locals come to eat.  I usually try to eat where the most authentic meals are.  Where the people of the culture eat.
author: Glenn N.

description:
Food is still good, but service is still lacking.  We came during lunch hour, and yes, I would understand service would be a little slow.  But it doesn't make sense when I get my dish and then have to wait half an hour for my 3 other dining partners' dish.  It's not like we ordered something special, it's all from the lunch menu.
The place on Larkin might be a few blocks further for me, but the service is just so much better.  Plus, the lunch menu is $1 cheaper on Larkin.
author: Karen L.

description: Not sure if we would return to this particular Lers Ros. We had dinner there last night. The server was very curt and rude. She rushed us along and wanted to start taking our order within 2 minutes of us sitting down and acted annoyed that we weren't ready. Dinner was tasty. We left a decent tip, and didn't dock her despite how we felt. However we did have leftovers and when we opened them the next day, they had not bothered to include our leftover rice, and there was somehow a piece of chicken in my husband's vegetarian yellow curry. Not pleased :( Overall a disappointment.
author: Anne Y.

description:
The best lunch special in this part of town! Not one but TWO choices for entrees/protein, rice, and salad for a little less than ten bucks. AMAZING! Food was great and service was kind. They are packed during the lunch hour so get there just before noon to get a table if you are with a group. 

I had the chicken with cashews and chilies and one of the tofu dishes. I asked for spicy and food lacked heat even with the "hot sauce". If they could use some actual hot peppers, food would be near perfect.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Okay, Lers Ros. I'm intrigued. 

I was around the corner at the biergarten enjoying my liter of beer and catching up with a good friend of mine when we were feeling pretty hungry. Neither of us spends much time in the neighborhood so we had no idea what was around. After a quick minute of scouring yelp for places to eat, we decided to get some Thai food, downed our beer, and headed out. 

Surprisingly, we were seated immediately, even though it was dinner time. However, I'm not terribly fond of their seating arrangement as we were in (really) close proximity to other customers. 

Their menu is pretty extensive. But I ended up getting the pad thai because...well... if a place can't even make THAT right, then...

Anyway, the pad thai was definitely solid and the portion was generous. I like my food to have a little kick to it so I asked for some type of hot sauce and the waitress returned with several small glass jars of some pepper sauces. 

The restaurant itself was rather clean and the modern decor added to the upscale feel. I was totally expecting to pay an upscale/sf price but that wasn't the case. I believe my order was around $9 or so. 

Serivice was passable. 

In short, I enjoyed my experience at Lers Ros and I will be back to try their other menu items. Hopefully, this place is just as good without alcohol in my system! haha
author: John B.

description: Mediocre Thai food. It's the usual suspects but just not as good as you would like it to be.
author: J. A.

description:
Delicious and quick service. 
Tables are too close together, can't be helped since it is a little place and very busy at lunch time. 
Combo orders are available, for those who want to try diff items.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Tom kha kai - bad serving dish (hard to spoon out of once low), heavy on the lime, add sugar to taste, good over all though.

Look chin ping beef balls- almost gamey. Tastes like a cow smells.

Pork shoulder - really good. Juicey and tender.

Garlic quail- tastey but slightly overcooked

nuer pad prik thai beef- spicy but flavorful

Pad phed Venison - way too spicey. Painful!

Kang phed yang (duck)- VERY good. Tendor, perfect level of spicy, great flavor, great sauce.

Mango sticky rice- undercooked rice, good mango, good coconut milk flavor. Not great overall

"I'm not too impressed with this place. Unfortunately because I had high hopes coming in! Great town though and cool ambiance."
author: Michelle S.

description: Amazing food! We loved the atmosphere and the friendly service. Everything was fantastic. We would definitely eat here again and we highly recommend this place!
author: Destiny K.

description:
This is as adventurous as I can get on a wet wet wet day in SF.  I couldn't bear to order the garlic and pepper rabbit or minced frog as I was with my two young kids who are very into Peter Rabbit and Kermit lately, so Pad Ped Alligator it was. 

It was a little tough, but boy, when they say 'medium spicy', it's for people who grew up eating very spicy food. Glass of water, please!

On a bright note, the rest of the meal was great-- the kids loved the chicken noodle soup (not spicy), and we absolutely loved the garlic quail appetizer, green papaya salad and yum nam tok (roasted beef with spicy lime dressing). 

Main gripes: the floor is slippery, and I was already wearing rain boots! And the bathrooms need to be updated to match the rest of the restaurant. 

I've been to both Lers Ros locations, and while this location is trendier, I'll agree with most that the Tenderloin location feels more authentic. It just happens that I'm always in the Hayes Valley area so I'll likely frequent this location more.
author: Dawne L.

description: Simply one of the great discoveries of my lifetime, in regards to all three locations (this is my least favorite parking situation though). Word on the street KOH MOO YANG PORK SHOULDER is love me tender great, and they weren't kidding, but you got to add the white rice between the bites. RED PUMPKIN CURRY SHRIMP is a tad spicy and saucy to the max. But I still say the off-the-menu treasure is LEK TOM YUM HAENG, a rumble in your tummy jungle -- crispy pork, ground pork, fish cake, chili flakes on a bed of noodles (choose thin noodles over fat, I've done both). It's one of the top ten dishes of all-time, of anything, anywhere. #bustabutton
author: Sean C.

description: Came here for Sunday lunch and made a reservation a head of time. The lady seemed very skeptical whether our group was able to make the time since we only reserved an hour before. I was very confused as why they don't have rice with the curries. It just seems so odd to me that it was additional cost. Maybe I'm too used to Vancouver offering it together. The red curry came and it looked like a very small portion but it was sufficient. I ordered brown rice, nothing special. The thai iced tea was pretty good. I enjoyed that a lot. I don't think I would come back again though.
author: Millie W.

description: Went with a friend the other day for a late lunch.  We arrived at 2pm and they advised they closed at 230pm to prepare for dinner service.  While I understand that, every website that shows their hours does not indicate a break in service, so myself and another couple were bummed out.  Anyhow, we still ordered our food and inhaled it.  It was great, both of us enjoyed our lunch and would come back.  The service was probably more of a 2 star.  I ordered a Coke and they brought me a hot one with a glass containing 3 ice cubes - and they're weren't big either!  They also removed our lunch mats from the table when we sat down, so that was kind of weird.  At any rate, go there when they first open and not before they close.
author: Shaun W.

description: Love this place! The food is delicious and you can beat the lunch special! The grilled chicken is a favorite. The green curry is nice and spicy!!!
author: L M.

description:
I LOVED this place! One of the best thai restaurants I've been too, for sure.

We sat near the bar on a high table. I don't know if it's like this every night (we went on a Saturday) but there was a 4-people Thai band playing near us, by the bar as well. It was a little loud to talk for the bar area but it was still ok. :-)

I wanted peanut sauce but felt like having prawn instead of chicken or beef. Even if that wasn't on the menu, I was able to get it! It was soooooo good! Lots of peanut sauce, served with spinach and pretty big fresh-tasting prawns.

Husband had beef green curry which he loved!

We had ginger and garlic rice. It was sooo delicious! We also ordered a brown rice since there was so much sauce left, it was good but my favorite is definitely the ginger one (4$ vs. 2) I will be ordering again during my next visit.

Staff was friendly + good fast service (we were served like 5 minutes after we ordered on a Saturday night!).

Only negative point and I won't take out a star since they quickly found a solution and the food was so amazing: when we showed up, they hadn't written down our reservation.
Had given my name, number and reconfirmed location... Perhaps since I had called between 4 & 5 p.m. and they close for an hour then... Still had talked to someone though, so beware!

42$ without tip for two. Pretty good!
Can't wait to come back and try the Pad Thai maybe?
author: Leslie S.

description:
As a lover and connoisseur of Thai Food cuisine (ok not exactly), I must say this place is decidedly average. 

For the most part everyone in my circles has excellent food and restaurant taste, so anytime a place is hyped up by more than one of my friends I come to expect big things. 

Alas...this place just comes up short in multiple important areas. 

Food - We ordered the Pad See You and Yellow Curry and chose to share both dishes as is my custom. The food was alright for the most part, especially the curry, but the noodles and rest of the meal left me wanting more. For being hyped as the go-to Thai restaurant in the area, I was expecting at least one of the dishes to blow me away. Not the case.

Environment  - The vibe in here was very "meh" as a whole. We came on a weekend night, and it was surprising to see the place be so low energy, especially when compared to the vibrant and trendy restaurants surrounding it in Hayes Valley. Also - while not the restaurant's fault - the people that sat next to us were a little...what's the word..."basic"? When they weren't bickering about minor details of their relationship they were engaged in discussions of friend drama or celebrity gossip. Seriously. 

Service - So on this occasion I happened to be grabbing dinner with a really good friend of mine who I hadn't seen in more than a year, so we had a LOT to catch up on. Despite that fact, for some reason every 5 minutes or so members of the staff would return to our table and ask to clear our plates or bring to-go boxes. Despite the fact that we would politely decline their request, a short time later another person would return and ask the same question. Hmm. 

I mean while it's true that we were eating slowly, it was also clear that the reason for that was because I was having an actual conversation with someone at dinner. Therefore, there was really no need to come back and ask the same question over and over again, and really, it would have been nice to have a little bit of uninterrupted conversation. 

So overall not my favorite (not sure I would come back), but also not terrible enough to leave a bad taste in my mouth or anything. Just a forgettable meal.
author: Brian S.

description: I really like their lunch specials. Also like ho fast the service is. My only complaint is that you cannot get the lunch special to go. I do not understand this because sometimes it is so crowded they lose business. If I could get the lunch special to go I would give 5 stars.
author: Amanda B.

description: 1 star for the fried rice and 1 star for the curry and that's about it. Staff was really rude and not welcoming at all. They sat us in the back corner even though there were other people and lots of space in the center of the restaurant. The pad thai was the worst. It tasted NOTHING like pad thai. It legit tasted like barbecue chicken.
author: Andrea R.

description: I had rabbit meat here for the first time. It was good. I felt there was more bone than meat, but then again it's rabbit. The meat itself tasted like chicken. I thought it was gonna have more of a gamey taste. Overall, I've eaten at better Thai restaurants in my opinion but I do like the fact that they consistently offer more exotic meats like frog legs, alligator, rabbit.
author: Rodney G.

description: Literally yelled into my ear when I was trying to order for pick up. Staff is super unprofessional and hostile. Not going to go pick up my food now.
author: Derika L.

description:
Location and interior was nice, food and service was decent. I had the Pad Ke Mow (drunken noodles), and it was fine.

This was a 3 star experience, but it wasn't bad! Seems like there is a lot of hype about this place, but with so many other options to eat in SF, I may not be so quick to return.
author: Jordan L.

description: Really nice upscale Thai restaurant with very affordable prices considering the location. Beautifully designed clean interior and also plating of food. Tons of dishes to choose from, almost too much. Ordered the seafood curry and chicken satay. Curry was a bit bland and not spicy and curried enough especially for a Thai dish as Thai food is usually VERY spicy. Its perhaps made for non-Asian/Thai customer palate but this was too unspicy. Overall very good tho and I'll come back to try other dishes.
author: p f.

description:
Close to the theater district, this Lers Ros Thai is a great spot for a quick pre-show bite. And I mean quick! We had a party of 12 and we were able to finish ordering-eating-sorting-out-the-bill in an hour!

Our party loved the fried trout, tom yum, spicy papaya salad, venison, and scallops.

The decor is very classy and the prices are quite good.

It's walking distance (a block or two) from the War Memorial Opera House, Davies Symphony, and Nourse Theater. Really fantastic spot.

Thank you!
author: Vicky J.

description:
So bad it made us question whether food should be eaten ever again. 

I ordered the fried rice and pad see ew from Caviar (a delivery app) on February 7th because my boyfriend and I were too lazy to go to the store. 

We were starving, so it's pretty amazing that it tasted the way it did. The rice was flavorless and dry. The pad see ew was slimy and made our stomach's hurt the moment we swallowed. I actually tried to dress the food up, adding some veggies, spices and seasoning, but it was as if rotten fish juice had spilled all over everything. There was an inescapable taste of bad.

I cannot believe they have 3 locations. Hopefully our meal was a mistake, but I know I will never order from this place again.
author: Julia T.

description:
This is my Thai place in the city!!
Really good food and attentive service.
Love it!!!
author: Melinda M.

description:
Ambiance is great. Food is subpar. Ordered their pad se ew which was a small pile of noodles. Lacked vegetables and had hardly any shrimp. The flavours were not great and it was drowning in what tasted like soy bean sauce. 
Eggplant dish with chicken - not great. Eggplant was cooked well but would not recommend this dish. 
Tom yum - decent. I enjoyed the soup but wasn't expecting all the vegetables like broccoli and cabbage. If you don't mind the twist then I'd say go for it.
Mango with sticky rice - rice way too undercooked. But tasted good and the mangos were perfectly delicious and ripe. 

Overall, flavours are not very authentic but it's a good place to come for a date or with a few friends. They have good service and the food comes out pretty fast. They don't accept reservations until 8pm. We waited 30 mins on a Friday night when we got there at 7:45.
author: Isabel B.

description:
Went to Lers Ros Hayes St for a gathering with my new friends, there were 10 of us and each spent $21 for a group meal.

1. Food was delicious!
2. Ambience was great.
3. Great and fast service

We ordered so many things (I forgot the Thai name though..) such as Pad Thai (I love the Pad Thai, noodles are tender, fresh prawns, and fresh bean sprouts too), Spicy Duck with Red Onion (just like the name it was a bit spicy but I love it because I love spicy food), Steamed Sea Bass (I'd say this is the bomb!! I've been missing Asian food and this sea bass is just on point, so incredibly fresh and cooked well), Tom Yum (also very fresh and served hot in a mini stove, you can taste the Thai flavor in the broth), and a bunch of other great dishes.

Ambience was great for large groups, and the service there was fast and so nice!
author: Annisa J.

description:
Ordered the Pra Ram Kai as take out, so not able to comment on the restaurant experience. This dish is sliced chicken with spinach and peanut sauce.

Sliced chicken: Dry
Spinach: Oily
Peanut sauce: Mild

Overall, not an inspiring dish and just boring. I'd heard good things about them, i.e. "they are the best Thai in the whole city." Not true.
author: N'olo J.

description: My absolute favorite Pad Thai in SF. So creamy and delicious. You won't be disappointed. They have great lunch specials too. Great location if going to the Symphony or Ballet/Opera.
author: Rachel B.

description:
My girlfriend and I had a good dinner date here before the Symphony last night. Definitely try the Koh Moo Yang Appetizer (pork shoulder)! It was delicious with the dipping sauce which was spicy with chili, but also citrusy and zesty. We also had the Rockfish special and the stir fried chicken with ginger/onion. Both were flavorful, but the Rockfish definitely had more spice and flavor fireworks. The fish itself was nice and soft.

Nice, modern ambiance with reasonable prices. Service was good. I recommend making reservations over the phone since I saw people turned away and by 6:30 the place was full.
author: Josh L.

description:
A not so traditional Thai restaurant with lots of selections including some not so ordinary meats. 

Restaurant is in a nice and busy neighborhood. Inside is very loud with a nice view overlooking Hayes St. 

On to the food! We ordered 3 dishes:
- Deep fried pepper and garlic quail with spicy sauce on the side. Also available with frog or rabbit. Dish is very well fried and the sauce is a good complement. 4/5
- Stir fried Crispy pork belly. The skin is very Crispy and thicker than the similar dish found in Chinese restaurant. Sauce is quite good but very oily. 3.5/5
- The one I'm looking forward the most: stir fried alligator meat! They only have one dish with this meat. Never tried it before so I was eager to try. The dish itself is average at best but the meat is quite good. It's very chewy meat. The closest thing I can think of is a thick calamari but it doesn't have the same texture. 3/5

Closed off with ice cream desert. They have durian sticky rice if you like durian :)

Overall: highly recommended. Will come back again to try out  different meat.
author: Erick K.

description:
I just had a second poor service experience. The first time I went, they asked us to switch tables halfway through our meal, put us against a wall, and then didn't even end up using the table they moved us from.

Tonight, I order the remainder of my curry to go and they dumped the liquid in a cardboard box with saran wrap around it so the liquid soaked through the bottom and spilled everywhere.

Then, I found a hair in the food.

The food is good,  but the service is seriously detracting.
author: Erin R.

description:
Lers Ros is on the higher end of Thai food, with smaller portions and more refined flavors. Their menu offers the typical dishes, like phad thai, but they also have more luxury items featuring duck and crab. Luckily my boyfriend and I were able to try a good sampling of their food with our per diems since the prices are definitely up there.

My favorite dish was the crab fried rice, which wasn't at all greasy or overly salty. The amount of real crab in the dish was generous, and it made a familiar dish more unique. Their pad see ew was also pretty good, with a good amount of chicken, although it was on the saltier side. We also tried a spicy chicken dish, which had a great lemongrass aroma that wasn't like anything I've had at other Thai restaurants. All in all, it was a perfectly sized meal that didn't leave me feeling heavy. The Thai flavors were able to come through without the usual grease and heavy-handed flavors of a lot of Thai places!
author: Ashley T.

description: Lers Ros is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. I am use to going to the one in the Tenderloin. This location is not a hole in the wall. It's more trendy for a night out and taking your dates. Enjoy the same food without getting bother by some crack head. My favorite is the stir fry pork belly with that awesome crackling, tom kha, duck larb salad. Honestly, you can get anything here and it's pretty good. Feeling adventurous; they serve rabbit, alligator, and quail. I also like that I can order brown rice and it's not a small bowl, they give a pot full per order. Service is always good and it always hits the spot when I am craving something spicy.
author: Kien M.

description: Food was not bad although the portions did not meet the price. The service on the other hand was terrible. When ordering our meal the server asked if we wanted brown rice or white rice as of it came with the meal, in the end they charged us extra for the rice. Not once did they fill our own water cups and we had to hunt down our waiter to get our check to get sauce
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite a few days ago.  I've been there before on a Sunday afternoon and I enjoyed everything!  This was the third time my husband and I went during the week and I wasn't that thrilled with my food.  I tried the ginger shrimp - I found out I don't like ginger.  The rice was great.  I ordered some rolls but I didn't like the flavor.
The server was a little mean to me and I let that affect my desire to eat.  
 I may try it again but on a weekend - the staff seem more happier then.
author: Glamorous O.

description:
Fusion Thai food. Omg the crab cake..seriously are you kidding me. At least you could have added crab extract (gives an impression of crab). Its made out of some kind of fish. Doesn't taste or smell like crab, then its not crab..I was in shock when they brought it to our table. Was about to say, we didn't order that.
The soup was good.
Service was slow, not attentive.
author: Marlui A.

description: Had a concert at the Opera House so this was a pre-concert dinner - very busy so make reservation if at all possible.  Good, solid Thai food.
author: Carl A.

description:
The staff need some serious training on waitress etiquette - served the water before the customer asked for it 3 times. No success on asking for extra bowl and a plastic fork (for the kid). 

Highlight of the meal was the food. I will give them 3 stars. Everything is mediocre, except the shrimp paste fried rice. 

Too many Thai restaurants in SF. Don't have a reason to come back.
author: anita s.

description:
Looks chic enough to be the next best thing. If only it didn't fall a bit short by user reviews.  Lers Rod Thai is a hip place to grab a swanky cocktail and feel as if you're in a downtown metropolis when really you're only in Hayes Valley. Cold dark wood, with cement and glass surrounding it's diners this restaurant begs for the hot 20-something crowd of singles who intend on grabbing a few drinks before a night out.  The decor certainly keeps the noise inside as it was fairly loud with each table talking over the next.  If only it were in the Marina.

Lers Ros serves some delicious food!  The Ginger chicken had to be the highlighted dish of the night with fresh bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, ginger, and of course, chicken. The Pad See Ew was also equally delicious but nothing that made me stake claim to a new Thai eatery. The finishing touches of a sticky rice with mango dessert begged for a bigger stomach and infinite scoopage.

All-in-all this restaurant is well worth it's 3+ star rating.  Will I dine here again? Yes.  Will it be anytime soon?  Possibly.  Can I say that it's one of my favorite places or soon to be favorite?  No - hence the solid 3 star rating.  After leaving the table having only paid $32 for our 3 large dishes, I was pleased.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Prices on Yelp are not accurate. Add an additional $1 or $2--had I not already committed and sat down I would've head down the street for better priced Thai food. 

The food itself was good; overkill on the bean sprouts and tofu on the Pad Thai to the point where you couldn't taste the noodles/chicken but it was saucy. 

I headed here for the tom yum soup and I could barely finish a few spoon fulls--not that it was too spicy (I could totally handle some Thai spice) but there was not enough water added to dilute the taste; they were generous with their shrimp prawns though (maybe it just seemed that way because there wasn't enough soup? #thedroughtisreal) 

But as mentioned in other reviews, the service was chaos. Though they great you with a smile, you're not assigned to a server so be prepared to flag one of them down to take your order, refill your drink, get a take out box, ask for a lid for said take out box, ask for your bill, and then ask where your bill is?

Sunday nights aren't even that busy... ? 
They dropped the ball today.

Come here if you've got time to kill with friends and patience to ignore the bad service.
author: jamie j.

description:
Didn't see alligator anywhere, but they did have frog, rabbit, quail, eel, catfish, boar, and oil paintings. I didn't see much else; although I thought I'd glimpsed open seating in the main area, I was placed behind a divider. Wasn't this called "time out" back in preschool? That explains why "dunce" was written in Thai on the hat the server gave me to wear. #nonotreally

PAD PED PLA LAI $12.95 "Spicy Chili paste with Thai Eel(Bone-In), Young pepper corn & Galingale": Different from unagi and anago. Smaller cross-section, rounder slices, and has a spine (which you can eat).
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oj38qHzfuRrmtCZpAzPPzw&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

THAI HERB SAUSAGE $8.95: I couldn't figure out which corn snack these tasted like. I was getting close by the last two bites. See if you can tell me once you've eaten it.
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=v4zX5hj89K-gqXkSJgiCQw&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

Have you seen a school of fish - in a cluster, then making darts to and fro at random? That's how this overpopulated server team moves, similar to its counterpart at the Tenderloin Lers Ros http://www.yelp.com/biz/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco#hrid:zfD_OTZ9cr3LanEHg2JS-A. In fact, I recognized at least one worker who does both spots.

Takeout was going well. Indian dudes, an old black U of M alum, and a post-hipster were just some of the people dropping in to pick up their orders. The servers verified the items against the customers' recollections, too.
author: Dan B.

description:
great location on Hayes. modern ambiance.great food!

my first dining experience was for a group of 15 so food was just ordered for the table, however the 1 thing i made sure to order was the LARB DUCK since ive heard it was featured in the 7x7 magazine. 

all the dishes ordered was very good. this was also the most juciest pad see yew ive ever had. i recommend the brown rice instead of white because their brown rice is actually a blend of brown and red rice and is amazing. the duck was my favorite dish of all and it so happened to be the only dish i took a picture of too
author: Sarina A.

description: Big bonus points for the location and the ambiance inside, relative to most other Thai places I've been. The food isn't the most flavorful. Portions are normal. I could get a better value elsewhere, overall, if I sacrificed location and ambiance.
author: Paulina F.

description: I've only ever gotten Lers Ros as takeout or delivery, but I've always had a great experience. Delicious!
author: Matt J.

description: My friend and I stopped by here on a Sunday afternoon around 3. We were seated immediately, and the ambience was pleasant. We got two orders of pad thai (with shrimp), and they tasted very good. While the dishes were presented nicely, the garnish was a bit much and took up almost half the plate. I also had a Thai iced tea which was pretty refreshing.
author: Anika J.

description:
When a Thailand native who works at different Thai place says Lers Ros is the best, most authentic Thai in the city...Believe them.

I ducked in here on Sunday night to get a basic Pad Thai to go. The place was full and there was a build up at the door, the host took my order in less than 5 minutes and said it would be ready in 10. He was right. Paid 12 for the very big portion and gave a 2 buck tip.

The rest of the menu looked amazing, decent bar area considering how small the place was and how can you beat the prices compared to every other overpriced place in Hayes Valley?!? You can't.

Stop looking. This is the only Thai place in SF you need to go to. Ever.
author: A T.

description: Lers Ros Thai is a fancier Thai place. The atmosphere is cool, with an exposed stone wall on one side, floor-to-ceiling windows, and dark dining tables and chairs. My friend and I ordered the pad thai ($14.95) and alligator entree ($21.95). I'd never had alligator before, and it was quite chewy to me but not off-putting in any way. The alligator dish was quite spicy, and the pretty berry-like garnishes that we thought were edible were actually fresh black pepper plants or something of the sort--we learned the hard way. While Lers Ros Thai portions are smaller and more expensive than the plentiful cheap Thai restaurants I'm used to in the East Bay, I thought their pad thai was one of the best if not the best I've ever had! It possibly could've been a tad less sweet, but I think the fact that the serving was smaller than other heaping noodle dishes made the flavors more vibrant. My friend said that they are always out of mango when he tries to order mango sticky rice here (including their other locations) and sure enough, when we asked for the dessert they said they had no mango. We opted for the alternative, stinkier durian sticky rice. I've never ordered dessert at a Thai restaurant before, but tasting the sticky rice dish has opened me up to the option in the future. The dessert was composed of a mound of a mixture of rice and durian pieces, coated in a sweet syrup like condensed milk. I liked that the whole thing was warm and the durian seemed like it was steamed along with the rice, since the pieces were well integrated into every bite. However, glutinous rice is pretty heavy stuff, and the more durian I ate the more its peculiar stench got to me, so splitting the dessert among at least two people yields appropriate serving sizes. It would be a satisfying night to go to SF Jazz or the Symphony next door topped off by dinner at Lers Ros Thai.
author: Amy G.

description: Overall an excellent restaurant making fresh, spiced and non-greasy Thai food. Every dish is outstanding and overall a good value for high quality, tasty food.
author: Laurence S.

description: Very good from my extremely limited exposure to Thai food. Don't be afraid to ask the staff for help or a combination of that and simply pointing at other people's food like I did. Sun-dried beef was deliciously sweet in a beef jerky kind of way, be generous with the sauce because life is short and why not? =)
author: Jay D.

description:
Mind you I've never been to the original locale. Ive heard hype beyond reproach so I think the expectations were way out of line. Even Thai friends saying that this is the best you can get. Well I can think of a new place where I think it's even better. But dont get me wrong, it's darn good. The choices of proteins and sure volume of cooking styles I've never seen before intrigued me. We ended up with:

-Thai Herb Sausage    
Roasted Thai Northern style herb sausage, served with peanut, cut ginger, sliced red onion, sliced lemon and chili

-Nuer Tod    
Fried-sun-dried beef, served with chili and rice powder sauce

-Koh Moo Yang    
Grilled slices of pork shoulder, w/chili and rice powder sauce

-Garlic Quail    
Fried Quail, served with hot sauce

-PAD PED Venison 
Stir-fried Venison with House made chili paste, Thai Eggplant Young pepper corn & Galingale

-Hoy Lai Pad Prik Pao    
Clam stir-fried with sweet chili paste and basil leaves 

-LEK TOM YUM HAENG    
Steamed Skinny Rice Noodle with ground pork, slice fish cake, plain Crispy Pork Belly serving with an idea of Dry Tom Yum Noodle

There was also a rockfish special that we had that had a similar prep to the Venison but with a green chili sauce instead of a red one. All the dishes were pretty solid but I felt like the appetizers were better than the mains. I also felt that it was not as spicy as I thought it would be. Are they starting to tone down what they're doing for American palates? We finished off with a white pistachio ice cream and sticky rice with mango. I think as the place got really crowded the waitresses would get more aggressive about clearing out stuff. In fact they would clear something while people were eating. Picking up stuff while people arent finished just seems a bit rude. For the life of me I could not communicate with one of them and every time I said something she'd hear the opposite. I will try the other locales and see how consistent they are. but because this is a high traffic area Im just not down with being rushed. 3.5 stars
author: Kim N.

description: Pretty yummy Thai food. My only complaint was that their Pad Kee Mao was not spicy at all, when it really should be. Otherwise delicious place. Get their fried tofu and garlic rice! Try to come at an off time during the week, it's get unbelievably packed on weekends.
author: Ann Marie L.

description:
What a smart move for Lers Ros Thai to open another outlet far enough away from the grittier confines of the Tenderloin to make the new one feel like a cosmopolitan reinvention of itself. It's right next to the Grove and across the street from the Hayes Valley Grill, which will most assuredly bring in the more urbane diners with their more delicate palates than the Larkin Street locale ever could. Interestingly, the menu hasn't changed to accommodate the masses, which is fine by me since I like the spicy kick that their menu provides. It should come as no surprise that the new location provides a much sleeker decor and far trendier ambient music to make it more competitive with the likes of Osha Thai among the hipster crowd.

Even though it's been open for just a month or so, the approach looks to be working. People were streaming in. Jamie W. and I came here on the early side, about 5:45PM, and were seated right away next to the window in the corner. This is a prime spot because you're not crowded against the other tables here. The first thing we ordered was the memorable $10.25 Tom Kha Kai, a coconut milk-based soup served in a Thai fire pot with chicken, lemongrass, trumpet mushrooms, and kaffir lime leaves (see photo). This is one of my favorite soups from the other location, so we were happy to be ladling such ambrosia into our little bowls. We then had a double-header of pork. The first was the $10.95 Moo Prik Khing, which was a pile of pork ribs stir-fried with house-made chili paste, red peppers, and green beans (see photo).

The second was a dish that was calling my name with the two most beautiful words in the English language, "pork belly". It was the $10.95 Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob, which consisted of chunks of stir-fried pork belly topped with crispy rinds and accompanied by sauteed basil leaves (see photo). Although the rind provided more chew than desirable for an entree of this caliber, the pork belly itself was delicious. The service was rather tentative that evening, probably because a bevy of young pretty girls have been hired to serve. Now if they could just gain some street cred from their older colleagues on Larkin, they would truly be stellar here. In the meantime, you can enjoy good, spicy Thai fare at Lers Ros Thai in a user-friendly neighborhood.

FOOD - 4 stars...did I mention they serve pork belly?
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...sleek and chic...and the restaurant doesn't look bad either
SERVICE - 3 stars...needs more confidence
TOTAL - 4 stars...spicy Thai in a comfortable setting
author: Ed U.

description: A little to greasy and very loud. Not sure if I would come back. I might just order take out if I'm really hungover.
author: Gilbert P.

description: Very good lunch combos. Servers need to be more educated on the wine list. I asked for recommendations between two types of Rose and my server had no idea. One star off for that since if you're going to charge me $10 per glass of wine then please be more knowledgeable. Ambiance and food were very good though. I'll return again :)
author: Bella L.

description: Visited here for lunch and had their combination lunch.  I ordered their kai yang and their vegetarian yellow curry  The kai yang chicken was slightly overcooked with the meat not being quite as tender or juicy as I would have liked.  The curry was by far the best...smooth, rich, and creamy!  It was fantastic with the rice. Pretty good deal though - ample food at a decent price!
author: Connie Y.

description: Amazing food. So many selections on the menu feature wild Game. Alligator, venison, wild boar, fresh line caught wild trout, duck. A fusion of things not typically associated with Thai and it was great. Highly recommended.
author: Tony G.

description: Extremely great service and the food was absolutely amazing. We ordered the beef noodle soup and the spices were absolutely divine. Will be back for sure!
author: Anthony D.

description:
Duck Larb appetizer - I loved this dish, but my counterparts may have been less enthused with the super fish saucey smell.  

Chicken Pad Thai and Yellow Curry - nice portions, solid taste.

Good wine and beverage selection. 

My only quip is that the service was REALLY slow. We had a reservation at 7 on a Friday night. Once we were seated, the server asked if we were ready to order, which we weren't, but she immediately left without asking if we wanted drinks.  We waited probably 30 minutes to even place our meal order.  We also sat at the table for another 30 minutes after we were finished with empty plates before they were cleared out.
author: Trish P.

description: The food is fantastic for the price. They don't always list all ingredients on the menu, so if you have allergies, you need to be careful and repeat your allergies a few times to the waiter or waitress. I've had a few incidents of undisclosed fish sauce and certain veggies that don't treat my stomach so well. Once you learn how to navigate the ordering process, most dishes are quite excellent.
author: Gil F.

description:
Oh my! Either I ordered the wrong food or this Lers Ros Thai just not up to par with the original location. We ordered many dishes at the other location and almost none disappointed me, but during this time, I ordered their lunch combination special with kra pow and the black pepper beef. The taste was just meh, but yes the value was pretty good for like $9.95 you can choose 2 dishes. I believe it was during lunch rush so service was non-existent almost. 

My kra pow was just whatever, pretty plain taste and my black pepper beef really taste like tons of pepper powder just poured to it. I couldn't even finish my dish, this hardly ever happened before especially I was really starving when I got there.

If I have another option, I would totally choose to the original location but now at least I know this one just have a better fancy decor, but food wise was not good enough for me to come back.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Great place to eat !  Nice staff ! Nice food !
Was recommended by a friend and i finally let them drag out to this place and left fully satisfied! The service was quick and friendly, restaurant looked nice and clean. Food was great, would definitely go again. Pad Thai is GREAT by the way!
author: Justin T.

description: So far this place is my favorite thai restaurant in San Francisco.  I've tried dine in, eating by the bar, take out, and delivery from this place.  The place is very clean and has a modern feel to the place.  I highly recommend the Nuer Pad Prik dish (a beef dish).
author: James H.

description:
I prefer the Larkin location in terms of price.  It's the same food, so it's worth going to the TL for the lower price.  But if you want some atmosphere, then this Hayes Valley location has it.  It can get loud and lively at night.

There's lots of exotic options, like frogs legs, and Thai food staples, like Pad Thai.  I only had chicken soup because my stomach was sensitive that day.  It was good, but I wish the chicken didn't come minced.  I prefer chunks of chicken, which it did have.  I'm not sure why the chicken was served in different ways..

This place is worth a try if you're in the area and all the other restaurants in the area are full.
author: Vira P.

description: Came here because they were the only place open till 11pm on a Sunday.  A person craving Thai food is in mini Heaven at this quaint establishment.  Amazing options of food.  Got the crab fried rice and asked for medium spicy. They best crab fried rice I have ever eaten!  The rice was super fluffy and it was at the perfect spice content.  They had plenty of crab meat and it all tasted scrumptious!  Definitely a great option for Thai!  Will be back for sure!
author: Maria J.

description: I went here with the intent on trying the Garlic Quail, and I was sort of disappointed.  It was hard to eat, and a lot of work for what I consider to be not a lot of meat in return.  That being said, Lers Ros still does killer Thai, and I still walked out of here feeling like I needed to be rolled home.  Overindulgence means the struggle is absolutely real when you're sitting on Muni on the way home and your squished up against a window. My husband and I had a reservation for here at 7:30 and while getting a reservation wasn't hard online, it was pretty packed by the time we left.  We ordered the Garlic Quail and Chicken Larb to share.  The chicken larb was a little too spicy for me, especially towards the bottom of the dish where the jalapenos had made it's way into the residual sauce and leftover chicken.  But, it was still delicious and I still ate it.  My husband went with his usual Pad See Ew, and I went with the Pad Woon Sen (glass noodles with shrimp, cabbage, eggs & tomatoes).  Both of us ate in silence while we devoured the plates in fronts of us, reluctantly sharing when one asked to try the other's dish.  While the Garlic Quail didn't quite pan out here, I know we left here completely (and probably too) satisfied.
author: Lisa I.

description: Food so bad...I have to be honored with the owner. If they keep all the level of food like that. They need to close their restaurant soon...I do not want to pay for this dinner too. But I paid and feel waste time and money for this restaurant
author: Vy T.

description:
On Friday, I ordered take out from this Lers Ros location (Pad c u w/beef, chicken yellow curry, papaya salad) and got terribly sick the next morning. 

It was quite a surprise, as I've ordered from here many times previously and never had a negative experience. Order from here at your own risk.
author: justin y.

description:
So, me and my buddy walk in and try to sit, and we ask the host to not seat us literally right next to the front door because it was windy as shit.  The host dude goes, "Please don't give me a hard time and sit here." Me and my buddy looked at each other and laughed, because we couldn't believe it... Anyways, we got a better table.

Ordered a fried rolls and a combo plate and all the food was legit. Fried rolls were fatty in size and stuffed pretty well. The shrimp in the papaya salad was tender and not dry, and same with the chicken. Was all really good and fast with it actually coming out from the time we ordered.

I've gone to the Mission location, and have had them for takeout before and never had any complaints. Always good.
author: Shawn B.

description:
My fav thai restaurant in the city.  Good flavors, fresh products, really spicy.  

The service is not the best, but show me a thai place where the service is great.  I don't go to thai restaurants for great service.  I expect to have to wait a long time, especially when it is busy (much like Lers Ros).  I expect orders to be forgotten and I expect them to arrive in a haphazard manner.  All you people bitching about the service need to get out of your hoity toity san francisco mindset, and realize that the reason the service is slow is because you are in a busy restaurant where the dishes all cost $10-12.  None of these servers worked at Saison or French Laundry previously.  GET OVER IT!

Ok, onto the food:

Green Curry:  exceptional!  Spicy and the perfect consistency.  I even like the eggplant that put in theirs and I hate eggplant.  They use the small green ones and they don't get all mushy.  Proteins are tender and not overcooked.

Duck Larb:  Always a winner.  Tangy and flavorful.  Not a dish I have seen at any other thai restaurant.

Pork Shoulder:  Very good.....something about it prevents it from being great though.  It is a little one note, but the pork is tender and the spicy dressing is good.  It needs something else.  A different flavor....a different texture or something.

I definitely plan to come back.  This location is nicer inside than the one in the TL.  I have only been to each location once, but the food seemed to be on par at both locations.
author: Christian C.

description: Consistently excellent--best Thai restaurant in Hayes Valley
author: Troy S.

description:
This place deserves a 5 star average rating. 

I grew up in Thailand and it was my first language and experience in food. This place is the closest I've been to authentic Thai food in the last 15 years of living in this country, across more than 10 states. The catfish filet, cashew chicken, tom kha shrimp, and everything else were absolutely incredible. 

The service was ridiculously quick on a busy Friday evening, the servers were really kind, and I'm only eating Thai food at this place from now on.
author: Akshay B.

description: We used to buy from this Lers Ros about 2-3 times a month. But since my last review in 2014, the place has gone downhill from average and three incidences in the last 6 months have led us to decide not to patronize this restaurant again, which we hate to do, because *some* of the staff are great. The 1st incident occurred 4 months ago when my friend became sick after eating her vegetable tofu dish. My dish was fine, but she was out of commission for 2 days (though not hospital bad by any means). The 2nd incident came when we ordered carry out and they got our order wrong -- we couldn't be bothered to call to change it, but the dish they gave us was $3 cheaper than the one we ordered, and was too spicy to eat. And they only gave us one rice when we asked for two orders. We let this one slide as things happen. But recently they got our order wrong again -- we asked for a mild dish with extra X and they gave us instead an extra spicy dish with *no* X at all. As we had ordered @10pm, right before closing, we weren't able to call them to tell them and have the correct food delivered. And then life got busy. Three days later I brought the order back, uneaten in its original container, with the original receipt, and asked them to give us a new correct one. We were then told that the dish couldn't be made mild (which is weird, because we had ordered it that way before several times, and which still doesn't explain not getting the extra X that we requested). They then asked if we wanted something else instead and I said sure, how about something simple like pad thai. When we went to get it, they said "$14 dollars please." And I was like "What?! Why didn't you tell us that you weren't going to replace our dish for free, *before* we wasted some 35+ minutes of our time?" She responded that it had been too many days (3) and that we should have called the same day we bought it. Fair enough, but she should have told us this decision when we first came in with the mis-fire dish and not wasted our time (and we were waiting outside in the freezing cold because there is no where to sit inside unless you are eating). Suffice it to say, we are taking our business elsewhere.
author: Kate A.

description:
Larb Moo and steamed sea bass are amazing here. highly recommended. The steamed bass will come on top a fire canister so that there is a fire to keep it warm the entire time.
