Super tender meat and love the garlic, ginger, lemongrass flavors infused in the dish. Good to share among 3 people or more. 

We also loved the papaya salad with salted eggs. The salted eggs are the ones that I used to have in China with porridge - actually went great with the papaya salad even though I was skeptical at first. 

Skip the pork rib dish (one of the special dishes) - the flavors were a bit off and there is not much meat on top of the tendons. 

The waitresses are not be the friendliest people here even though the waiter was nice. I called for a reservation the same day and they confirmed it on the phone. When I showed up, they couldn't find the reservation and said that I couldn't get the reservation for that night if I called on the same day - which is a complete lie. On top of that, they asked for a confirmation number (which is never provided when one calls for a restaurant reservation!) And it wasn't until that I showed them the restaurant number I called that day (which they requested), they begrudgingly seated me. No apology for not messing up my reservation. Given the attitude here, maybe best to do the reservation online.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Great, quick service. Big menu. Delicious food. Not too pricey either which is good for the neighborhood. They turn tables quickly so if you are looking for a place to eat, but don't have a reservation it's a solid option
author: Shawn T.

description: Issan Thai cuisine pretty unique in SF including frog legs, quail, and other interesting and delicious dishes in addition to more typical Thai dishes like several versions of som tom.
author: Stuart G.

description: More like 3.5 stars but I just wasn't amazed by this place. The food is expensive for Thai, and rice is not included in the $12-13 for an entree, which I have a problem with since they act like it is l. Something I still have to learn about CA, I guess, is that nothing is ever included for free. I ordered the pra ram pak, which is tofu and veggies in a peanut sauce. The sauce was flavorful, but they did not get all the water out of the veggies so it watered down the saucepan the plate. Rookie mistake IMO. The servers were not particularly friendly and it's not like it was particularly busy on a weekday at 5:30 pm. Just eh, maybe the other locations are better.
author: Cara R.

description:
What I ate: Duck larb, boar curry, garlic frog legs, garlic ginger rice, Thai tea
Visit date: April 11, 2012
First time? Yes.

Unleash your exotic food eating side at Lers Ros! We started off with duck larb. Two words: Oh yes. The spices blended beautifully-- a lovely mix of sweet, sour and salty flavors. The duck was tender, but I wasn't a big fan of duck fat. 

The garlic frog is just like baby chicken wings. Beware of tiny bones. They serve it with a sweet-sour sauce and top it with fried garlic...a lot of it. I love me some fried garlic!!!

The boar curry. Eh. The boar meat was ok. I had never had boar before; I like to describe it as a cross between cow and pig. They serve their boar with the tendon-y parts which I'm not a big fan of (too much chewing!). If you like your meat, don't get the boar curry. What I did like about the dish was the heat factor!

The garlic ginger rice was delicious! I don't like ginger chunks (just a big fan of the ginger flavor), but it was easy to pull them off. Think garlic fried rice with an extra kick.

You should also know that Lers Ros does it spicy and they don't warn you. That's alright by me. ;) Just wash it down with a perfectly brewed and mixed Thai iced tea.
author: Erin G.

description:
Get the Tom Yum - aka coconut curry soup. I don't even like curry, but could guzzle down an entire serving of this Thai recipe in one sitting. 

By far, my favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Are. Two locations: one in the TL and the other in Hayes Valley. The latter is a little less ghetto, but hey, the grittiness of the Tenderloin is kind of why I like Lers Ros. 

Ignore the random menu misspellings ("served in a flamming hot pot"), you'll not regret any menu decision made. Honestly, the more errors means the food is going to be that much better... That's a personal theory, not a fact.
author: Abby S.

description:
Overall rating: 3.5 stars (The Thai food is actually very good, but some of the dishes are too creamy / sweet for my liking).

I've been here twice now, and in general it is yummy Thai food and a solid choice for dinner. 

However, I'm getting pickier with my Thai food and feel that the Pad Thai was a little too sweet, and the green curry was too thick (had too much coconut milk). It was delicious but felt a little too sweet and creamy for my liking.
author: Lillian C.

description: Food is not bad but lousy service.  Servers never smile and are not friendly at all.  Perhaps they are not paid well.  And when I said the beef was too tough in the soup noodles I ordered, the waitress said she could order a new one for me but would charge me.  I said forget it.  Last time coming here!
author: Portia C.

description: I went with my friend for lunch today and found in my Pad Thai someone's nail.  Kitchen staff clipping their nail in the kitchen?
author: Lorna N.

description:
Food 3.5
Overall 3.0

Mission Accomplished.  We came, We saw, We ate.  The duck larb as listed on 7x7SF Magazine's 100 things to eat before you die in 2012 list.

Duck cut up and stir fried with various ingredients. Very spicy with a slight sweetness after taste.  Served with lettuce cups.  Scoop some duck into a lettuce cup.  We enjoyed it.  But we have to wonder - why did they also give us the lettuce core?  Isn't that usually tossed out?  Did they run out of lettuce leafs?

The waitstaff suggested the duck larb first to be followed by our entrees.  We ordered one of the specials = stir fried alligator and pad thai noodles with shrimp.

The alligator dish was very spicy in red curry sauce. To me it tasted like chicken thighs, but hubby said it tasted like a cross between pork and beef. Go figure. Great pad thai noodles.  Fresh and good size prawns.

We finished with the sticky rice and durian.  If you've never had durian, it's a tropical fruit.  They cook it down until it's very gooey.  But the smell. Pungent.  An acquired taste for sure.

I had a Thai iced tea.  Nice.

Pros - good Thai food.  Flavors very distinct.  Service quick.  Prices very reasonable with exception of the gator which was $19.95 for an average size dish.

Cons - 
*unless you score one of the tables by the window or against the wall (which we didn't even though we were there at 6pm.  They were unoccupied, but wait station formula), you might feel very squished. In addition, there are two rows of tables in the middle of the restaurant.  They sat us in a row of three tables that sat two people each. Tables are so close together that our platters actually touched the next table and vice versa. Literally you're on top of the next table.
*very noisy. Difficult to carry a conversation.
*tables way too small.  If you order more than two dishes, you better eat fast; else, they'll bring it and you've got to squeeze it in.
*service is quick cuz they want your table. No conversation.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I prefer the Lers Ros on Larkin but this Hayes Valley location does serve similar, delicious food. Some of my favorites:

- the veggie tom yum soup - it includes huge mushrooms and both Lers Ros have the best tom yum I've had ANYWHERE
- the spicy tofu - not fried and pure deliciousness
- the green curry (and I'd guess the other curries are great too!)
- and even the simple jasmine brown rice is great!

Reasons why I prefer the other location:

- there are more tables and it's not as crowded
- you can almost always walk in to the location on Larkin without a reservation - here is gets busy!
- the wine list is better and less expensive at the Larkin location
- they have delicious small candies on your way out in the other location but sadly not here
author: Meghan P.

description:
The food here is awesome!  Great flavors, good price points considering the bougie location and the nice-ish environment, extensive menu.  We came here for dinner the other night and ordered this crispy chicken with garlic rice dish, the duck noodle soup, and the pad see ew.  I loved that crispy chicken dish - probably the best of the night. Yum! 

My only gripe was the service.  I'm generally not picky when it comes to service, but one of my pet peeves is when people in particular jobs are poorly trained or just plain bad at their main functions.  Customer service people who are rude; service workers who forget your orders; administrative folks who don't answer emails promptly, etc.  In fact, I actually wasn't going to review this place, but the service bothered me in such a way that I felt compelled to shed some light on this and hopefully the staff will read it and then properly correct the issue.  

So here's the problem: The waitresses started taking away our dishes even before we were done, which struck me as really odd and abnormal.  We were eating family style, and we each had our individual plates, but when this one waitress noticed that our own plates were empty, she'd come by and take them away! And then, near the end of our meal, when we still had food on some of the shared plates, she came by and took those plates away, stacking them on top of each other so that it would've been awkward for us to ask her to stop.  There was enough food left on those plates to take home, and I again found it strange that she just came and took all the leftover food away without even asking us if we wanted to take the food home.  

The service and, in particular, the behavior of that one particular waitress bothered me so much that I'm taking away TWO stars for that.  So, the food actually gets 5 stars - it's fantastic.  The service was just so strange that it made me wonder if she was properly trained to be a waitress because I feel like it's a pretty standard (and expected!) thing to ask your patrons if 1) they're done eating before you take away their plates and 2) if they want to take home any (especially a substantial amount!) of the leftover food.  

Service aside, you should still come here.  A VERY tasty meal, I was absolutely impressed.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I can say with confidence that this is my favorite Thai restaurant. 

+ The food is consistently delicious and tasty. My mom spoke with a waitress and she let us know that the chefs are Thai so the flavors and ingredients are authentic! 
+ Amazing lunch special menu. Come between the lunch hours (11am-4pm) and get ready to fill up your tummy with tons of food. A rice plate with two specials is only $9.75! So cheap and you will leave with leftovers too! I suggest getting their BBQ chicken served with a sweet and spicy sauce. You basically get a quarter of the chicken.
+ The DUCK LARB! One of the reasons why I am constantly craving Lers Ros. It has the perfect balance of tangy and savory! The flavors are seriously addicting. It is a MUST TRY! 

- Come prepared for bad service. The waiters aren't very attentive and not the most friendly!
author: Britney L.

description:
If you can't handle spicy, make sure you let them know.

I asked for everything to be mild and everything came out really spicy for me. Not the usual mild that I'm used to, like Osha.

We had:
-Duck salad. Was very good and flavorful but like I said, very spicy.
-Pork belly. Their "crispy" is hard so it was hard and spicy, not a pleasant to eat dish.
-Yellow chicken curry. It was a typical yellow curry that was super spicy to me.

Staff was nice and the space was modern and clean.

I would come back but I would definitely order with caution.
author: Andy W.

description: The food was really good and you get large portions! My only dislike was that I really don't like tofu and you cannot substitute for lunch combos!
author: A M.

description:
Having been a fan of Lers Ros- Tenderloin for years, I have been spending lots of time lately in Hayes Valley, so Lers Ros- Hayes Valley has become my new thai joint.  Their stir fried pork belly with rinds has always been exceptional in my book (albeit, a bit overpriced.)  I decided to be adventurous one afternoon and searched through their yelp page for a thai dish recommendation that I had not yet tried.  I settled on a dish called 'lek tom yum haeng'- steamed sticky rice noodle with ground pork, sliced fish cake, crispy pork belly, and peanuts.  It was absolutely DELICIOUS and this is my new go to for thai noodles now.  I usually go for pad thai, rad na, or pad see ew, but these noodles were so simple, fresh, and best yet- not heavy or oily.  It doesn't look like anything special by appearance, but don't be fooled- they pack a mean punch of flavor and have easily become my new favorite dish at Lers Ros!

4 stars because the service tends to be slow and lacking at rush hour.
author: Clarissa P.

description: i'm peeved. the pad se eew literally made me say "ew" OKKURRRR. we also missed an order cause they just never brought it. the tofu was also kinda dry, it was dry like your vajoina OKKUURRRR. the guy got lost on the way and we got our food two hour hours later OKKUURRRRR.
author: Xavier L.

description: Lots of delicious vegetarian options, cute interior and fast service. They also have whole coconuts! Beware that this place gets really crowded though.
author: Katie P.

description:
When Lers Ros is good it's really good. I wish instead of listing like a hundred different dishes on the menu to appeal to everyone that they would just list the stuff they're really good at. Otherwise it's hit or miss trying to order here.

This last time I came here with a friend with specific recommendations - which were all good - but of course I forgot already. So this time we got the fried rice with fried chicken (good but not interesting), spicy pork spareribs (okay), spicy chicken (okay) and pad thai (okay). I was really disappointed in the pad thai. I'm not sure why 7x7 calls it the standard by which all pad thai should be measured. To my tastebuds it was still too sweet.

By far the best dish was the duck larb we ordered as an appetizer. Juicy pieces of duck with crisp skin in a spicy sour sauce. Wow. 5 stars for that dish.

Also nice that the kitchen is open until 11 PM. Makes this the perfect after symphony/ballet/etc place to grab a bite to eat.
author: Jean K.

description: Horrible customer service. Refused to honor our reservation even though I showed them my email confirmation (see photo). After "checking their system" they claimed to have no record of the reservation and refused to seat us. I get that mistakes happen, especially when computer systems are involved, but their failure to take responsibility for the error and attempt to accommodate is abhorrent. I asked to speak to a manager and they said he wasn't there. What a horrible way to alienate customers.
author: Christy S.

description: Just went to this place for the first time a couple of weeks ago, and its hard to believe that the reviews are so low. They had amazing food (we had chicken satay, pad thai, and a curry) and a great ambiance. The service wasn't the friendliest (hence the 4 and not 5 star review). Overall, we had a great dinner and would recommend this place if you're craving thai.
author: Maggie M.

description:
only gave 1 star. Wanted to give no stars since we were unable to attend. We had tickets to the opera and a confirmed reservation. See email header 

From:  Lers Ros Hayes Valley noreply@bookatable.com
 Subject:  Reservation confirmed (QYEDFTEK): Table for 2 for Dinner at Lers Ros Hayes Valley 1 November 2014 - at 6:00 PM





i was running a bit late due to traffic and out of courtesy called to let Lers Ros know. Imagine my horror when they said they had no record of my reservation and could not take a party of 2. Ever try and dine near the Opera or SF Symphony without a reservation when a performance is scheduled that evening. Well both the Opera and Symphony had performances that evening. So we ended up not having any dinner. I emailed Lers Ros and they did not have the courtesy to reply.
author: fred t.

description:
VEGETARIANS BEWARE! THESE PEOPLE LIE ABOUT WHAT IS IN THE DISH.
Last night was may be my 50th time to Lers ros and I couldn't have been disappointed more. I am a vegetarian and having fish sauce is against my religion. In their vegetarian menu they not only have Red curry or green curry in it but to my shock they add fish sauce to it. I have a habit of asking every time I order and mentioning no fish sauce, no meat etc. When i asked yesterday the waitress who served me told there i already fish sauce in it. So i told her that I order it every time and they say they make it without it. She then told me "No there is fish sauce in it and they put it in at the time of preparing the curry. And waiters take order and LIE about it that there is no fish sauce" Can you believe it that a place to eat lies about what they are serving to you.
author: Manya D.

description: I was appalled at the customer service in this place. The waiter at the door was extremely rude.  This was the WORST dining experience of my life.
author: MissPancake L.

description: Very bad attitude, the guy waiter was so rude we almost walked out! The place was pretty empty considering it was the dinner time rush, probably other customers are already aware of this unfriendly staff..
author: DVolt B.

description:
Ordered just two dishes and both were beyond disappointing.

Rad Nah  
House secret gravy sauce and marinated pork topping on the seasoned flat noodle. 

The house secret gravy, the most plentiful ingredient in the dish was basically a flavorless gooey corn starch glop. There were a few pieces of pork slices hidden within and very few noodles which were for all practical purposes, and tasted just like Chinese Chow Fun. Oh and some Bok Choi mixed in. It was unappetizing in looks and not special at all in flavor. I wonder what the secret is?

BEEF PAD PRIK THAI HAI 
Stir-fried Top sirloin Beef with Thai Black peppers, Yellow & Green Onions

The waitress said the beef was "tender slices". What is was consisted of thick large slices of stringy and too tough almost to cut let alone chew beef which I can not believe was Top Sirloin.

The flavor profiles of both of these dishes was very un-Thai like compared to any Thai cuisine I have ever had.

The two dishes with tax and tip came to $30. Not at all worth the price.
author: Steven B.

description:
One of the things I love about San Francisco, is that no matter what your day holds, or where you wander in the city you are never more than a few paw prints away from good food. Today's find came from Hayes Valley while I was shopping at Nancy Boy for some bath products. Their shampoo does wonders for my untamed fur...but I digress, this blog is about food.

I was in the mood for something warm and satisfying, so I stopped in at Lers Ros Thai. It was my first time visiting so I didn't know what to expect. I'm so glad I did, I think I've found my new go to Thai place. And there is a location on 16th street just a few blocks from where my doggy palace is located.

I wanted to try a couple of dishes, so I ordered the vegetarian Pad Thai and the Pra Ram Pak, a peanut curry dish with vegetables. And for those vegetarians out there, they have an amazing list to choose from, so dig in. 

The Pad Thai was warm, with a sweet smokiness that I've never experienced before with this dish. The vegetables were cooked to perfection, tender yet still slightly crisp. They were flavorful and fresh. 

The Pra Ram Pak, was a delicious surprise. Served with white or brown steamed rice, it was tofu and mixed vegetables in this slightly spicy, peanut curry sauce that was out of this world. I was licked my paws trying to get the last drop. It was crazy good.

So if you are in Hayes Valley, the Mission, or the Mid-Market area of the city, and you're in the mood for really good Thai food. Stop by. This place has an extensive menu. I can't imagine anyone not being able to find something here that suites their taste or dietary requirements. 

My rating...4 Paws

With love from my dog bowl to yours....Happy eating.
Shatasdogbowl.
author: DJ S.

description:
Well, the service is fine, but the food wasn't my taste even though I normally enjoy eating Thai food.

OMG here it comes... Just 30 minutes after eating at this restaurant my stomach felt funny and it sounded like I have swallowed a singing frog.
author: Toke K.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and I love their variety of plates for different tastes!
I'm vegan but my boyfriend is not! This has options for the both of us. 
The plates are big! So come hungry!
author: Antonia R.

description:
Family Vacation Part XIV

Title: This goes out to World of Warcraft, Server Nazgrel, The Riddle of Steel (awesome Guild), and my good buddy Sunspot!

While in San Francisco I reached out to my old guild mate that used to play World of Warcraft. We both had retired from it but kept in touch (occasionally) on facebook. Once I reached San Francisco I asked him what was a good place to eat here and he said "What!? You are here??? We have to meet up for lunch!!" I agreed and he decided on this place. 

Lers Ros Thai is considered one of the top places to eat Thai food in San Francisco. At least that is what my friend said. I recall that it appeared out of place on the block it was on (which is normal for San Francisco) and the interior design was a sight to see. You will get distracted by the see through chairs, the illumination, and the paintings. Even the kids were impressed. (that is saying something, because they usually don't notice anything... especially their surroundings)

I haven't actually seen this friend in person. I have only talked to him through World of Warcraft and seen pictures of him on Facebook. Our Guild though was like family so it was like meeting an old friend. After that was taken care of we checked out the menu. Ordered and ate. 

Chicken Satay - grilled chicken skewers withe peanut sauce. These were yummy. I think all things should have peanut sauce. I am so glad I was born before peanut alleries were invented.... yep, i said it!

Kang Karee - Yellow Curry. This was the best curry dish I have had anywhere. I still have nightmares of this delicious yellow curry. Nightmares of not tasting it again. 

Pan Fried noodles - I don't remember which one. It was good though. Hard to mess up french fries and noodles. 

We ordered a few other things that I don't remember but everything was good. I was so stuff after this that I couldn't eat anything else for the rest of the day. Next time I would try alligator though. I don't think I saw this dish when I was there. 

It was nice catching up with a Warcraft friend. If he ever visit Riverside it will be hard to pick a place to top Lers Ros Thai.
author: Patrick M.

description: Food was good, service was good, atmosphere was nice, location was great (other than the usual SF parking).
author: Devin P.

description:
Lers Ros had a booth with a dozen cute guys/gals pumping out thai eats. no lines cuz instant service.

locale: SF street food fest 2012
eats: larb kai (3,small)
-ground pork in a vinegar sauce with cabbage
-excellent.semisour taste of thai classic.

thai notes:
-observed food prepped on site in the rear.
author: Victor G.

description:
BE AWARE! THESE PEOPLE LIE ABOUT WHAT IS IN THE DISH.

The food is not too bad, but the service is absolutely more than horrible. I have to give them one star since there is no star option, however, I doubt they deserve any star at all. 

I'm allergic to some food condiment and made it clear to them from the beginning. When I get the food, I suspect there is allergic condiment there and ask explicitly again, and they promised that the food does not have it. I trusted them and went ahead with the food, I vomited immediately with the food. Then, they admitted that the food has the condiment. 

Will never try or trust again for the second time .
author: Zhiyong X.

description: Went here because it has vegan options (for my spouse). The food tasted freshly prepared and delicious. I had a yellow curry chicken, spouse vegan Pad Thai. But the menu offers many interesting choices I haven't seen other places, so we'll definitely be back to try some of them. Spouse is always happy when the servers understand what 'vegan' means without  explanation, and this place fit the bill!
author: D. R. G.

description:
Good, standard Thai food. I wouldn't mind going back, but it didn't stand out all that much. They have enormous portions and a menu that looks like you'll always be able to try something new, which is quite nice. I was very fond of their chicken satay, which I order at every Thai restaurant; that peanut sauce was delicious! I think I may have offended the chefs, because I started slathering the peanut sauce over my main dish of chicken and basil as well...not because it wasn't flavorful, but because peanut sauce is damn good.

The place is decorated quite nicely and the service was good. Not much to say otherwise, but it's a good place to grab a bite if you don't want to wait in a super long line at the other Hayes restaurants.
author: Robbin A.

description: I first came here for their lunch specials which were particularly affordable for a large amount of food with a pleasant taste. I think this place has a nice setting and one of the more affordable restaurants in the area, portion size are generous depending on what you order. The curry and pad thai is simple, if you're looking for very authentic food then it may not be your place. Could be spicier but I would come back again.
author: Ellie A.

description: Very good and inexpensive lunch. My sister and I both ordered the two-item lunch special and we were quite happy with our selections. She had the yellow curry tofu with vegetables and I had the garlic pork with garlic spinach. Service was very good from a number of staff members. Our waiter was very nice although not at all knowledgeable about their wines.
author: M F.

description:
It may be slightly overrated, but it's hard to beat this place when it comes to trusty, dependable thai food.

My usual order consists of Yellow or green curry - both are amazing here, although i am partial to the yellow curry.  Their basil thai minced chicken (extra spicy) is so incredible here - probably one of my favorite dishes.  It's simple but yet so flavorful.  For a noodle dish, my usual go to h is the pad see ew.  I've had their Pad thai which is great but they make a mean pad see ew.

There's usually a wait, so I prefer to do takeout or delivery from here, usually picking up smitten on the way home for dessert.
author: Steve A.

description:
The wife and I went to see a showing at the Nourse, and after reviewing some of the menus in the area, decided to check out Lers Ros - afterall, you can almost never go wrong with Thai!

We sat at the bar, as (as is typical for SF) there weren't a lot of tables, and they were full.  We ordered Singha's while we reviewed the menu.  We both noticed something rather interesting...EVERY single employee was a "youngish" Thai girl.  Interesting.  Only in SF, I guess.

I decided on my fav dish, Gang Karee Gai (yellow curry....mmmmMMMmmm), while the wife ordered a garlic prawn dish (as, again, one can NEVER go wrong with garlic).  We also ordered a side of white rice to share.

Here's where it went downhill, unfortunately.  They actually brought out the wife's dish VERY quickly, and the waitress served us both rice.  Then, we waited.  And waited.  And waited.  Oh....and then we waited.  Seriously....almost 10 minutes later, they served my (rather simple) curry.  My rice was still warm, or course (NOT).

But, alas, it got worse.  While the wife's prawn dish was good, the yellow curry was, quite simply, the worst I've ever had.  The cook, for whatever reason, simply smothered the curry with onion.  Not ever had onion in my yellow curry before (and much of my curry consumption takes place in Thailand, so I kinda "get" what goes in it), but I wouldn't have minded.  But there was more onion than potato (and this is essentially a potato curry), and the curry was just ruined.

So on the up side, easy to get in, good location, good cold Singhas.  On the downside, the worst yellow curry on the planet.  So...um....read other reviews and order something else.
author: Bill O.

description:
My wife and I were visiting from Florida and had a craving for Tai. After looking at yelp we decided to give the place a try and we were very pleased. 

We were right in between a rush so did not have to wait very long (5 min, but could see how it could be a long time during a rush). 

Dinner came very quick but tasted fresh and flavorful. Service as a little slow getting to us but how busy they were I think they well. 

Overall, we were very please and glad we have them a try.
author: John P.

description: On the fence about this one... On one hand I love lers ros thai in the TL and jumped at the opportunity to join some friends at the new, definitely safer, location in Hayes. On the other hand, the food just did not taste the same here. I'm not sure if it's the adrenaline of walking through the TL that makes the other one better- who knows? The service was great and being able to make reservations via yelp or opentable makes life even easier. I'll definitely be back to either location.
author: Leina K.

description:
Very oily and taste wasn't great either.
We ordered chicken pad kee mow and spicy tofu.
author: Karthik P.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Lers Ros in the tenderloin and have been curious abt the food here for a while. 

Disappointed to note that everything I tried here is over salted and lacks the great flavor that is signature to the tenderloin location.

- Tom kha Kai - pot was not flaming when it came to the table. Tiny detail but adds to the drama. Very salty and way too tangy. Pretty undrinkable

- shrimp paste fried rice- terrible. Extremely salty but lacks the unctuous -ness of shrimp paste in the dish. I had to stop eating it and pack it home in the hopes of adding more brown rice to cut the extreme saltiness 

This location's dishes doesn't even taste anything like the tenderloin location. 

PASS
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Walked in on a Monday night and had no problem being seated right away for a party of 2.  We started with the Kra Duk Moo Tod (fried spareribs) that were really disappointing.  Very tiny pieces that were mostly all bone and fried spices.  I would not order that again.  For my main course, I ordered the Yum Pla Muk (Spicy salad with boiled calamari) because I had partially been in the mood for sushi but lost that battle with a hungry man.. The salad was good and perfectly spicy.  I ended up wrapping pieces in the lettuce head on the side and eating them like rolls.  I tried the Pad Thai as well and that was pretty good.  

Not a bad Thai place to sit down and eat at if you don't want to just grab take out.  Reasonably priced.  Nothing special and not terrible.
author: Raina D.

description:
My favorite ambiance out of the three locations of Lers Ros. Super friendly service, accommodating of our big group. 

Pad siew - standard, good
Yellow chicken curry - good
Duck larb - good
Boat noodles - not as flavorful as I like. Noodles were a bit too mushy for my tastes
Papaya salad - good but very spicy
Soup with seafood - okay but not exceptional
Chicken satay and thai curry puff - tasty 

I would definitely stop in again.
author: Melinda C.

description:
I came here for lunch the other day. I had the Tom Yum soup and their lunch special (9.95), which consists of salad, 2 sides and rice. 
For my sides I had the green curry and minced pork with garlic. The green curry was tasty and had a significant kick to it. The minced pork was amazing... it had great flavor and was very tender.

The portions are decent in size. I had a hard time finishing my dish - maybe I was having an off day. If you are looking for a restaurant were you will be holding conversations. You may want to seek an alternate choice. It can get pretty loud. The restaurant has foam on the ceiling, which I'm guessing is to try and help with that issue.

Some of the staff members are more abrasive then others. If your one for a high level serve this may not be your spot.
author: Kristina S.

description:
We used to order delivery from the tenderloin location, but can now walk and get takeout in Hayes Valley. The food might not be quite up to the tenderloin location standards, but it's still pretty solid Thai food for SF.

We have had so many meals from this place with our most recent two consisting of 
spicy pork larb salad, beef with spinach and peanut sauce, pork shoulder salad, pad kee mao, and green curry.

Hands down Lers Ros has some of the best green curry in city. It is always consistently creamy, flavorful, and quite spicy (we're definite fans). 

As for everything else, it can range from just okay to pretty good. We've had mixed results ordering the various salad entrees from the menu. Generally, the salad meat tends to be quite fatty (ie pork shoulder or duck) and fairly unappetizing. On the other hand, we generally love the mix of lime juice and fish sauce that's used as the salad dressing. Salads here do not tend to be very spicy. The pad kee mao was decent as well. It's hard to measure up to Marnee Thai's pad kee mao (best in the city) and this one from Lers Ros was not much a competitor. It'd good thai-style noodle, but comparatively, lacked the spice, complex flavors, and touch of sweetness that Marnee does so well.

Overall, our go to spot for Thai takeout.
author: Amy D.

description:
The food was okay, not exemplary as one may expect from these reviews. We went for lunch and the pad thai was good the curry was okay, the Tam Kha Ghi was terribly sour, oily and oddly flavorless other than that. It was beyond obvious the waitress didn't want to be there and did not want to be helpful at all - we're not demanding people but NAPKINS would have been nice for a $100+ LUNCH for two adults -  and one child who only ordered sticky rice.   I felt a bit sick after eating the food - I think I maybe had allergies to some of the ingredients.......

OMG!!!!
FOLLOW UP an hour after writing my review and some research: Now I'm freaked out!  I just discovered this place was shut down by health inspectors twice and when we were there LESS than TWO weeks ago from today I had DIRTY silverware and plates and blew it off!!!  http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2013/11/08/lers-ros-in-hayes-valley-shut-down-by-health-department/

Do not EAT HERE! YOU WILL BE SICK!  Maybe I'm allergic to roaches - ewh! I'm so sickened by the prospect.......
author: Sabrina B.

description: Pretty authentic flavor and good variety of dishes Way over priced and portions where a bit on the skimpy side so the value isn't great. If it's busy the kitchen gets backed up and impossible to get a table without a reservation.
author: robbie l.

description:
i've walked past this place a bunch of times on my way to grove or smitten, and i kept telling myself to try it - well, i finally did!

this restaurant is usually very busy when i go by, but since i went during off-hours lunch (around 2pm) it wasn't too bad. the decor really nice and modern with the clear plastic chairs. the staff are friendly and efficient - the server i had didn't speak perfect English, but I was still able to understand her with not too many confusion issues.

The food was great. I had the green coconut curry with chicken and my boyfriend tried one of the daily specials - shrimp paste fried rice. Both meals were really good and were served in generous portions and nice presentation for the price. I asked for medium spiciness on the curry, but even medium seemed to be a bit much for me since their scale of spiciness seems to be on the higher end lol

All in all, good place, and I'd definitely go back again.
author: Bianca C.

description:
I love this place. Sure, they aren't the friendliest staff, and they might make you sit at the bar when you come in to eat alone, but the food is fantastic -- some of the best Thai food I've had in SF by far (and I LOVE Thai food). 

I particularly love the yellow curry (with tofu!) and vegan Pad see-ew. Everything is fresh and feels fancy. I usually can't finish everything in one go, so I take the rest home and it becomes the gift that keeps on giving.
author: Amber G.

description:
Thai herbal sausage was disgusting. It smelled like food that had not been refrigerated properly.
Papaya salad with crab was good.
Yum Koh Moo Yang was ok. I like it better at Sai jai thai because it has a smoked smell.
Service was ok but not good. There were so many servers but a lack of service.
author: Nat W.

description:
Wait staff was a bit perfunctory as we were a small party.  They were half empty, you think they'd have been more glad to see us.
Portions are very small.  Special prawn with asparagus - I love asparagus! - but dismayed to find it is only the asparagus lower stalk, not the tips.  Small portions, high price, probably won't be a regular here.  But it was tasty.
author: F C.

description:
Came in for a solo lunch yesterday. The staff worked to get me a seat quickly which I appreciated. Slick interior with nice modern touches around and about.

Server did not seem happy to be working at all. Bad sign. I know a job can be shitty sometimes but if you work in the service industry (which I have) you just got to suck it up and put on a smile. When she poured my beer for me, she did so way too quickly and the foam started to come out of the glass and all over the table. Of course she was split as soon as she put the glass on the table and didn't see the mess she made. Bummer.

I ordered the lunch combo with chicken and cashews and a red curry with pork. The chicken didn't have any cashews whatsoever. Another bummer. However, the red curry was exceptional and made up for the let down of the previous dish.

Maybe I'd come back with a friend to try out some other dishes but after this experience I won't be in a rush to come back.
author: Art O.

description: Decided to get OSHA for lunch one day, but the Dreamforce conference caused traffic jams all around downtown (I know, there are OSHAs on Union and on Mission too.. why we didn't go there? I don't kow). We ended up coming here because I've tried the one on Larkin once and thought it was pretty decent. I saw the chicken over coconut rice and it looked pretty good in pictures, but what I got tasted like old chicken that was microwaved before being served. The skin was rubbery and the meat was pretty dry. Not to mention, the house salad that they served as a freebie app was disgusting. It had a weird coconut flavored syrup-y taste to it, tossed with some shredded lettuce. Maybe they give you that to trick you into thinking the entree tastes better? Meh.
author: Helen Z.

description:
Came here for lunch with friends twice. The 1st time we thought the waiter was just had a bad day, so we tried to forget about his BAD & COLD ATTITUDE and LONG FACE. 

After a couple of months, we thought to give it one more try. OMG. 
He did not even bother to say anything. We stood near the doors and he just pointed out where to sit with a long face ( I mean really long. Looks like you owe him one million dollars). Not even a word. Then he threw the menus to the table, we said thank you. No words back, just turned and left. My friends wanted to leave immediately. But I insisted to stay to check him how he works with this kind of attitude. 
Felt so bad for ourselves and him. If he is so unhappy working there, he should leave. He is ruining the business. 

The lunch special is not bad though (if it's without the waiter's long face).
author: Bruce T.

description:
This is the new and pretty younger sister to the older, original location in the TL.  It's a welcome addition to the dining scene in Hayes Valley.

Given the level of spiciness and they flavors in the dishes, I would guess that they are staying true to their roots, which is fine by me.  However, if are not a fan of Thai chili peppers, choose wisely from the menu.  This is not a place with tiny chili peppers on the menu indicating the level of heat in each dish.  Assume that most, if not all, if the dishes have some level of heat.

The green papaya salad is quite refreshing, but really spicy!  I've tried it plain and with shrimp and both are good.  The pork belly  dish, Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob, is delicious and comes stir fried with basil in a nice sauce.  If you are a fan of the Chinese roast pork with crispy skin, this is your dish.  The Beef Pad Prik Thai was tasty and came with a sweet, peppery sauce; the beef was on the chewy side though.  The Prawns Asparagus came with a slightly spicy garlic sauce and is something I would recommend.

The only dish that I found disappointing was the Kaeng Som Koong Pak Ruam Soup - although this tasted good, there were only four pieces of shrimp, a lot of cabbage and was mostly broth.

Service is just okay but could use some improvement.  One time they lost my reservation; I had called two weeks prior and even repeated all the details to the person on the phone to confirm but when I walked in my name was not to be found on the list.  Luckily, tables were available.   They have a habit of clearing our dishes before we were done eating.  Yes, I understand for the need to turnover the table, but there was still uneaten food on the plates.  On all of my visit our servers have spilled food (onto the floor) while collecting our plates.  On time it was the soup, another time it was a sauce.  I found some of the waitresses friendly and more helpful than others.  On a positive note, they constantly came by to refill our water glasses, which was much appreciated given how spicy some dishes can be!  They also met our requests immediately.

The other issue I have with this restaurant is the noise level.  I think it would be quieter to eat at one of their outdoor tables than inside.  The decor is modern and sleek, but the hard edges do make sounds bounce.  Even 1/3 filled the noise level can get pretty high!  

Overall, the food is worth making a visit, but I wonder if the overall experience would be better at their other older, more established location.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I remember when Hayes Valley was a dump. Well, it's still a dump in parts but has come a long ways in most respects. A nice place for a walk nowadays. 

While ambling through the neighborhood we chanced on Lers Ros and gave it a try. It was very good and so we've been back several times since.

Pretty good Thai food all around. The crispy catfish is the bomb - really tasty, particularly when washed down with a beer. I can also recommend the sweet rice and mango for desert. Really special.

Service can be a bit iffy at times and it can get crowded. Last time we had a waiter with a serious attitude. Maybe here boyfriend just immigrated to the Islamic State or something. But all in all the food compensates for that occasional lack.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Came here on a recommendation by a friend. Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table since its a pretty small space and it was busy. The decor is really modern and you can tell that it was either newly renovated or a pretty new space. 

(1) Moo Phing: it was basically like a pork satay and it came with a sweet soy sauce with a little bit of vinegar in it so it was a bit tangy. The sauce tasted really good with the pork but I found the pork to be a little too stringy and tough, and not that flavorful.

(2) Pad Kee Mao: Very good flavor in this dish, pretty typical of most thai restaurants and just a little bit spicy, but i found this dish to be quite greasy.

(3) Chicken Curry: Nothing too special. It tasted good but not overwhelmingly so. It came with slices of chicken, sliced onions and chunks of carrots. It was a decent sized portion.

(4) two bowls of the ginger/garlic rice: i always order this whenever eating thai food so this is a must to go with the curry! Tasted good. 

In general this restaurant was good, but not outstanding. Since it is in Hayes Valley and it has beautiful decor, they do get away with charging a little more than your standard Thai restaurant. I did enjoy this meal, but I found that as I kept eating, the food just felt more greasy and it got less and less enjoyable. Good to try this once but dont think I'll come back again! There was nothing wrong with it, but also nothing special about it either.
author: Isabella L.

description:
3.5 stars.

Ooh, a nice Thai restaurant with a more authentic menu that tastes a bit more like Thailand.

We stop by here for a quick lunch. Service was a bit sparse, but ah well, it happens. We ordered the curry puffs and the duck larb (salad). The curry puffs were fluffy and delicious with the satay sauce, and the mister wouldn't stop praising it. The duck larb? Well, if you eat it on its own, I think it was a bit over seasoned, with too much sourness (lime juice?). However, eaten with the lettuce like you eat any lettuce cup, and it tastes just right.

It seems to be pretty solid, and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere (during lunch when there aren't many people). Definitely gonna stop by again.
author: Alice C.

description:
My friend and I had lunch at Lers Ros Thai after walking over from the Embarcadero.  When we arrived there was only one group eating, so we got our pick of tables.  

We ordered Pad Thai and the Lek Tom Yum Haeng.  It's very clear all the ingredients are fresh here.  The Pad Thai came with a side of sprouts, which were nice and crunchy.  The Lek Tom Yum Haeng was definitely the highlight of the meal.  The fish cake and the ground pork were really good, but what really impressed our palates was the crispy pork belly.  It was fantastic!  I thought I was eating roast pig.  

The only down side was the service, or lack of thereof.  After taking our order, we never saw our server again until she brought us our check.  Someone else brought our food and took our plates.  I really wanted my water glass refilled at least once.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
DUDE $9.75 for two items and a house salad for lunch. YAASSSS!
Their red and yellow curry is my fav. I also like the basil chicken. with brown rice. my co-worker took me here for lunch and I will most def. come back. Thanks Winnie.
author: Mary-Helen A.

description:
2 stars due to high prices for...average food...average service.  So I would not return.

Our party of 4 arrived for late lunch on a Saturday without a reservation.  They were fairly busy so we had to wait 15 mintues or so for a table.  

Service...our waitress attended to us promptly...but she never smiled.  She did not bring our orders in a logical order.  First she brought a lunch special order for 1 of our party.  The next order did not arrive until 5 minutes later.  It was a green curry.  We had to ask for the rice which arrived 5 minutes later.  By that time the curry was luke warm.  Our other items arrived at different times.  During the meal we had to ask the staff for various things.  They did not seem attentive.  They did bus the table well...:-)

Food...overall nothing special.  The green curry was bland.  The delicious green papaya salad was fresh & full of citrus flavor.  It was the best dish by far.  We ordered a steamed sea bass which looked good but apart from some toasted garlic on top, tasted bland.  Overall the food tasted bland for a Thai restaurant.

The prices seemed high for the service & food taste.  Our lunch special was $18, the steamed sea bass $30, a very small glass of beer $4, etc.  

Almost all other Thai restaurants I have been to in SF have been better values.
author: Saul M.

description:
The waitresses here are the rudest human beings who don't know a thing about customer service. I don't understand what makes them so constantly cranky. There is also an extra unfriendly one that refuses to give you hot sauce, forks and napkins when you ask for them. What kind of take out order doesn't include utensils in the first place?! 

Also, cockroaches: http://sfist.com/2013/11/08/lers_ros_closed_by_health_departmen.php
Gross
author: Joyce C.

description:
NOT a fan of the food OR the service. The way this place is set up is absolutely terrible and the food is mediocre and Americanized. 

If you come during dinner hour, you MUST come early or make a reservation or you will be relegated to the bar and high tables with uncomfortable, wiry seats. The main tables are absolutely impossible to eat at unless you have made reservations. Luckily I got there right at 5 with my mother, but they only allowed us to sit at the very high table which my mother had trouble getting up on and the seats provide you with no support. We were sitting at the one of only two tables that were open to walk ins. 

Now for the food - the duck salad was awful. It had so many good reviews on yelp and I was eager to try it, but the taste was SUPER pungent and it tasted as if it was dosed in vinegar. Also, they put some strange crunchy coating over the duck and it felt like I was biting into finger nails. It was so salty and strong it was impossible to eat without drinking massive gulps of water. 

The pad kee Mao was not impressive at all. It tasted more like beef chow fun with some spices thrown in and it was drowning in bean sprouts, which were more plentiful than the noodles themselves. 

The green curry was probably the most enjoyable dish of the night, but it wasn't too spectacular. I'd say it was your standard green curry dish but it certainly was not enough to salvage the meal. It had a good flavor, a nice balance of coconut milk and spices and just decent overall. 

Now back to the service - as we began to finish up our food, we had only been there a grand total of 40 minutes when the hostess came up and asked us how much longer we are going to take. EXCUSE ME?! Are we not paying customers that have as much right to sit and eat as everyone else? Im sorry you have people waiting but that is not our fault and it is awfully rude for you to expect us to rush when your restaurant's poor management skills prevent you from properly managing the amount of customers you have. 

I won't be coming back.
author: Sara W.

description:
This is a pretty good choice if you're looking for Thai food in the city. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is posh with huge floor to ceiling windows and modern furnishing. 

It's gets pretty busy during lunch here. They offer a great lunch special for $10, where you get to choose 2 items off their list. It's come with rice and salad. I always get their curries (red is my favorite) w/ chicken. Other top choices here are the basil minced beef, the spicy mango salad, the pad thai and pad see-ew. 

Service is good. The prices are reasonable. Portions are huge. Food is a bit too sweet for my liking, but over all pretty tasty. They have lots of vegan and vegetarian options too.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Their food is god awful.
Their service is even worse. 
While we were there the egotistical manager wasted 20 minutes of our time and did nothing more than apologize by coming back to let us know that both the items we had ordered were already sold out.
We used to be usuals. 
Now we hate the establishment and the management.
Don't waste your time supporting a mediocre food establishment with absolutely horrendous service.
author: Soroosh P.

description: Outstanding food, fresh looking and tasting. One of the best thai food experiences I've had.  Some unusual proteins on offer, boar, alligator, frog, so the more adventurous diner might like to give those a try.   Red curry with tofu was absolutely delicious, special of ginger scallops was absolutely fantastic.  Adding this to our go to list of restaurants next time we are in Hayes Valley
author: Dar V.

description: Loved getting take out here recently: pad see ew, crab fried rice, breaded pork and vegetables, ginger garlic rice - mmm!  This all hit the spot when I brought it home, and we thoroughly enjoyed it.  Service was nice and the guy at the front desk was friendly and chatty while we waited for our food.  I like the Larkin location too as this one is closer to me, but the Hayes location is very relaxed and lovely too.
author: Maile N.

description: Amazing food.  Authentic menu and spectacular presentation.  The yum pla duk foo is something most Thai restaurants don't even attempt to make, but Lers Ros does an excellent job.  We started with the Thai curry puffs with cucumber salad and peanut sauce.  My husband had his favorite - yellow curry with chicken and he said it was excellent.  We had ice cream for dessert - they are large portions and should have shared one between the two of us.  This is a great spot for very good Thai food.
author: Jeff S.

description: 30+ minute wait and they were going to serve me the wrong dish...and 5 minutes later found out it was still the wrong dish. Customer service was ok but could use some work. The redeeming quality is that the food is actually good and the ambiance and neighborhood it's in is great.
author: Berna V.

description: Service was good and quick. First time here ordered pad see ew with beef. Too salty and beef had chewy bits. Green curry was okay.
author: Shengyin G.

description: Food is good and on the higher end but the service is really bad. Asked three different staffs (from bus boy to two other waitresses) for four glasses of water, extra bowls for the noodle soup. Should not have TAKEN three requests. Even at baseball game, 3 strikes you're OUT! Then, appetizer came out fast and REMOVED FAST. We haven't even finish the appetizer and the waitress RUSHED to take it away. Ughh.... I'm not coming back to this location. Totally disappointed with this place  With it's location, I expect to have SUPERIOR service and manners.
author: K G.

description: Hands down, my FAVORITE thai restaurant in the city BY FAR. Never had ANY problems here and the food is ALWAYS amazing. I love coming here right before the opera or the SF Symphony concert BECAUSE this place doesn't make you smell like a fast food restaurant plus everyone is courteous and friendly!
author: Sophie P.

description:
Great food, tainted by awful service. Will update this post with details later. 

Go to the location at Larkin St for a better experience.

Update:

1) Made a reservation for 6 at 8:30 PM. Arrived at 8:29 PM with everybody in the party and they informed us that we'd have to wait 15 minutes.
2) Finally seated at 9:10 PM = 40 minute wait when we had a reservation?
3) Order our items, bill comes out to $22 per person after tax and tip. Split the bill onto a few credit cards with the last person being charged only a few dollars to cover the rest of the tip. Tip comes out to be 18%, which is generous considering the fact that we had to wait so long to be seated without a single apology. Most restaurants would usually comp an appetizer or dessert for that.

All of a sudden, a waitress who barely speaks English and obviously doesn't understand math yells at the group because the tip amount was so low on some of the receipts. This lasts for 10 minutes with the entire restaurant listening in and the waitress implying that we didn't tip enough and that we're cheap.

As far as I know, 18% tip is fine for good service, 20% for great service. Maybe I'm wrong?  Regardless of numbers, servers should never be hostile and confront customers for ANY reason. NEVER. 

As for the food/restaurant:

The food is great, it's on par with the original location on Larkin St. The restaurant itself is nicer and newer, but they need to seriously work on training their servers.
author: John W.

description: Been here on three different occasions. The food is consistently good enough to keep coming back. Service, not so much. Today they brought out our salads, but no beverages, and then my entree only.... Still no beverages. And then finally everything came out. Then they forgot the to go order we placed at the beginning. Never checked on us. Pretty standard scenario for past visits as well.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Everytime I've eaten at Lers Ros on Hayes, I've been pleased. Excellently prepared dishes. I've been here for dinner on a several occasions and have always found my meal to be perfectly prepared and well presented. The spices used are added with a delicate hand, never overwhelming the dish. 
The decor is pleasing, clean lines with an elegance.
Service is accomodating and polite. Yesterday was the first time I had lunch there and found the choices of the luncheon specials to varied.
The big bonus was Jeremy, the host. Warm, open, very welcoming, conversational and fun; he made our meal a " memorabe dining experience".  Prior to that, my visits were about the food but the addition of Jeremy is a testimony to the importance and contribution of a restaurant's host. He "made" our visit special.
author: Susan R.

description:
Wasn't impressed with the original Larkin location. Wasn't impressed with this Hayes spot. 

Stopped by for dinner on Sunday and easily snagged a two-top around 7pm. Ordered the tofu and eggplant stir fry and the $30 fish in lime and chile broth.

Waitress asked, do you want the eggplant to come out first? We said no. Waitress asked, what kind of rice do you want? We said brown rice.

Can you guess what happened next? Eggplant comes out first (10 min before the fish) along with a container of white rice. Guess the waitress was only asking to be polite.

The eggplant/tofu dish ($9.95) came with ~7-8 pieces of eggplant and 4-5 pieces of tofu (it was not substantial). The fish came in an interesting fish shaped platter placed on top of a burner. The presentation was impressive and it had nice tangy flavors, but it definitely would not have fed more than 2 people. 

All in all, both dishes tasted fine but neither had the pungency and kick of dishes I've tried in Thailand.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1071.

Food here is same great as the original on Polk. The garlic frog is my all time favorite except  it does have smaller chopped bones so be careful when you are eating the little meat the frog had. It's very flavorful.

I love their Tom Yum in clear soup which is served in a flaming pot to keep it hot as you are enjoying it. This is quite a pretty scene.

The rabbit was good and was also deep fried. The brown rice was with good chewy and moist. They also serve Jasmine tea which was very nice on a rainy day.

Service was fantastic and very couteous. If you look closer to the bottom, most of the plates and bowls are imported fromThailand.

The setting is not very traditional Thai but more modern American. It's got some artwork on the wall, dark wood table with clear plastic chairs. Think of it as Osha in Marina.
author: T L.

description:
I used to live in Thailand and have been going to the Lers Ros on Larkin for over a decade.  It has some of the best Thai food outside of Asia.  When they opened this Hayes location, I thought great way to share authentic foods in a slightly more upscale setting.
Unfortunately though, over time, the food at this location has really really slipped.  It has happened slowly over time.  The spices lessened and the flavors became more muted.  And, over the past year, we have noted a marked decline in the quality of the ingredients used, especially the pork and beef.  The pork shoulder items are now made with fatty and low quality meat which has rendered them bad tasting, tough, and almost inedible.  The beef curry tastes fatty and strong also. 
  I hope that this might be just this location trying to save some pennies due to the rent.  We are now going to retreat back to the Tenderloin.  
  Lers Ros team we love you and your restaurant.  Please look into this and see if there are some inadvertent changes!  We hope the old amazing Lers Ros we used to celebrate is back soon!
author: Trecker J.

description:
We have been here multiple times.  The time before Saturday, they screwed up our reservation, but we managed to get a table.  With great difficulty I made a reservation for Saturday, but when we got there, no reservation.  They couldn't find it, in spite of the fact that I asked them to repeat the info to us.  Hard on Saturday, Hayes Street when restaurants are full. But they seated us anyway
To add insult to injury, my wife ordered pork with onion and ginger.  They forgot the ginger and must have been on the last two pieces of onion. The pork was not well cooked and full of gristle.   My meal was OK.
Disappointing!  When they first opened, the food was really good.  

WHEN I EMAILED THE MAIN OFFICE, THEY GAVE US A GIFT CERTIFICATE TO TRY THEM AGAIN.  THIS TIME THE SERVICE AND FOOD WAS GOOD -- NO COMPLAINTS.   SO I GIVE THEM HIGH MARKS.  ANYONE CAN HAVE A  PROBLEM - JUST MAKE IT GOOD.
author: Buddy Boy D.

description: Nice portions (just the right amount, like not too much), food was fresh and savory. We got the yellow curry and the crispy pork belly, which both were great. It's simple and easy, a tad more in price in comparison to the nearby other Thai places, but very tasty. Keep hearing about one location in SF was better than the other, in reality, you can't go wrong here.
author: Howard J.

description:
it's a great back-up place to go in hayes when everything else is packed... and that's exactly what we did. it's trendier than most other thai places in the city, but not quite like osha.

according to two of my friends, it's the most authentic thai place in the city! and since you heard it from someone who has heard it from someone, you know it's true. jk. apparently it has the spiciest dishes of all the thai places in the city, and i can at least attest to that. i'm 90 percent sure that my face was melting off, and 100 percent sure that i hadn't taken any drugs. and i freaking love spicy food!

i hear the tenderloin location is better, but i haven't tested it out.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Lots of tofu options on the menu for vegans and very nice food!  They have a vegetarian section and asian places dont use dairy, so as a Vegan you are safe to order off this section as long as you dont see any egg.  

The atmosphere is somewhat lacking, it's a brand new bulding and feels a bit sterile.  I wouldn't bring a date here to wow them, its a bit loud... but not in a hip/cool way... in a loud, vacant way.

Food reviews...
Tom Yum Pak Soup:  Sooo flavorful, and sooo good.  This soup is really the only reason why I'm giving the restaurant 4 stars, otherwise it would be 3 stars.  The lemongrass and galangal and lime came together so yummily. There were four of us at the table and this was easily everyone's favorite.  Caveat:  I've never had a thai soup before that I can recall, so not sure how this soup would measure up for a connoisseur. We found it delicious.

Khing Sod Tofu:  Tofu with ginger, veggies, bean sauce. Good, not too oily, not too sweet, just the way i like it.  I wish this dish came with more veggies though.  

Spicy Tofu:  Same as the above but with bamboo and a bit spicier.  Dishes were almost identical in flavor. 

Brown rice:  soooooo tasty, i wish I could make brown rice this good.  Thai idea also had really good brown rice like Lers Ros.  Maybe it is a San Francisco thing?  I just moved here from Vancouver.

Beef Curry:  The other people at the table ordered this.  They thought it was good.  I'm always glad to find restaurants to cater to both vegan picky me and my omnivore friends.  Another reasons for 4 stars.

Thanks Lers Ros!  Very nice food!  We live around the corner and have already been back for 2nd visit and willl be sure to see more of you in our future.
author: Evelyn N.

description:
I wasn't planning on coming here for lunch. I was going to give Chez Maman a shot but due to BART slowdowns by the time I got to SF they already had a long line. And since it was pouring down rain I felt more inclined to soup than eggs. 

I ordered the curry puffs and seafood soup.

The puffs were the first disappointing food I've had at Lers Ros. They tasted pretty much of just dough. 

When I ordered the soup the waitress asked if spicy was OK and I said yes. She said she would put medium spicy. Wow! If that was medium spicy I can't imagine what the real spicy would be like. Talk about sinus clearing - I went through most of my purse pack of Kleenex! I had ordered a soup without noodles because I did not want to feel too full; I ended up adding an order of rice to add to the soup and ate nearly the entire pot of rice. Don't get me wrong, the soup was really good, with lemon grass, basil, lime, clams, shrimp, fish balls (really tasty). Not for the faint of heart, or should I say stomach? For dessert I got pistachio ice cream. Generous portion (probably could have served two but ice cream goes down easy), drizzled with honey, sprinkled with nuts. 

My overall impression remains, good food, moderate prices, generous portions, service still needs fixes. My table was very wobbly. When I mentioned this (it was hard to cut food) the waitress said she'd get someone to fix but did not. I saw a piece of rubber on the floor that had apparently been used to balance table but had gotten knocked out of position; I got down on the floor to put it back. I had to ask twice for refills on my tea. They brought the check without asking me if I wanted dessert. The napkins are way too flimsy and I had to ask for fresh. But the prices and food plus extensive menu still make Lers Ros worth a visit.
author: Carol S.

description:
Average Thai food with substandard service and a long wait, not worth the price.

It's interesting that they had a wine list, though we didn't get to try it out. The pad see-ew was meh, but the green curry was quite good. We also got the papaya and duck salads, which were okay. The food is really spicy here so take that into account!

It's not a bad place but the not worth the wait, and it's not a real fancy place so I thought every item on the menu was a few dollars more expensive than it should have been. I'm not from SF but probably won't be coming back here regardless.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Went here for lunch (take out) on a Saturday. It was pretty empty and the servers were pretty accommodating.

This place is OK. I ordered the Pad See Ew with pork and the broccoli beef and they were both good but nothing mind blowing. Not somewhere I would be anxiously waiting to return to.
author: Jessica L.

description: OMG! Best Thai food I've had ever! Not your average Thai. Menu items included alligator, rabbit, venison and boar. Tons of vegetarian options also. Everything had wonderful flavor and freshness. Sat at the bar because all the other tables in the restaurant were reserved already and we got there at 5pm when it opened on a Thursday night. We had fried vegetarian rolls (average) but the flash fried trout with mango sauce, duck larb, and pad broccoli were tremendous!!!!! Staff was very cordial and helpful. A must! We will be returning here many more times!!!!
author: Cindy L.

description:
I always hesitate to make best of statements.  I may run into a new best of next week.

However, for Lers Ros Thai (Hayes Valley), I am going to make an exception.  This is the best Thai food I've eaten in San Francisco.  It is among the best I've eaten anywhere.

On a suggestion from a colleague, we had lunch here.

I was surprised.  Based on it's reputation, I thought it would be busier.  Many of the nearby restaurants were quite full.  This was at 1 pm on a Thursday.   So, it wasn't at the absolute heart of lunch hour.

We were quickly greeted and offered a table of our choice.

The service was impeccable.  Our server was very friendly.  Not only was she courteous, but she was very helpful with the menu.  During ordering, we asked her advice on numerous menu items and she provided very helpful direction.  She also remembered my colleague from a previous visit.  She even remembered specifics of his order.

The ambiance is pretty basic.  It is neat and organized and pretty straight-forward.  It is a very functional room.  But, there is very little glitz to it.

The star of Lers Ros Thai is the food.  It is freshly prepared with quality fresh ingredients.  There is a very significant menu with a wide range of dishes.  There are many dishes that you do not usually find on your average local Thai restaurants menu.

The food:

Salad with spicy beef - I do not know the name of this dish.  It was a salad with strips of beef.  There was a touch of a kick.  Cabbage was provided to use if the heat became a little overpowering.  While the heat was noticeable, I found it to be pretty spot on to my own preference.  

http://tinyurl.com/735os7z

We also each received a small basket with sticky rice.  The rice was also wrapped in plastic to help keep it hot.

Roasted Thai Northern style herb sausage (served with peanut, cut ginger, sliced red onion, lemon and chili.)  I really enjoyed this dish.  The sausage was relatively mild.

http://tinyurl.com/8yarpky

http://tinyurl.com/7gwatwu

Nuer Pad Prik Thai Ooan (Sliced tender beef, stir fried with young pepper corn and galingale) - This was probably my favorite dish.  It was also spicy.  The meat was very tender.  The pepper corns and galingale had imparted levels of subtle flavors.  I ate this dish with steamed white rice.

http://tinyurl.com/6r6wovu

Steamed Vegetables - They looked exceedingly fresh.  They were obviously NOT overcooked.  However, I chose not to have any.

http://tinyurl.com/823uhze

There were also a number of different sauces provided.

Overall, functional neat ambiance, excellent service, and amazing food combined for a terrific lunch.  I would happily return.  I think it would be fantastic to go with a slightly larger group which would allow for trying many more dishes.
author: Mark D.

description: Thier lunch plates are fantastic! You get your choice of two selections from the menu. The  servers are always friendly and your food comes surprising fast.
author: Darryl H.

description: Solid food - plenty of choices. Service was a little rushed. Seats were dirty. Good prices for the area.
author: Howe L.

description:
This place is really shooting itself in the foot. Great location, really good food, and the absolute pushiest service in San Francisco. 

The hostess gave up our table when some of our party was late. That was actually OK. But they made no effort to make the present guests comfortable. They also rushed us out the door as we finished our meal.

Very unpleasant, rude staff that does not know how to run a restaurant.
author: Erik P.

description:
Food tastes good but the last two times I've ordered delivery the food has arrived 2+ hours later.  They tell you an hour on the phone and it's much, much longer.  When calling, they're no help other than to say your food is on the way.

Not worth the headache.
author: Andy R.

description:
I think of Thai food, with all its warm curries and hot noodle dishes, as prime comfort food, making me a huge fan of the more laidback and casual Thai restaurants out there (especially the quintessential kitschy ones that have karaoke stages and a dessert/drink menu as long as the food menu). 

For people like me, who often go to Thai restaurants to order some tom yum soup, pad see ew, and even a little dessert for under $20 before going out to brave the world, Lers Ros may not be your go-to. It's a slightly more expensive Thai restaurant with beautiful paneled floors, black minimalist furniture, and stone-covered walls. The portions are also much smaller and strictly per person, as opposed to other Thai places, where two entrees and rice may easily feed three people. 

With all that said, the food that we ordered was deliciously prepared. I tried the Kang Keaw Wan coconut milk curry (green curry) with brown jasmine rice, while my friend ordered the Kao Mun Kai Tod (a garlic and ginger rice plate with fried chicken). The green curry was the perfect blend of creaminess and spiciness, with a good assortment of chicken and vegetables thrown in. My friend seemed to enjoy her dish as well-- I tried a bit of her fried chicken, which had been prepared to golden crispy perfection. 

In conclusion, Lers Ros' rather modest portions makes me think that my $16 could have gotten me a comparably delicious meal and a half at another Thai restaurant. Although this is probably me being picky, I wasn't a fan of being charged extra for my rice either, especially when I'd ordered an entree that absolutely requires rice to be eaten (unless drinking is a new way to ingest curry). Will probably not be visiting Lers Ros too regularly, but I had no complaints about my meal here.
author: Esther W.

description:
Yeah, I'm late to the party but Lers Ros Thai does deliver food that is very close to what you find in some parts of Thailand and that isn't always the case in many Thai places in SF. 

The space on Hayes is way fancier than the original location and it's date worthy decor, also they have sound baffling panels luckily cause even with them it can get noisy.

The menu is huge and has a range of Thai dishes from Americanize non spicy for to more traditional dishes. The prices are higher than at many Thai places in the city but the quality of the food I felt was worth the price and there are many dishes at around 10 dollars.

Service was good with the server checking to see if our dishes were gluten free for my friend and being willing to split the check. They were attentive without hovering and just friendly in general.

The space is accessible in all areas including the bathrooms.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
Ler Ros Thai is located in a nice trendy location with all the standard trendy Thai restaurant decor. Just like its cookie cutter appearance, the menu is not unlike other restaurants of its kind. It's quite extensive and good thing they are categorized. One may be better off with just the lunch special appendage menu. The lunch deal is good; pick 2 dishes and it comes with a large heap of rice and side salad. Noodle soups are offered with only two types of noodles: flat or thin. I had the Kuay Tiew Moo Look Chin Pla (I had to copy and paste this from the online menu). It was exactly what I expected and delicious. I would come back to try more dishes from the noodle soup category alone. They also have dishes that feature rabbit, frog, and alligator.

lunch rush at noon. arrive early!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Review for Sat 8/17/13:  
Service was SLOW.. super slow.  The 3 of us were eating "family style" sharing 4 dishes with rice.  The dishes came out one at a time at a snail's pace.  I mean, the entire night, they refilled my water like 20 times!  Then, they even forgot about a dish until we asked the waiter about it.  Once the dish arrives, it was the wrong order.  We wanted Green Curry with "Prawns" and not "Pork."

THE WAITER DID NOT APOLOGIZE.  Instead, he took it upon himself to tell us that the words "Prawn" and "Pork" were too similar.  NOT.  He then claimed that he had repeated the name of that dish we ordered, which none of us recalled him doing so.  *(Please note that I'm auditory dominant).  

We did not argue.  We simply didn't eat the dish, so they took it away and, of course, still  charged us for the dish.  Oh, and the apology comes right before the waiter hands us the check because he still wants his tip.  REALLY?!  

Don't worry all, we still gave a minimal tip.  They'll just lose us as customers because apparently, Their Customers Are Always Wrong.
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
Let me begin by saying I had the worst customer service experience here than anywhere else in the past 10 years. First, the host was rude and would not seat me where I asked to sit (although the place was empty and she immediately seated the next party where I requested), lunch specials ended a half hour before the stated time on their website (false advertising), they wouldn't break a dollar for change so I could feed my expired meter (really?), and the server lied when I asked if the fried chicken entree was breast meat (it was all dark). FAIL. FAIL. FAIL. 

DO NOT come here if you expect anything but sub standard service.  As well as the food, I've had better.. a lot better. Definitely pass.
author: David E.

description:
I'm a regular at Lers Rors. I will point out the key differences between their two locations:

Hayes - nicer location, shorter wait, just average service
Larkin - ghetto location (in a sketchy part of the TL), longggg waits, but service is pretty good

Lers Ros is a solid place to go for a slightly more upscale Thai meal - good place to go on a date, before a show, etc. I'm vegan and there are definitely plenty of vegan options here on the vegetarian section - mostly you have to avoid things with eggs. My favorite is the Tofu Prik Khing (this is not on the menu at the Larkin location but they can make it for you if you just ask). The tofu is crispy and really spicy along with the green beans. I always get the garlic and ginger rice which is SO good. 

Food is definitely more expensive than the average Asian place, especially given the portion size. Overall, there is nothing special per se about Lers Ros but it is always a crowd pleaser.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I think the trick here is to stick with appetizers; the entrees weren't anything to rave about, and one we actually sent back as we were so disappointed with it.

For appetizers we had the garlic quail, papaya salad, thai puffs and a crispy beef dish.

The garlic quail was good, I personally am not a quail fan, however, once you got through all the bones to actually get a bite of meat, it was well cooked, and the piles of garlic seasoning on the side was delicious.  The papaya salad was also very well done.  It was extremely spicy, but so tasty, we powered through with a couple of glasses of water.  The thai puffs were also good, nice little carb bites.  The crispy beef was delicious, and the hot sauce mixture that came with it was sooo good!

For entrees we had the pad se ew, which was good! It wasn't too greasy, well flavored and chicken was well cooked.
The ginger beef was awful - that was the dish we had to send back.  The pieces of beef were all fatty and inedible, the dish itself was very bland and it didn't look appetizing at all.
The prawns in basil was ok, they only gave us 4 prawns on the dish, which is a bit stingy imo.
The tofu dish was another meh one.  The tofu was not tasty, too tough, like it had been overcooked, or just sitting on the hot plate for too long.

One interesting thing, we took a bottle of wine with us, and noticed on the menu that they waive the (minimal $12) corkage fee if you order a bottle of their list.  We ordered a bottle off their list as well, and when our bill came we had still been charged corkage...We asked about this, and she let us know the policy had just changed but they haven't had time to update the menu yet....what?  That was an interesting exchange, in the end she offered to void the charge "if we would like her to?" which was the whole point of us raising the issue.

I found it bizarre to have an out of date menu in the city and then to not address that with the table at the point of us ordering an additional bottle of wine.
author: Kym P.

description:
