Despite looking fancy, the prices here are actually really reasonable! We went to the Hayes Valley location to try something new. We both decided to order something different than what we'd normally get for Thai food: Garlic/Ginger Rice with Crispy Chicken and Tofu/Vegies in Sweet and Sour Sauce with Pineapple. 

The food didn't look impressive at first, but once we dug in, it was shockingly delicious! I've never had a sweet & sour mix that actually had a strong sour flavour, as the sweet flavours usually override it. The crispy chicken looked amazing, I wanted to steal pieces of it! 

Service was a bit on the miss side but we're aiming to go back since some of the other food options look great.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Fairly solid Thai for a typical "trendy thai" price. Friends recommended the TL location, but we were closer to HV so we stopped here. Maybe we're just spoiled by having a fantastic Thai place close to home, but Lers Ros was about on par with what we're used to. You usual options on the menu, plus the added novelty of the game options. Some more "authentic" options, too. Everything we had tasted good. The vegetables were crisp and flavorful and the sauces were just right. Only complaint about the food was that their idea of "medium" was really tame compared to what I'm used to, and I found myself wishing for some chili sauce to add to it. Looking around, though, I didn't see any on any of the other tables, so I felt like it would be unwelcome were I to ask. 

The decor is nice, not too contrived, everything seemed clean. The service... not great. We didn't know what we wanted right away, so the server disappeared, we waited a while with our menus down, and when she didn't come back we had to flag her down. The rice came out WAY before the rest of the food, so it just sat there getting cold, and then there was a lot of table-tetris going on with these attractive, but way over-sized serving dishes on our tiny little two-top. 

If you're nearby craving some curry, I'd say go for it, but it's nothing to go out of your way for.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
I heard the Tenderloin location has better food, but the Hayes valley location was easier for us to get to. 

Trying to remember what we got..
- Duck coconut milk curry: great flavor, not too salty, lots of vegetables and lots of duck, definitely need rice to go with it
- Whole fried fish: good crust on the outside, tender inside, surprisingly clean tasting despite that it was fried, served with a spicy dipping sauce
- Sliced pork: reminded me of Korean food, more unique for a Thai restaurant
- Pad Kee Mow: with chicken. It didn't have the wok char on it, and it was still pretty greasy, but the carbs did the job

Everything had a good amount of spice.  It wasn't too heavy, but I was pretty stuffed. 

Tip: They take reservations on their website
author: Marilyn H.

description: I liked everything I had for dinner here- the tom yum soup, the papaya salad, the larb, and the duck curry, but I am also aware that I am not the most adventurous Thai food eater. I thought that the service was very attentive and the restaurant had a good ambience. We ordered everything to medium spicy and it was spicy for a couple of people in our party so I would suggest starting with just a little bit of spice. Other than that I would highly recommend!
author: Allison S.

description:
I came here last weekend, at 6pm on Sunday.  The first thing on the menu looked awesome, so I ordered it.  Then, just before my girlfriend's stuff came out, our waiter came to say that they were out of it.  I asked what else they were out of, and they were out of 2 of 3 of the house specialties on the specials menu... Kinda weird that they'd hand out that menu without warning you first that you can't actually order much from it.

I ended up getting a chili prawns thing with some pretty cool gigantic beans.  It came out about 10 minutes after my girlfriend's entre.  It was supposed to be in chili oil, but it was really more of a sugar/molassis preparation that was cloyingly sweet.  The gigantor beans were pretty cool though... I'm glad I had those, I'd never had anything like them before.

Anyway, experience kinda sucked.  I had the runs 1 hour later.
author: Jon E.

description: This review is based on only the service. I was hesitant to eat at the the restaurant after it was shut down recently for health code violations but decided to finally give it a try. I made an online reservation a few weeks ago and showed up right on time. After talking to the hostess, it was obvious they didn't have any online reservations on record. The only had a written wait list. I showed her my email with the reservation, but instead of apologizing, she rudely just said we would have to wait like everyone else. There was another couple next to us that were in the same situation and just as fed up with the hostess. If they overbooked, they should be honest and apologize. Instead, the hostess was extremely rude. Unless they fix their service, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Thom Y.

description: Word on the street is that the other location is better, but hey this is a nicer neighborhood (and you can get smitten after).  Loved the pork belly..super crispy!  Also finally got to cross the duck off the 7x7 big eats list.  One down, a million more to go.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Came here for a goodbye party dinner on a Thursday night. I remember thinking that my friends would not arrive on time and there would be a wait at the restaurant so I got there about an hour or so late, and still had a to wait for a little bit.

I got the rabbit because well, why not? There were bones so it was somewhat a little difficult to eat, but it wasn't bad. I should get something else next time. Maybe some curry or pad thai. 

Service was WONDERFUL though.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Really great food both times around....

Papaya salad, spicy the way I like it, generous on the prawns!
Sticky rice - they need to make it a little cooler so that when you take it out of the container, it doesn't dry up in 15 seconds.   I had to put some water over it to keep it most....

Really yummy peanut sauce.

The chicken with spinach and peanut sauce - delish!

Last time, had the pad see ew - great as well.  

All flavoral, hopefully healthy dishes.
author: Candice H.

description: Lers Rose; you've officially provided my aunt with the worst birthday ever. Not only did you give our reserved table away to a party that did not have reservations, making us and our family wait for over 45 minutes, and when we complained, all we got was a "sorry, nothing we can do about it." In addition, I found a hair in my mediocre tasting food. If you like hair in bad tasting oily food, and a restaraunt giving your reserved table away to someone who just arrived after you've been waiting, then please come to Lers Rose. I believe you could have a better eating experience at Pf Changs or a McDonald's.
author: Mads M.

description: All the food with the exception of the Eel dish was beautifully crafted and presented. The service was done with a smile and the ambience was lovely to be in.  The eel dish - however was ridiculously conceptualized... Bone in dime sized morsels, I would've had to suck on them and spit the bones out at the dinner table. Not going to happen. Everyone else at the table was delighted with their food.
author: Lindsay H.

description:
Tears of joy (and reaction to spice) were held here by yours truly during pride weekend! Rekindling with a great group of past friends, we enjoyed such delicacies as Thai Herb Sausage, Tom Juerd Pla Muk Yuud Sai (stuffed calamari with pork in house special broth, vegetable and egg tofu), and Som Tom Poo (papaya salad). My tears were initiated by the spiciest dish: Pad Ped Moo Pah (boar stir-fried with a house-made chili paste, young peppercorn and galingale).

Been here 3 times, always tried new items each time, never a dull moment inside. Eat family style, mandatorily! Flavors on the plate are at least as scrumptious as those in your conversations here.
author: Garett T.

description:
I brought a couple more friends here for a late sunday lunch around 2pm and the service was so sloooow. My food was also bland as hell (chicken with.. some veggies) and we couldn't flag down the waitress to get sauce so we asked the kind people at the table next to us. They needed it again later so we passed it back to them. Took forever to get our waters refilled. Lame. 
Sorry LRT, ya lost me.
author: Christine Y.

description: Just had a fabulous experience here!  Extremely attentive, efficient service and delicious food (we had the red curry with chicken and tofu with eggplant in basil).  We were in a hurry, and they were able to bring the food out within a few minutes of ordering!  I saw the mixed reviews for this location, and wanted share the very positive experience I just had.
author: Barnali D.

description: The hostess was very rude from the beginning and then she took us to our table which was right by a register with no room to pull the chair out and plenty of room on the other side of the table so I asked if we could slide it over. She told me to sit in another seat (we had a party of 5 and it was a table with 5 seats) Dont know how she didn't put this together. So I tried to explain but she just rolled her eyes at me and said do you want another table? I said no and sat down and slid the table over a few inches. Problem solved. Her rudeness was completely unnecessary for such a simple situation. Then one of the food runners dumped sauce in my friends FULL glass of wine and just took it away without remark and never came back. The food was Mediocre. Our server was nice
author: Kristen R.

description:
Translucent chairs...cool. It's nice to find a Thai restaurant with modern decor other than Osha. 

I've been to Lers Ros on Hayes twice now. I honestly don't remember what I ordered the first time...it was only in December but it was clearly not a memorable meal. What I DO remember was walking away thinking it was kinda 'meh' and a tad overpriced for what it was. Then again, I guess you pay for the ambiance.

This time my experience was better, but mixed. My friend and I split the Garlic FROG appetizer. Yep, I tried flog. This may not be impressive for many of you out there, but I hadn't even tried beef until last July, so I'm patting myself on the back for this one. Anyways...back to the food. I thought the frog was decent. I can't say I like the bone to meat ratio, but that was the frog's fault, not the restaurant's. It was lightly fried and served with a spicy red sauce. Nothing to write home about, but decently good.

Next: We split the Red Curry with Roasted Duck and the Pad Kee Mow with Chicken. The Red Curry with Roasted Duck was DELICIOUS. I highly recommend it. The Pad Kee Mow, on the other hand, was kinda bland. There was some heat to it, but not much flavor.

Rather than give you a bowl of rice, the servers come around and serve you rice as needed. At first I thought this was annoying, but I quickly realized it's just a smart way to reduce waste. They were quite attendant to our rice needs, so it wasn't a problem.
author: Talia G.

description: They overcooked my noodles so they were kind of one big stuck mass I had to chew on, and when I ordered fish cakes, and the server repeated my order - I was still served vegetarian eggrolls. Not bad, but not great either.
author: Kristina B.

description: Horrible service. I came in for a weekday lunch by myself. No one was at the reception desk, so I put my name on the sign-in sheet and started to wait. There were quite a few empty small tables including bar seats when I signed in and I still was kept waiting for 20 minutes with others. Finally someone showed up at the reception desk. I was standing right next to the desk and was the first name on the sign-in sheet. Surprisingly, another two guys behind me approached her and told her they already seat themselves at an empty table. She left without acknowledging me and others in the line and walked to the table to serve the two guys behind me. I was like what the hell?  I had been there twice previously and the food was so so too. Will never go again.
author: Bright T.

description: Helps to have a Thai place in the hood. Really craved it that night and was expecting to be pleasantly surprised. Unfortunately the food was extremely oily and the noodle plate had less noodles and big pieces of celery ( we'd requested to skip the celery). Hopefully next time it will be slightly better. The server was helpful in avoiding non vegetarian ingredients.
author: Nutcrackin C.

description: It's been two hours and I still haven't received my delivery. We've called 3 times and they are "calling the delivery guy". At one point they didn't even know if my food was delivered or not. This is probably the worst service I've received and will never order from this restaurant again. I encourage you to do the same.
author: Raúl S.

description: They didn't have our reservation when we walked in but they sat us anyways. Apparently this is an ongoing problem. Make sure you get the person's name who took your reservation so you can drop it when arriving, just in case. Service and  food once we sat down was good. Live music on Saturday night was nice. $4 Thai beer Singha was quite good with my medium-spicy green curry. Wife has shrimp with peanut sauce and spinach which she loved. The finger and garlic rice was awesome. Overall, great quality for a decent price.
author: Ian S.

description:
Good food but the staff is so arrogant that you don't care about the food. I once said Thai iced tea was bad and not as they usually make and the waitress said ok took it and went away. Lol. No attempt to correct or to offer a fresh one. 

Very arrogant staff. 

When I'm paying explicitly for their service it's not too much to expect a little bit of kindness at least courtesy sake. 

Too bad they are rude. I was thinking to make it a regular. Their loss they missed a returning customer.
author: Priyanka A.

description:
Omg I was so hungry hungry when Wolf picked me up from school yesterday that I couldn't think straight. Since he hearts thai and h8s the TL we made a b-line for Hayes Valley and Lers because it was the closest good thai I could think of. And after we ordered and got our food I began shoving it in as fast as possible. From what I remember on the inhale, the chicken satay- YUM; chicken with chili sauce and green beans- so spicy my lips burned for a solid 20 minutes after; and the service- good. 

The flavors of the dishes are great. The acoustics in there are awful and its super loud. But Lers is still my favorite thai place in the city.
author: Emily D.

description:
Can't go wrong with this place.

I haven't found a Thai restaurant in SF that's as good as this one. I suspect that part of the reason is due to the ingredients they use: They don't substitute or skip them just because they're harder to get. For example, the tiny round Thai eggplants: Most other places don't bother with them, but Lers Ros uses them liberally in their curries. They also don't skimp on spiciness, which is great since lots of other places tone things down a bit too much.

If you come here, order anything pork related. They're ALL good. If anything, order Koh Moo Yang (grilled pork shoulder): Tender pork dipped in a spicy & tart sauce. I'm salivating just thinking about it!

And definitely order something from the " Original Thai Style" section. Chances are you wont' find "fried egg with acacia" elsewhere. I'm not suggesting this just for the novelty of it. That dish is actually very yummy (if you like tamarind).

If I'm by myself, sometimes I get one of the soup noodle dishes, and usually I get Kuay Tiew Rua (also known as Thai boat noodles.) It is very aromatic, spicy and sour, and comes with plenty of meat.
author: C C.

description: Holy crap. Spiciest Thai food I've ever had. I had a rough time getting through the chicken larb. It was good, but I couldn't fully enjoy it. If I ever come back, I'll make sure to ask for it mild!
author: Angela H.

description:
Hands down, my favorite Thai restaurant in the city!  I've eaten at both locations and the food is consistently awesome.  Service was fine and the interiors of both restaurants have been renovated/updated, though the one on Hayes is in a better neighborhood.  I'm picky when it comes to Pad Thai, and they get it just right.  Everything else has been great, though I've been less impressed with the appetizers.  

Overall, I highly recommend the restaurant and will continue going about 1x/week.
author: Hanna W.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here (sober) on a Sunday in the late afternoon during the Bay to Breakers aftermath. Was expecting inauthentic, not-so-great-tasting Thai food, but actually got inauthentic and very delicious food.

Food - We ordered the chili pepper beef and pad see ew with prawns. Both dishes were amazing. The beef was tender, covered in chili flakes how I like it, and while it didn't taste authentic, it was still worth the calories. The pad see ew was also great, and they are generous with their serving of prawns.

Ambience - Overall it looked like a low-budget restaurant trying to be stylish, so from afar, it looks like a cute cafe. It's nothing too special by SF's standards, but it's not your hole-in-the-wall thai restaurant either. On another note, I think the manager needs to pay attention to music choice in this restaurant; it REALLY did not set the right mood listening to 90s slow rock, like Savage Garden and Goo Goo Dolls. Seriously, play something upbeat so I don't feel like I'm eating in a supermarket in the Midwest.

Service - They were not aiming to please, from the hostess to the waitresses. Not only did it take about 10 minutes for us to get greeted after sitting, we didn't get checked on (not even a how are you doing?) from the waitress from the point of dropping off the dish until we got our check. But when I'm going out for Thai, or any other asian food for that matter, do I really expect 5-star service? Definitely not.

Will I come back? Sure, I'll return for the delicious food on a Wednesday night, but I would rather spend my precious Saturday nights at more accommodating and lively restaurants.
author: Casey L.

description: The food here itself is very good but probably the worse service and staff around. Our waitress had a very rude attitude towards us ever since we sat down. Then when we finished our meals she gave us the check and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. When my friend said we would like desert and asked for the mango sticky rice she said that they were out of mango. Craving desert, she said it was okay and ordered the fried banana with ice cream. The waitress knowing that she wasn't able to get rid of us glared at us and was like, "oh actually might have mango". Not coming back...
author: Sheridan L.

description: We went in close to closing time on a Saturday night, none the less the staff was super friendly and the food was outstanding - great food and service - loved it - highly recommend for a nice dinner experience- oh yeah - great beer !
author: Thorsten T.

description:
I made dinner reservations on their website for Saturday evening at 6:15 p.m. for party of eight.  The occasion was my birthday and my sister and her family were coming in from Marin, and Thai food is one cuisine that we all agree on.  We always go to Marnee Thai in the Sunset, but this year, I wanted to try something different -- it turned out to be an terrible decision! 

Eastbound traffic on Hayes Street was awful, and it was getting close to our reservation time.  I asked my husband to let me off a block west of the restaurant and I would walk the rest of the way to check-in since it was already the time of the reservation.  I was less than a block away when my phone rang.  It was someone at Lers Ros asking if we were going to honor our reservation.  I replied that I was walking there right at that moment and was less than a block away.  Later, I checked my phone for the time stamp, and that call had come in at 6:20 p.m.

I arrived not a minute after that phone call and there was no one at the check-in podium.  I looked around and saw servers busy with their tasks, but didn't see a host or hostess that I could check in with.  A couple minutes passed and I saw a female server setting a large table against the back wall and went over to speak to her.  I asked her if she was setting up for my party of 8 with the 6:15 p.m. reservations.  She asked if everyone was present.  I said that my husband and sister were parking, but that I expected them shortly.  I asked again if the table that she was setting up was for us.  She said that since we weren't all there, that she had to attend to the other customers who were waiting at the door.

My sister and her family arrived about five minutes after that. My husband and daughters just behind them. Some time later, a party of 4 arrived and checked in with the same server that I had been talking to. They announced that they also had dinner reservations; I found out that they also had reservations for 6:15 p.m., however, they arrived significantly later than we did.  Within a few minutes, they were seated.  That was the last straw.  I spoke to another server: there were words exchanged, and he admitted that they gave my table away.  I said, F--- you, thanks for ruining my birthday dinner, and left!  We had been waiting for a total of 40 minutes by the time we left.  Not my finest moment, but I'm owning up to it. Let's see if Lers Ros owns up to their part and admits that they were wrong too.

As we were walking back to the car, I called Marnee and asked if there was any way they could accommodate a party of 8 in 15 minutes, that we were driving there from Hayes Valley that moment.  The host answered that they could probably squeeze us in 30 minutes and took down my phone number.  The Marnee host called me back in two minutes and asked that if someone from my party could be dropped off and check-in with him when we arrived, that he could seat us sooner.  I said, "will do."  We were seated as soon as we arrived.  What a difference in service! We had a delicious and enjoyable meal after that disastrous attempt at Lers Ros.  

I don't about the food since I didn't get a chance to eat there, but if I could give this place ZERO STARS I would, if only for the complete lack of service. I have never encountered such unprofessional and rude service! I have never left a 1-star review on Yelp before, but in this case, I didn't see how I could not. Giving away my table just minutes after speaking to me on the phone - UNBELIEVABLE!
author: Sun L.

description:
OMG. the most delicious Thai food I've ever had :) good service and nice ambiance. i would recommend this place and the hot and sour soup :)
BTW, We went there for dinner so I'm not sure if they have the same menu for lunch or not!
author: Sara K.

description: Best Thai I've had in the city. The roll appetizer is a must - the dipping sauce was worth the visit alone.
author: Robbie K.

description:
DEEEEELISH!
Pros
- their red curry is drinkable. We usually get it as a take away so no one can judge me. 
- great portion size
- always tastes fresh and food is great quality.

Cons
- Delivery can take between 1-2hrs. I get hangry waiting

Eat in, take out, its delicious you wont regret it.
author: Ellen B.

description: Went with friends after shopping. Had no reservations but got seated quickly since a table left right as we put our name down. The service was decent, but I got sick from the stir fried pork belly. The meat was oddly dry and chewy and had an odd smell. I thought it was from fish sauce or something, but when I was dry heaving in the middle of the night, I was sure that I had gotten sick from it.
author: Yuri K.

description:
I came here with a friend and we shared  the pork belly and red curry with duck.  Friend loved the pork belly (I thought it was pretty good, but not amazing).  The curry was solid.  I actually like the Tenderloin location better in terms of food, but this is obviously a much more comfortable setting (inside and out!).

It's a three-star restaurant, but since there are no other good Thai options in Hayes Valley, I'm giving it four.
author: Erika C.

description: Something uniquely delicious about their Pad Thai AND cucumber salad also. Good lunch values also. Nicely decorated, dedicated staff, Aok prices. Check it out.
author: Sue C.

description: Have eaten here twice now and have left full and so satisfied both times. Service tended to be better at the Mission location, but nothing that would keep me from coming back. Eat here! And prepare to sweat from the spice!
author: Patrick F.

description: Worst service ever. Will let you wait forever. They claim 5 min but it will just take Forever.
author: Jiangyang Z.

description:
i love that lers ros isn't afraid to kick your ass in the spiciness department. What's that? the som tum is too hot? well order something else cause we like the fire. 

On a cool note, looks like the prices are the same as the TL location and the quality has not suffered at all.
author: Misha T.

description:
New location of Lers Ros... and not in the Tenderloin. I'm very happy about that. The interior is much nicer. A better ambiance for, let's say, a date, than the other location. It has a nice separate bar area, but all in all, the restaurant doesn't hold that many tables. Go early, so you're not one of the 100 people waiting for a table at 7:30pm.

Duck Larb salad is always a great start to the meal. Your tongue will be fresh and can take its citrusy spice.

Any of the curries is a good bet for sharing. Try them with both rice (I prefer brown) as well as wide rice noodles (sprinkled with peanuts atop!). YUM :)

We also got the catfish (bone-in) in chili paste sauce. The minimum spice level is medium... and it IS spicy, so be prepared! The catfish pieces are quite small so you'll be getting a whole lot of bone. For those not adept at deboning fish, opt for the filet instead. Personally the dish was too spicy for me, but someone who is more accustomed to it will love its strong flavors!
author: Sherry L.

description: I live like right across the street form this place so I never even thought of writing a review but considering that I eat here twice a week..... IT'S SO GOOD. Yellow curry, pad see ew, fried rolls, steamed broccoli- that's my usual order and it's always amazing. Haven't ventured that much (or even at all really) but I know what I like and Lers Ros makes the best yellow curry known to man. Reasonably priced for such high quality ingredients and the staff is always friendly. Love it here (and you will too!)
author: Rachel M.

description:
Lers Ros is a total staple for my apartment. Its been hard to branch out to order in from any other thai places because Lers Ros is so dependable and solid. The noodle dishes are great, as is the chicken skewer appetizer.

The actual restaurant has a great ambience. Definitely not the place to go for a romantic date, it's loud and happening. A very hip thai spot. Good for family style!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
For me, this place is all about the duck larb. The rest of the dishes I've had here have been good, but nothing that really stands out above every other $10-12 per plate Thai restaurant in SF. I come for the duck larb, stay for the duck larb, leave thinking about the duck larb.

Why would I recommend an entire restaurant based on the strength of one dish? Why don't I mention the atmosphere (clean, modern, dark), the service (attentive), the wine list (good enough) or the fact that I often have to ask the waitresses to repeat themselves so many times that I feel like a dick? Because none of these things are duck larb. Only duck larb is duck larb. There is no duck larb but duck larb and duck larb is its prophet.

Say it with me now: duck larb. It feels good just to say it. How many stars do I give this restaurant? Duck larb.

tl;dr: Duck larb.
author: Ben G.

description: The food is good. Tasty and lots of veggies. The only drawback is that most of the severs and hosts are rude and dismissive. I still go but I've learned to ignore their attitudes.
author: R D.

description: I am Thai and this place is the best SF has to offer! Reasonable prices, authentic food and fantastic staff! You will never be disappointed here!
author: Victor M.

description:
Stopped in to Lers Ros Thai for dinner on our trip to San Fran this week. I'm not sure if they have this all the time, but on Saturday night they had a live quartet playing Thai music, which I thought was pretty cool. The restaurant was relatively busy given that it was a Saturday night but we were greeted and sat down right away. The food was good too, a little pricey for Thai but it seemed to be good quality.

Honestly, my only real complaint is that after we received our food, no one came to check on us again until they came to take our plates. So we sat with empty drinks for 15 minutes or so. When she finally came back, she didn't offer any refills, just asked if we were finished, took our plates and brought the check.
author: Stacey S.

description: Heard many good reviews about this place and I decided to give it a shot. The spicy level is more to the   true Thai dishes. Their mild dishes are actually more like medium in other Thai restaurants, which doesn't bother me. We ordered six dishes among four of us and we couldn't finish them. The pan fried noodle dishes are safer bets. Garlic frog was too dry and it was hard to chew with. Thought of ordering the pad ped alligator w/ "medium" spicy level, yet was not brave enough and I detoured to the scallop with ginger sauce, wasn't too impressed. We were seated outdoor in such a nice neighborhood. Parking is difficult as usual.
author: SW Y.

description: Music and atmosphere is loud, room was stinky at times, waitress was pushy with the check and food was very average. Entrees go for $11-$22 but dont include rice.
author: Jacques A.

description:
RUDE, INCOMPETENT AND INCONSIDERATE LIARS. THIS PLACE DESERVES TO GO OUT OF BUSINESS.

The staff in this restaurant failed to honor a confirmed reservation, and then lied to us about it, treating us rudely and unprofessionally.  This is consistent with other reviews, including Fred T. from 11/10/2014 and Christy S from 10/13/2014 who were turned away after having confirmed reservations. They lied to Zhiyong X (11/13/2014),  Manya D (10/16/2014) and Ashkay K (10/16/2014) about what ingredients were in their food. So, not honoring confirmed reservations and lying are both patterns of behavior and not just isolated incidents.

I got an email from their reservation service saying: "Thank you for reserving at Lers Ros Hayes Valley. Your Dinner reservation on Saturday, November 29, 2014 for 3 at 6:15 PM is confirmed." We showed up 10 minutes early and they said, sorry, they were overbooked and there would be no table for us.  I showed them the email containing the reservation confirmation.  I looked over and saw an empty table, and asked why we were not being given that table since we had a confirmed reservation. 

The demeanor of the person dealing with us was completely rude and unprofessional, acting as if we were somehow at fault for them not honoring our confirmed reservation. They said that they tried to call to cancel the reservation. However, I looked at my phone and there was no record of any phone call from them. They were simply lying. Furthermore, they had my email address and could have emailed if they couldn't get in touch with me by phone.

We had tickets for an 8 PM symphony concert and there were absolutely no seats available at any decent restaurant in the area.  We had planned a nice evening out, but Lers Ros Thai turned what was supposed to be an enjoyable dinner into a stressful and unpleasant experience.  

The worst part of it was having to deal with rude, incompetent and inconsiderate liars.  I can deal with people who make an honest mistake, are apologetic, and do their best to right their wrong, but I can't do business with the kind of people who work at Lers Ros Thai.

If you don't want to support rude, incompetent and inconsiderate liars, you should not eat at Ler Ros Thai.  By the way, they were closed down by the health department, but recently re-opened: http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2013/11/08/lers-ros-in-hayes-valley-shut-down-by-health-department/
author: Ken C.

description: By the end of the meal, 2 of 5 dishes were wrong. We had 2 vegetarians. All their dishes had chicken. Forget about discount or refund got stuck with 18% gratuity....
author: Soham P.

description: In San Francisco a solid favorite!! Vegetarian coconut soup with vegetable is amazing as also the vegetarian pad thai!!! Friendly and nice atmosphere
author: Reed D.

description: The food here is always great! And no matter how busy they are, they are generally very quick and courteous with their service. Everything I've eaten here has been delicious and they're accommodating about my vegetarianism.
author: Sheila M.

description: I have been searching for a wonderful Thai restaurant in San Francisco.  This place is not it.  I was very disappointed in the food.  Way too goopy.  Hayes Valley as a destination takes a lot of effort as parking is very difficult.  Not worth the effort.
author: mi m.

description: I have been to MANY thai restaurants and this was the worst.  Started with the vegetable rolls, that tasted like they just took them out of a box and deep friend them.  No flavor. No nothing.  I had the LERS ROS SPECIAL COMBINATION PLATE  - papaya salad with grilled shrimp, and bbq chicken.  Nothing special about the papaya salad and the grilled shrimp didn't looked grilled.  The BBQ chicken was the DRYING, most overcooked chicken I have ever had.  My partner had the PRAWNS ASPARAGUS and it was so-so.  Won't go back again - they did at least take the vegetable rolls off the bill, but would have much rather preferred if they had taken the combination plate off.  Note to restaurant - if a customer doesn't eat most of their food, ask why!
author: Joi R.

description:
Nice place and good food. 

Poor service and servers need to learn how to speak and understand english! 

Unprofessional and incompetent manager...Pathetic!
author: Sjngdyanu C.

description: Best Thai food in the city! You can't make a bad choice; everything is fantastic!  Try the red curry, duck, pad kee Mao, sweet and sour soup, Thai curry puffs. Very fast for takeout too! Simply the best!
author: Meghan M.

description: I love this Thai place because I have happy memories from eating here with my little sister. The restaurant is also super clean, and they include chopsticks and forks when you order carry out. Get the shrimp pad Thai or fried rice!
author: Gina H.

description: I enjoyed my meal here, but the service and the space was really nothing special. We ordered the Tom Kha Kai and Pad Thai, as well as green curry and a tiger prawn dish. It wasn't the best Thai food I have ever had but it was pretty ok, or enough to try it one more time at least.
author: Kels E.

description: Not sure why this place doesn't have a higher rating.  It's our go-to thai takeout joint. The food is really good (especially the catfish!) and the staff has always been really friendly. Can't speak to the dining-in service though.
author: Kristie F.

description: I got the steamed chicken rice dish and I loved it!! The rice has a very flavorful ginger and garlic taste and had a generous portion of chicken, and I also like the spicy sauce accompanied with the dish. Will come back soon to try more dishes^^
author: Tina W.

description:
I disagree with everyone here. Consistent or no, the service here is endearingly human.

After making my reservation here, the maitre d'hotel called me three times to ensure that I'd make it to the restaurant as scheduled. When my party showed up for our reservation at 7pm, another party was still seated at our table, refusing to leave for the next half hour. Our hostess seemed obviously stressed out and about to break into tears. But by the end of the meal, we were having such a good time that I couldn't help but notice the grin on her face. It was good to see her like that.

As for food, my recommendations go to Pork Belly, Duck Larb, and Garlic Frog. The Pork Belly is easily a standard deviation better than anything else I ate. I didn't actually eat the Duck Larb or Garlic Frog, but given the acclaim from all of the foodies I personally know I would recommend them anyway.

I could totally handle eating here again. If I lived in SF, I'd probably be eating here all of the time.

PS: Apparently there are two Lers Ros restaurants in the city, and the one in the Tenderloin is better. Doesn't make a bit of difference to me, I'll go with this one.
author: Marty H.

description: As a vegetarian, this place is a downer. They put fish sauce in curries, but don't admit it. I'm okay with bad food, but this place is straight up dishonest.
author: Akshay K.

description: Delicious! All dishes we had with beef ginger, pork belly, tom yum and few more were all great! The taste is very strong flavor and i definitely come back for many more time!
author: Tu Anh D.

description:
Loved the super spicy dishes they have at this place. Great service taboot. 

Definitely worth it to come here.
author: Daniel H.

description: Omg we ordered medium spicy red curry chicken and we got a chili bomb soup with a tiny bit of chicken. It was so hot that it was deemed inedible. What the heck? Even if it weren't too spicy there wasn't much substance in the dish. Really unimpressed. Skip it.
author: Ella M.

description:
Another Lers Ros location?! YESSS!!! Right? Not quite...

I boldly stated that Lers Ros in the Tenderloin was THE best Thai food I have ever had. Walking into this newer location, I was expecting the same. We ordered my 2 usuals: Duck Larb and Pork Shoulder (which are still amazing). Not knowing what else to get, we decide to be a little bit more adventurous...so we order the Rabbit dish and Alligator dish. As default, we also ordered the Pad See Ew.

The Rabbit seemed overcooked and the meat was dry. The sauce and/or seasoning was nothing memorable. The Alligator was a big disappointment as I found it to be a very average dish. The flavor of it honestly tasted or reminded me of the spicy ramen packages. I'm very open to new foods and love trying new things, so I know it's not me being a picky food snob. The Pad See Ew was what you'd expect. Average.

Service was good. Interior is a lot nicer than the TL location. I might have been hallucinating but it seemed like portions at this location were less. Also keep in mind that this place closes earlier than the one in the TL. 

You can find my review for the Lers Ros Thai in the Tenderloin here:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco#hrid:TyLPhrIawAjNncWQ37A4bQ

This Lers Ros is still good but I'd rather wait outside in the cold chillin with the loiny locals for a seat to eat at the original location.
author: David P.

description: Best yellow curry I've ever had & I spent a month in Thailand! Pad Thai also great! Definitely will be back.
author: Sfgal S.

description: This place has the best Thai food in San Francisco. I know. I know. Everyone says this, but in the US I have had Thai in three restaurants that I have felt have the best dishes, and this place is one of them. It came recommend once by my husband's tailor who lives in Thailand but what finally brought us here was after the Nutcracker one evening this past December for a late post show dinner.  I was impressed.  I didn't give that last star because the service was just not great.  I would still go back though.
author: Mali C.

description: Love the atmosphere and location of this place but tonight the food and service was disappointing. I've been to their other location in the TL and have always had a good dining experience but tonight was bad. We waited for our food forever but the server was apologetic and offered us drinks on the house. The food was alright not as flavorful as the other location but the aesthetics of this location was very nice. Overall I don't think I'll return to this location. I'll have to brave it up and go to the TL for some good Thai food.
author: Matthew L.

description: Great authentic Thai good! Had the Tom yum phra which was medium spicy, fish paste curry, pork shoulder appetizer, pad Thai, Ginger garlic rice. All very good with a medium spice level which was perfect. Great service as well!
author: Elvie G.

description:
Food was good.  The Pad Woon Sen was pretty good - it's not too greasy as you would expect from stir fry noodles.  Kao Mun Kai Tod was the best item.  The chicken was still juicy, with the outside crispy.  Pairs very well with the chili sauce.  The yellow chicken curry was good - nothing extraordinary though.

Service was fast and friendly.
author: e c.

description:
I'll start off by saying I'm not a big fan of Thai food, but my friend wanted to eat it so I agreed.  I was pleasantly surprised with my food.  The noodles were amazing.  Good flavor and not too sweet.

The wait staff as some people pointed out, could be better.  Parking is street parking only and on a Friday night in Hayes Valley it's best to take the bus.

Overall, it was a good experience and I'd definitely come back.
author: Kenyon S.

description:
came after reading wonderful reviews and ordered

pad kra prow
pla duk pad phed

maybe we ordered the wrong items? these are just average expensive food.
author: Char Y.

description:
Never been to the venerable Tenderloin location, but this is probably my favorite Thai food in the city.  I've been here four or five times, and it never disappoints.

First of all, AWESOME lunch special.  You get to pick two combo items, a salad, and steamed rice, all for under $10.  The space is very modern and sleek, the servers friendly and quick, and the food is all around excellent.  My favorite have been the Moo Gratiem, Pad See Ew, and the curries.  Surprisingly solid chicken satays, too.

Perfect for everything from a solo lunch to a group dinner before the symphony/opera/ballet.  Great addition to Hayes Valley.
author: James S.

description:
Um.  Ok.  So we ordered this:

Yum Pla Duk Foo 
Lime based salad dressing salad of fried catfish with chili and plenty of garden vegetables

that is the description taken straight from their menu.  We were expecting fried catfish in the salad.  when the salad arrived, there was no actual catfish to be found.  just chunks of fry bits over lettuce with a few slivers of papaya and red peppers.  we asked two separate people about this, the second one being the manager i believe.  she explained that there was no actual catfish in the salad... the dressing was infused with fried catfish essence.  well i'll be damned.  seems like "Salad of fried catfish..." means that there is actual fried catfish in the salad.  complete misrepresentation.  

also got stir fried clams in chili basil sauce.  i was not impressed.  the sauce was good, but the clams still tasted extremely oceany.  

the green curry was good.  but overall, i'm pissed i bothered with this place.
author: Ash T.

description:
My lovely friend treated me to dinner here for my bday!  Normally I go to the other location but this one was more convenient for us both because we were meeting each other there and I don't want to get murder raped on Larkin. 

It's so fancy compared to the other location and the food was tasty and fast.  The ribs were too spicy for my taste but the other dishes were on point.
author: Poppy C.

description: I have had really good experiences before at the other Lers Ros location in the Tenderloin and decided to give the Hayes Valley location a try. I was very disappointed.  I wanted duck but they were out, so I went with the waiters suggestion on this pork belly dish that was way too fatty. I usually really enjoy pork belly and know it is a little fatty but never ONLY FAT, I don't think there was any meat in the dish at all, just chunks of fat. I gave it a try anyway and after one bite I felt like I was going to have a heart attack. The waiter saw that I didn't like my food and instead of getting me something new or taking the untouched meal off my tab, he quickly had the bus boy take it way as soon as my girl friend was done with her dish. I said something to the bus boy about how the dish was too fatty to eat but he ignored me.  Immediately there after waiter came over and dropped the check and quickly scurried off before I could say anything. Furthermore, it took a ridiculously long time to get my food, my girlfriend got her food a good ten minutes before mine came out, it probably took along time to cut off all the meat off the fat so they could save the meat for another dish.
author: Mike B.

description: Best Thai food in SF. Moved across the bridge to Oakland, which seems to be a desert of decent Thai food.
author: Josh M.

description:
Just a small step behind their sister restaurant in the TL. 

Having experienced the greatness that is Lers Ros Thai a few times at the more Loiny location, I was excited to find a location in Hayes Valley, and subsequently dragged my friends over, promising nothing short of mouthwatering goodness.

I ordered my usual dishes, the duck larb and the pork shoulder, as well as a couple other oddities that intrigued them, such as rabbit and alligator. The duck larb and pork shoulder were amazing, as I expected, but I believe the portions served at this location are a bit smaller than at the other restaurant. I possibly could be wrong, but I definitely felt like there should have been more food on the plate.

The alligator and rabbit were... interesting, to say the least. But the meat is just not as tender or flavorful as everything else we had, and I would not order this again. I'll try (almost) anything once, though.

The decor at the Hayes Valley location is much nicer and more modern, so if you're hesitant about venturing into the TL, this one might work for you. I'll stick to my slightly scary but at the same time slightly charming Tenderloin location instead.
author: Sally T.

description: I live in the area, and this is my go-to spot for Thai in the city. It's just an all-around good fit for all types of occasions. Great for groups if you make a rezzie in advance, and fine to just pop in as a party of two. Lers Ros is also my default takeout place for those "I'm hungry but I can't decide what I want to eat" nights. On my last visit, I was feeling slightly under the weather due to seasonal allergies (I'm getting old) and their version of Chicken Noodle Soup really hit the spot. Other favorite dishes I frequently order: the minced pork over rice, crispy pork belly & basil, the pad see yew, and the green curry.
author: Susan C.

description: Great place to have lunch in Hays Valley go early this place fills up fast.
author: Leon P.

description:
Stumbled upon this place with a few of my friends and it was really good. There were a lot of people and we just beat to rush at around 8pm. The ambiance was great and the staff was on top of it. They are friendly and continuously check up on you to see if you need anything else.

We started off with Som Tom Koong Yang which is a papaya salad with prawns. This was waaayyy to spicy. It was probably one of the spiciest things I had ever had. Both of my friends thought so too as we went through our waters. We also had Pad See-Ew, Veggies, and Kang Karee (yellow curry) with rice -- all paired with white wine of course. My favorite of the three must have been the yellow curry. It had amazing flavors from the spices, coconut milk, and beef. The Pad See Ew was great as well with the right about of seasoning and sauce. The noodles were very soft and fresh. Both were great and I would definitely have them again!

I usually judge a Thai place on its Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Yellow Curry and I will have to say that Lers Ros ranked pretty high on my all-time favorites! Check this place out. It's worth the short wait.
author: Kevin H.

description: Really unfortunate experience today at lunch.  Website says the place is open from 1030a-11p.  When we arrived the waitress hurried us along saying that they close at 4pm.  The entire 45 min $50 lunch was rushed and uncomfortable.  The waitresses were hovering over our table and practically kicked us out at 4pm.  The food was very good- but I definitely won't be back
author: Alan S.

description:
Id give the food a 2.5
I liked the serving size and the options.

i appreciate the number of veggie options as well.

Truth be told though, the service is terrible.  Its not just bad, its terrible.

shame.
author: Kate S.

description:
I have had great meals in this particular Lers Ros.  Me and friends love most of the food.  Unfortunately I was very disturbed by the waiters attitude the last time I was there.  Recently,  I took a good friend for lunch there and he told our wait person that his beer wasn't cold enough.  I would think the wait person would say:" I'm sorry Sir, what can I do for you?" Or something like that. Instead he said (with irritation): "We have put the beers in the fridge since last night, but it"s not cold enough for you. Oh that's all right Sir, I will give you ice." 

His attitude got worse regarding one my food order. I wanted a non spicy veg beef, but my friend mistakenly ordered the spicy one.  When the food came I said I couldn't eat this.  He looked pissed, and we apologized because we made a mistake and we really apologized  three times to him.   We also told him that we would pay for the spice beef order and take it home.  His response was: "It's all right it's on me. I have to pay for it." When we insisted we would pay he kinda snapped: "It's okay it's our policy." We felt really bad about it. If what he said it's true, I'd like Lers Ros management to change this policy.  Please let us pay our food especially when it is our fault.  I'd also like Lers Ros mgmt. to train their waiters to have a better attitude because this experience was not pleasant at all and has made us hesitant to go back.
author: Hediana U.

description:
Nice little neighborhood place with attentive servers. My Pad Thai (my standard for Thai restaurants) was flavorful, not greasy. My friend seemed to enjoy her curry dish.

Tables are arranged a bit close to each other, making for an intimate setting. Ordinarily that doesn't bother me. However, that night there was a group of college kids who, for whatever reason, were split into two. Some were sitting along the wall beside us while the others were across the aisle. 

The kids across the aisle had their backpacks behind us (not their friends next to us, mind you) and cell phones charging in the outlets. They kept signaling to their friends and squeezing in next to us to check their phones. It made for a lot of  disruptions to an otherwise nice dinner of catching-up with a friend I hadn't seen in months.

So Lers Ros, could you please keep diners and their belongings together? Thanks.
author: L L.

description:
If I'm being honest (and I usually am) I found my experience at Lers Ros a little underwhelming. The food was acceptably priced and in line with what I expect in San Francisco but not for the quality or quantity of food. A side of sticky rice for $2 (don't get me started on Thai restaurants charging extra for rice) was only enough for one person. 

My veggie green curry was meant to include eggplant, but there was none to be seen or tasted. The tofu in the curry was actually well done - not too overfried and not to soggy - but the sauce was watery and without any leftover rice to sop it up, it went to waste. Service was attentive and polite, but overall I wouldn't return, as I left hungry and feeling like I paid too much.
author: Kat F.

description:
Great pad Thai! Just enough peanut flavor without it overpowering the dish.  Also tried the fried roll as a starter, very tasty. 

Fast service. Great prices. Worth a try.
author: Jenna-Lee C.

description: Had dinner here last night with some friends and everything was delicious. We all ordered something different off the menu to share and not one of our dishes was bad, in fact all were amazing. Fast service and cool ambiance.
author: Dina W.

description:
Bad food ? no, the food is quite O.K. 

But considering the price, the hype and the service. Esp the price (I really think it is over price for what we ordered, for both quality and quantity), I can find better Thai food for myself (I am Thai) in San Francisco in no time.

    If you think this is "already good Thai food". I encourage you to try more Thai food  in the city (just use "Yelp" here) then you will know what i am talking about.
author: Dom G.

description:
Lers Ros Thai is one of the most popular Thai restaurants in the city, so popular that they had sprung up a new location in Hayes Valley without me even knowing. I have frequented the Tenderloin location, and had my doubts of authenticity, as I sat at my swanky clear chair amongst throngs of Hayes Valley hipsters, but this Lers Ros Thai is just as good as the original. Here are some tidbits of food reviews based on my visit:

- Pad Thai: I always order it. I love the chewy noodles, and the unauthentic flavor of a good ol' Americanized pad thai. It was pretty good here, kinda small, but definitely not the best I had in terms of flavor (lacking) and noodle texture (mushy).
-  Tom Kha: I never get coconut soup, but this was one of the better ones. It comes with chicken and shrimp, and I find their shrimp here is generally.... frozen tasting. You know, kinda pasty and odd tasting. Broth was good though and generous in portion; it comes out in a flaming pot!
- Pork Shoulder: This was tiny, but it was DEEELIcious. More delicious than the crispy pork dish which I thought I would love.
- Crispy Pork: This was tasty, and extra fatty. However, the skin was so crispy that I had a hard time chewing it.
- Pad Woon Sen: No
- Pad Krao?: Ground pork with basil. So simple. Who knew it could be so delicious?
- Green Curry: Typical. But good. Wish there were fewer carrots.
- Duck Larb: Their famous duck larb was good, but just as fatty as I remember. It was really tasty paired with a leaf of lettuce. 
- Mango sticky rice: Delicious as usual, it's mango season! Sticky rice was cooked a little too al dente.

Overall, food here is good depending on what you order, especially for such an upscale-style Thai chain. I would recommend making a reservation as it gets shockingly busy at dinner even on a weekday. My one favorite out of all the dishes was the pork shoulder and pad krao, but I can't wait to return to try some other dishes. 

Tip: They take AMEX and are willing to split cards amongst even a group of 8!
author: Jess C.

description:
If I could give ZERO stars, that's what they'd get.
Don't bother making a reservation here before a symphony as they don't honor their reservations at all and aren't sorry that we're left high and dry having to end up with a sandwich for dinner at a place that at least was nice & cordial.
No manager available, tell them you're not happy and they smile at you and do nothing.  They pretend not to speak English...maybe they don't but if that's the case they have no business running a restaurant in the United States.
Food smelled good but we were told our 6:00 reservation wouldn't be available until 7:30...this isn't the only restaurant near the Symphony Hall so they won't be seeing us again.  We'd be treated better at McDonald's.
author: anne l.

description:
Made reservations for a party of 8 for my friend's goodbye dinner. Everything was fine until the food came out. Everyone but my boyfriend and I got their food after 25 minutes, it took another 15-20 for ours to come out. When they did, it turns out they weren't even the ones we ordered.

The waitress stood there expecting us to take it until we told her they weren't the right orders. We eventually accepted because we didn't want to wait for another 15 minutes for our meals. 

The waitress spilled food all over my boyfriend and then nearly dropped a dish on me when taking our plates away.

Better Thai food and service can be found at Marnee Thai in the sunset, hands down. After they completely messed up our bill as well, I vowed to never come back. Sorry, Lers Ros, I wanted so badly to like you.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
The best service during my stay in the bay :/

I've had better Thai dishes elsewhere buuuuut what makes this place a 4/5 is their duck larb! It's soooooo good. One of the best larbs I've ever had.
author: Gen A.

description: Wonderful find - a very wide selection and it was really good.  We had the frog appetizer....not a lot of meat but it is frog after all.  Was pretty tasty and not loaded down with coating or other 'stretchers'.  Had the pad thai and the Tom Kha Kai which was awesome - coconut and lime and the mushrooms were wonderful....could just guzzle that stuff!  Service was nice and very fast.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Reallyyy good thai food in Hayes Valley. I had the duck salad and the pork belly both of which were delicious.. the pork belly comes by itself and is just cubes of porks that are fried so they are perfectly crispy with a slightly tangy sauce. the duck salad is pretty spicy but a little sour. not the best i've ever had but stlil pretty good. It's a little pricey for thai food but i guess thats what you get for living in SF. 

(they also have brown rice and deliver!)
author: James H.

description: Food here was ok but I prefer TL location. Both locations tables are tiny cant barely put much food on the table.  I HATE the service worse is this location, they bring the food out and there's  no room instead of moving some dishes around to put the new dish on, we had to move it for them. When we are done with some dish, we would have to call them over to remove it.. Overall I hate the service here!!!
author: Dedee L.

description: Yummy! Cool location! Attentive servers. Makes a good cheap lunch in an otherwise very expensive neighborhood. Definitely coming back.
author: Thomas P.

description: My husband and I, who are loyal customers, visited this establishment a couple of weeks ago. We told the hostess, "we would like to go to the bar (which was empty) and just order drinks, but please let us know if you have people who would like to sit in our place if they plan on ordering food." She agreed and we ended up ordering some tea (we had 20 minutes to kill). We were there for approximately five minutes and the hostess came up and said we had to leave because we were only ordering drinks AT THE BAR. Again, I mentioned that the bar was not packed and the restaurant had empty tables. I do not appreciate this terrible customer service especially towards loyal customers who have recommended this restaurant to others. In addition, the bartender even remembered us and apologized, but it was too late.
author: Alexandra O.

description: Great prices for such a nice restaurant. I like right around the corner from the Hayes Valley one and this is my go-to spot. I'd recommend it over the thai restaurant around the corner.
author: Matt D.

description:
Visits: Once, after seeing the great Yelp reviews.

Apps to try: Garlic frog! (although there isn't a whole lot of meat on those things)

Entrees to try: Red curry, chicken satay, mmm.

Desserts to try: I don't think they have any.

Service: Fast, friendly, and on top of their game.

Establishment: Decently sized place, kind of sketchy neighborhood, lots of seating.

Restroom: I didn't use it. Crazy, I know.

Parking: ...I don't know.

Stay away from: Nothing!

Special Notes: It's not in the best part of town...
author: Moonie M.

description: Nice Thai spot, but not amazing.  Maybe high tables just annoy me.  Wish the dining room were more comfortable.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Dropped in at 6:30 today right before a rush of people came in. 

Ordered Poh Tak which is basically tom yum with assorted seafood. It came with 4 clams, an abundance of squid and 4 prawns. What a salt lick!

I had to mix in rice to find it tolerable.

i had ordered jasmine steamed rice and it got mistranslated to brown rice. The error was quickly fixed but echos the trend of delivering the wrong item.

I'd recommend the Tenderloin's Ler Ros location for a bit more finesse and this location for ambiance
author: Diana L.

description: I really loved their other place in the Tenderloin but I am really loving this location too!!! Love their brown rice option and almost every dish they had on their menu. Can't go wrong with any of the beef, chicken or shrimp dishes. Delicious fried tofu and chicken satay for apps. Chow down on pad kra prow moo krob- really good crispy pork, koong kra pow- juicy shrimp and fried rice!! Gotta try the pad see ew and soup next time! Food comes out fairly quick - get mild and add chilies as needed if you can't handle their regular (a little more on the spicier side). Can't wait to come back!!
author: Karyn L.

description: Good, inexpensive Thai food in a nice setting-- the vegetarian options are by and large under $10, and it's much better than the other Thai options in the neighborhood. Try the papaya salad!
author: Abe S.

description: Really great experience here! Food was really good (tons of options), and service was super fast and attentive. I got the pad kee mao (medium spicy) and recommend that you ask for medium or less for any of the spicy food options (I'd heard things about their spicy fish as well). Cheap wine and beer. Would definitely come back.
author: Shirley L.

description:
This was hands-down one of the worse Thai restaurants I have ever had and I love all Thai restaurants. (I am that irritating friend who always insists on eating Thai ) 

It's pretty deceiving though since the interior design is absolutely beautiful. I, myself was taken back by how elegant the furniture was. There are glass chairs, sleek tables, full bar? and a huge flat screen.

We were so excited. I have tried the other sister restaurant and it was more focused on a typical thai style ambiance that it was a surprise to see how modernized their 2nd establishment was.

Besides the look, there is really nothing good about this place. 

1. Our server only took half of the people's order and left. When we called her back, her face was twisted in annoyance. We almost hesitated to add more appetizer after she came back because she was so unfriendly. 

2.The food was overly salty or pretty bland and I'm not talking about a few extra sprinkles of salt for taste, I'm talking about full on accidentally-poured-salt-and-the cap-fell -off-salty. I'm very shocked because their sister restaurant was really good :(

We order 7 orders and 5 were so salty that it was not edible. The food made me full just looking at it. The rice and beef was good. More on the lighter side. 

3. They had one nice thing , their box that the check comes in. Very swank. 

Sadly the only good thing there. Wait the place is really clean though.
author: Sue T.

description: Really great thai restaurant. The ambiance is very nice and the food is good. My friend and I had Pad Kee Mow and Kang Daeng (with shrimp instead of Pork or chicken) and they were both delicious. If you're particularly sensitive to spiciness, let the waiters know.
author: Ammar R.

description:
Love this place.  Great food.  And the best value restaurant in the city. Can be pretty spicy.  

Crowd always diverse and laid back.
author: Carl A.

description: A good sized lunch special for 10 bucks with vegetarian and meat options.
author: Jacob S.

description: The food is still good, but the crowds have worsened. Which is not unique to this restaurant of course, but people jam in here to wait for a table, negotiate with the hostess, and stumble over one another. On our last visit, the servers and hosts seemed harried and, frankly, surly. Thai restaurants are legendary for friendly, welcoming service, but when we arrived before 6 PM on a Friday to a mostly empty restaurant, they were positively indifferent to our arrival. They asked if they could bring all the dishes at once, which is already a little pushy, and were grabbing plates back as soon as we finished. I understand the concept of turning over tables, but this place has gone from Thai restaurant to just another Osha. Eat your good food as quickly as possible! Or get takeout, better yet.
author: Spaulding A.

description:
Rounding up to five stars. We made reservations and arrived about 5:15 on a Saturday, with tickets for a nearby SFJazz performance. Service was prompt and efficient, so we got served quickly and were able to get on our way well before the show. The place was nearly empty when we arrived but filled up pretty quickly. They seemed to have plenty of staff, unlike many restaurants in the Monterey Bay area.

Our two cucumber salads, three entrees, and a big bowl of brown rice (for three people) were more than enough. We ordered the Pla Trout Tod Nam Pla  [Fried quick marinated whole Trout in fish sauce and pepper, served with Mango sauce]. While I can't attest to any mango sauce, the fish was one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten.  We also had a tofu & vegetable dish that was very good--just the right level of heat--and a tasty shrimp dish.
author: J R.

description: I will never go here again! I made a reservation on line for a 6 pm time slot for 4 people on a Saturday night, which their website said was available. I received a phone call 2 hours before the actual time only to be told I had no reservation. I had to scramble for another place at the last minute. There was no explanation from the hostess except the website should not have excepted my reservation request. Never again will I set foot in that place. Everyone else should beware, they are not honest.
author: Nile R.

description:
Kao Mun Kai    

Garlic and Ginger rice with steamed chicken, served with soy bean paste sauce and clear soup

... Was awesome ....
author: Hanwook K.

description:
This place was great. Went on a Monday night for a birthday meal. Not too casual, not fancy. Good for a group or dinner date. Best part--such a bargain! You get generous (delicious) portions for the price, its in a great area, and the service is just fine. 

The spicy green curry tofu dish was yummy--super spicy just as I like it. With a kick of coconut that made it taste like Tom Kha. 
PUR 2012 Red Wine, cheapest bottle at $28 (cheap!) but not the best. Plenty of other beer/wine/sake selections. 

Will be back soon!
author: Karlie K.

description: I love this place.  Close to work, crowded but always get a table. I would have given 4 stars before yesterday's lunch visit but when my Co worker and I went in for lunch we met Jeremy. He was really funny and personable. Excellent customer service. Great food, great person greeting guests. Love it.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I have been to this restaurant a few times. The food is good, the service is non existing, But the I last time j was there with some friends was the the worst and I worth to be mentioned.
To start with the bathroom was totally gross. Dirty and they had no paper in any kind. It made me wonder how the kitchen is?? We order the food and they just brought everything at once. The servers are just rude.. They really don't care! At the end they brought us the bill without asking if we wanted something else.. I said we wanted to have some dessert and the server that the kitchen was closed.. You work in the service industry as I do. Customer service is very important.. Remember you're not the only Thaj restaurant in the city nor the last.. I will never go back..Not will I ever recommend this to my clients.. A bad experience it's all it takes!
author: Sepulveda M.

description:
Cool decor. Check out the paintings on the wall up close; they're really interesting.

AVOID:
* the rabbit. This was by far the WORST RABBIT I've ever had in my life. Full of bones, as if they tried to grind them but grinder vomited them back out only partially broken. REALLY - the damn little pieces of meat were full of bone splits. WTF.
* the coconut water. If you don't like it in general, you won't like it here. The extra sheets of coconut that they throw in it don't help.

Cool decor though. Just don't be too experimental with the food.
author: Vlad V.

description:
My friend loves their larb salad which is beef with marinated red onions. 

I tried one of the Thai specialties beef with red chili paste, green peppercorns and galanga. It was pretty good. 

Service is a but overzealous but sincere and kind. Seems to be a very popular place. Had to wait about 15 minutes at 8pm on a Friday.
author: Chris R.

description:
Tried Lers Ros on a recommendation from a friend.  
I was a bit skeptical when we arrived, because the place looked very slick.  I was wrong, this place has rock solid Thai food and very attentive service.
The best peanut sauce ever. Excellent shrimp spring rolls and chicken satay.  Rich green curry with chicken, and tangy shrimp pad thai.  
Wished I was there right now!!!
author: Mark T.

description:
Food was OK.  But, I'm not heading back again.

For the record... If a person is waiting and you let them know that a table is being cleared for them, and then A DIFFERENT PERSON comes in and just sits down at that VERY table, then there is a correct response and an incorrect response from the server/host.  When you made eye contact with me and saw my surprise and annoyance, your response of, "I guess it'll be a few more minutes for your table" was not the correct one.  My response of, "WRONG ANSWER," is my final answer.  That was my last time stepping foot in your establishment.  Use your voice, server/host and get some cajones.
author: Eric L.

description: I love Lers Ros! It has redeemed Thai food for me. I have eaten there many times, and ordered delivery through caviar many times, and I always love it. The brown rice is awesome, flavorful and nutty. Who gets excited about brown rice? Service can be kinda weird, but they get the job done.
author: Mary M.

description: Great food, (I liked the way how the chicken was cooked sans fat chunks which has slightly restored my trust of biting into saucy chicken) the service was good, was pretty clean and they had a real Thai band playing on Saturday night which was different and nice. Very busy and kinda loud but overall a good atmosphere for a casual dinner.
author: Ranee W.

description:
Walking around in this part of SF not knowing where to eat and ending up in this place is a very plesant surprise I can say. Super friendly staff and the food...... very very tasty. 
Closing my eyes, while tasting the house special Tom Kha Pak Tofu Soup, makes me feel like I'm in Thailand and I can assure you that is quite special because I never been there. 

I had dinner in this restaurant twice in a short time period and also the second time the food was amazing. Great place to eat.
author: Efraim F.

description:
All I can say, cockroaches on soup terrines.  I know they supposedly "cleaned up the kitchen", but I just go back to this article and the nightmare reappears!  

http://sfist.com/2013/11/08/lers_ros_closed_by_health_departmen.php
author: Hannah H.

description:
"Can we get that medium or mild spicy?" we asked about one of the dishes.

Answer: a definitive "No."

Couldn't believe my ears.  Very unusual but ok, I'll roll with it. Hey, maybe these guys are so good at what they do that all the flavors are balanced to perfection.  Not nearly the case.  

The papaya salad was RIDICULOUS HOT. It was seriously impossible.  My taste buds were so burned I couldn't savor the other ingredients in the dish. And that was just the appetizer!

The rest of the order turned out decent but after such a horrific start, it was difficult to enjoy the rest of the meal.  After reading some of the other reviews, I get a sense that there's no science whatsoever to how the spices are handled in the kitchen. Some dishes get heaps of chili and others get a sprinkle, all totally at random. 

Then there's the price point and the pseudo chic facade. Don't let appearances fool you. 

Not coming back again.
author: Emit S.

description: Updating: I have been here more recently and been underwhelmed, and they were closed down for a while due to a roach infestation! I just.. Can't go back..
author: Amy C.

description: This used to be my Saturday morning post-drinking food of choice, but I've moved on since then. My experience has been nothing short of good, but I've had friends with sore bellies afterwards -- makes it hard to convince folk to come along.
author: Christophe C.

description: I LOVE THAI FOOD. If you've read my reviews you see I eat there often. I'd heard mixed reviews about this place from my coworkers but I tried it anyways. I ordered my fave dish - pad kee mao with chicken - and it was great!! Ambiance awesome, service good and prices were very typical to the area. I would go back!
author: Jam Rockah E.

description:
Hands-down the best Thai food in San Francisco.  Must haves:

-Green curry chicken
-Pad Kra Prow (basil leaves, garlic etc.) with ground chicken
-Pad Kee Mow
-Nuer Pad Prik Thai Ooan (beef with house made chili paste, peppercorn and galingale)

You can't go wrong with any of their dishes though.  The food comes a little spicy by default, but if you are like me and like spicy food, ask for it extra spicy.
author: Ravi R.

description: Was Here on a Packed Saturday Night with as part of party of 10. Service was slow the Place is Very Loud and Noisy. I have noticed they placed acoustical foam tiles on the ceiling to addressed this issue. (it did not help much) On to the food I had a green seafood curry which was tasty and nicely presented. Sadly my wife's order was incorrect and took them a while before they corrected it. I tried the beef and squid dishes and they were both good. Here's my tip go this place during the week when its not packed and think you have a nice meal out.
author: Brian S.

description:
7x7 you fail again! This duck larb was SUPER salty and not even a top 1000, more or less 100.

That being said, their chicken green curry and pad see ew were pretty respectable, , the service was good, and there is some good people watching  to be had from the sidewalk seating. 

Maybe if I had gone to the mother ship branch I would have loved it, but its still not bad if you like an impromptu Hipster-Safari to accompany your meal.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
One of my favorite places to go for lunch, since it's close by and usually pretty quick to get a seat. Good lunch special, and relatively okay atmosphere. I usually come here with one or two of my co-workers and generally I don't have any crazy complaints about this place. 

The reason why I'm giving it 3-stars though is the service. The service is really, really, and I mean REALLY inconsistent. I've had great service and I've had horrible service here. Is it really necessary to scoff and roll their eyes at me when I ask for a glass of warm water or to split the bill? If you can get past that, this place is great.
author: Gloria Z.

description:
I just came back from lunch at this place and the food is not settling very well in my tummy.

First off, they have THE WORST SERVICE EVER. When I walked in with my friend they asked us if we wanted to sit at the bar even though there were tables open. When we opted for the table we received some dirty looks.

They didn't even give us menus when we sat down. Instead, they decided to give the two men who came in after us menus, then proceeded to take their order while my companion and I waited. And waited. And waited. When I finally flagged down one of the servers (come to find out she only serves the food) she pointed that "she'll take your order" to one of the passing servers. Instead of having our order taken we waited some more.

While waiting, the two men who came in after us received their food and another couple who sat behind us, who we watched order after us as well, also get their food. WTF people. That's a big pet peeve of mine.

So, my companion received his food first. He ordered the BBQ chicken and some other chicken dish (sorry, the food is forgetful). The BBQ chicken tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge for a week then they decided to cook it before it went bad. It was extremely overcooked. His other chicken dish was minced up and had an excessive amount of sauce poured all over it. Which seems to be the trend here. They just douse everything in sauce hoping you won't taste the poor quality of the food.

I ordered the garlic pork and the Chicken with cashews. The pork was also overcooked as was my chicken. Both were swimming in sauce. The pork tasted old and rubbery. In fact, the gum I'm chewing now is not enough to take the bad taste out of my mouth. The chicken with cashews... haha, what a joke! It's like they opened a can of chicken noodle soup, took out the noodles and threw in some cashews. I was so hungry so I just ate all of the rice.

I'm so disappointed in this place because this is my first time trying it and I was hoping to find a new Thai spot. I normally go up the street to Jardin Thai (which is by far the best in the Tenderloin area IMO). They need to hire more attentive servers for the lunch rush, and the girl serving the food needs to stop touching her hair every 5 seconds. Gross.

All in all, Poor service, poor quality of food and you can't even have a decent conversation because of the acoustics in there. I definitely won't be eating here again. I would give them zero stars but I can't.
author: Jenn P.

description:
Lers Rot (pronounced "Let Roat" if you don't know Thai) Hayes Valley is average mostly because it uses many non-Thai ingredients. More "americanized" than "authentic" is what probably appeals to those that don't know Thai cooking. Place is dark and not in any way Thai in design. 

Would I return? Only with people who don't know Thai food and who think this place is the best Thai place in the city (and who probably also believe Panda Express is the best Chinese food).
author: Flynt I.

description: Went with a big group and ordered pat thai. Decent dish, what you expect at a thai restaurant. Slightly salty and fishy, yum!
author: Jane S.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Very authentic.
author: Mark R.

description: you guys have to try the roasted duck! it's amazing! great place, decent price, lovely food :)
author: Brian Y.

description: This is just as good as the Ler Ros location in the Tenderloin, but you can feel comfortable parking your car and walking to the restaurant because the neighborhood is better. I would recommend the tom yum soup for an authentic experience -- it's sour, has chicken, shrimp and mushrooms. The curries, pad see ew, and pad thai were also really good. I heard this was the best Thai restaurant in SF and after trying it, I would definitely agree.
author: Lisa L.

description: Went here for dinner one time to meet up with some old high school buddies, a mini reunion of sorts. Ambiance was nice and food was good, but I gave it four stars instead because the place was small! Plus we made reservations and we still had to wait a while. Not vad overall though, might come back here.
author: Cindy S.
