However, please explain why, when we are the only two persons in the restaurant at 5:00 on a Saturday, the next 2 people come in and they are seated next to us our tables within two feet of each other.  Each table was for two but if pushed together would seat four.  We asked to be moved and the hostess rolled her eyes, went to the host stand, checked her book, came back and said she could move us.  We moved our own menus and water glasses.  Sat down at our new table and the hostess was glaring at my friend so we asked for a manager.  We were told no manager.  I exchanged seats with my friend so they would not be looking at each other. We ordered the food and drink.  To order the food, two different waiters came at separate times to take our order. (Sorry, already ordered with the first waiter) The appetizer ribs were extremely salty and fatty, bordering on inedible - I actually thought it was kitchen sabotage/retaliation.  Our wine came after the appetizer arrived.  Had a red curry dish that was very good and a "hot" calamari saute that was also good and definitely hot/spicy.
After our appetizer arrived, the next two people entered the restaurant.  Of course, they were seated directly next to us, again within two feet at a separated 4-top..  These two customers hesitated before sitting but decided to stay.  Now there are six person in the restaurant.  Some spacing would be nice.  We were out of there before six with no one else entering up to then.
Also, please train your likable but clumsy young staff to be able to explain the food preparation style and ingredients in each dish. Completely clueless service.  No one could answer the questions about the food.  We ordered roasted duck, which is on the menu they then returned and said they did not serve roasted duck but we could have stewed duck.  Not what we wanted.  
I would not go back despite the food being decent.  Please get a professional manager who can correctly and efficiently run a restaurant and train your staff.
author: Edward M.

description: I eat here often and am never disappointed with the food.  The chicken curry is awesome.  The food is always fresh.  The 5 stars is all about the food.  Service could be better
author: Mike B.

description: I'd give the food 3.5 stars if yelp allowed it. Came here with my girlfriend and we shared sweet and sour pork, a red curry chicken dish, and a spring roll appetizer. Everything was pretty good and I'd definitely go back for another decent meal next time I'm craving Thai food. I thought the service was a little over-eager-- I felt like someone came to check in with us about every 5 minutes and cleared our plates a little too early, but over-eager service is definitely better than the alternative.
author: Will A.

description: Visiting SF and selected Lers Ros based on reviews but found it to be average at best
author: Dennis K.

description: Perfect. Lovely ambiance, attentive staff, and the best Thai food in the Bay, hands down.
author: Rebecca B.

description: Had lunch here with my friends. The lunch special is affordable. Portions are decent. My only complaint is the waitress packed our leftovers to go and accidentally gave my food to my friend, vice versa. They should be more careful with that. I'm not mad.
author: Bianca B.

description: Came here by chance since the place we wanted to go to was packed.  I ordered the lunch special with chicken satay and yellow curry (with rice and salad).  My sister ordered the pad thai.  When my food came out, I was disappointed that my chicken satay was cold.  It was strange though because my curry was hot.  The curry was delicious though.  My sister's pad thai took much longer than expected.  We had to speak to someone to check on the status and she never came back to tell us it was on it's way.  The good thing was when it did finally come out, it was super hot and tasty.  When we were done, we waited a very long time to get the bill and again had to ask someone for our check.  Overall, the food was good but the service was a little slow.  I will have to try the location closer to my work and see how their service ranks.
author: Gabriela R.

description: This place serves fresh, quality Thai and is consistently delicious. I've gone to the one in Hayes Valley and the one in the Tenderloin, and while both are great, I prefer this Hayes Valley location because of the ambiance and location. Favorites are the chicken noodle soup, red curry, pork belly dish and tom yum soup. The menu is huge and diverse. One of my favorite places to eat in SF.
author: T. Y.

description: Second time here, impressive diversity of flavors. Pork belly was crispy and flavorful. Black pepper beef was spicy but not overwhelming. Green curry seafood delicious. Service is great but not oppressive. Ingredients are fresh, crisp and flavorful.
author: Barry C.

description: This is my go-to place whenever I'm in Hayes Valley.  They have a very reasonable lunch deal which always satisfies me. I did get their pad thai one time, which I found far, far too sweet for my taste (yes, I know it's supposed to be sweet). The salads I've gotten there--Larb Kai, Som Tom Koong Yang, Som Tom Koong Yang, among others-- have always been great. I haven't had much on their regular menu, since I'm usually there at lunch time. Service is good, and people I have taken there have always enjoyed the experience.
author: Vero K.

description: Dinner was good- not extraordinary, but solid.  We were heading to the Nourse and it was early- 5:45 so we had no problem getting a table.  Service was good. We ordered fairly Americanized stuff-  Green Papaya Salad (good but a little spicy) Pad Thai w/ prawns, Chicken dish on spinach w/ peanut sauce.   I would go back.
author: A S.

description:
Lers Ros is a nice Thai place that has some real hit or misses. The food is definitely presented really nicely, the taste, colors, textures and the way the dishes are cooked all seem really well done. However my biggest complaints are the following:
1. NEVER put a person who doesn't speak English at the front door of your restaurant on a Friday or Saturday or ANYDAY who can't welcome you, ask how many in your party, and then tell you how long the wait will be. Tonight's "hostess".. or more like "losttess" did not even say Good Evening to me when we came in  and it took 5 minutes and 4 tries to get her to understand that my name was NOT even on the list yet.. all I wanted to do was ADD my name. You only get one chance to make a first impression, and this place made a bad one right off the bat.
2. Tables are too too small and way too close together. There's nothing worse than an owner who is so greedy that they substitute customers dining comfort with trying to pack more tables in than possible. The table next to mine tonight was so close the person hit me twice with her elbow..Really?
3. Staff is very poorly trained, and dishes did not come out in the order they were asked for. Rice first? then one entree, then three entrees back to back? wrong, wrong wrong..
4. NOISE LEVEL IS INSANE. Forget this place if you want ANY kind of intimacy or the ability to hear or speak to your dining date. Plus, then they play music? I had a sore throat and a headache by the time we left. All stone wall, and tile floors make for an echo chamber. 

Final call: Good food, fairly priced, small'lish portions, and horrible manners and lack of professionalism by staff combined with eating on an airport runway.. it's ok, but it's definitely NOT worth more than 3 stars.
author: Brian W.

description: Sat outside amongst a bunch of empty tables. Our drinks hadn't even settled yet when I was asked to order. I said I needed more time. The waitress came back less than a minute later and told me, menu still open, "Ok. What are you having?" I have never been forced to order on the spot before, that was a first. Terrible start to what I was expecting to be a slow, classy dinner with the girlfriend. Her food came out about 20 minutes later. We had to wait another 5 minutes for mine to come out which made it a bit awkward. They didn't seem to care about the delay. Laughably bad service all around.
author: Brook T.

description:
Little pricey but the food and service is good.  Understandable as it's an expensive venue in Hayes Valley.

Seating time can be a little challenging on busy nights but hey that's how it goes.
author: Robert M.

description: I got take out for lunch. The fried tofu was fine, huge amount of tofu. The vegetarian green curry had so much oil in it that had separated and risen to the top that it was gross and greasy to eat. Only managed to get through half of the curry, after attempting to skim off as much of the oil as possible (no success). Feeling pretty gross right about now. Will not return. Shame cuz it looked nice inside!
author: Cl B.

description: I love this place and am happy to see a second location after frequenting the Larkin address several times. I reserve 5 stars for out of this world. Four for excellent, which Lers Ros is. Favorite dish: duck salad with lime dressing.
author: Chris J.

description: No pineapple fried rice! Seriously? I love Thai food and was very underwhelmed. This place has a nicer atmosphere and decor then most of the other Thai places in the TL, so it looks like people come here on dates rather then go to the dive-y joints (Sai Jai) a few blocks away, but the food just isn't as good.
author: Scott T.

description: My new favorite Thai place in SF. The new location in Hayes Valley is gorgeous, and the food is really good. I like the wide variety of dishes that aren't on typical Thai restaurant menus, and the fresh, well crafted flavors of the dishes. Excellent
author: Terry N.

description: Enjoyed Shrimp and Asparagus in some thai garlic sauce. Yummy!!! Very light an fresh.
author: Nneka G.

description: My rating is based on my experience right after this location opened. Food was good and service was fine. We had to ask for one of our entrees to be re-heated as it wasn't very warm at all. The atmosphere and cleanliness of the restaurant were great and I'm hoping that the next time I got back things will have been worked out a little more and my experience will be smoother.
author: Kent W.

description: The food here and the price are excellent!!  Came here with my best friends for dinner and we were impressed with the ambiance and cleanliness of the place.  We ordered the chopped lamb salad (had a lot of crunchiness which we were told was rice), the pad sew eew (i'm sure i misspelled it) and beef with ginger (beef was very tender).  For dessert, we had the sticky rice with mango and fried banana with honey.  The service was great but almost too great.  They were on us like glue.  Asked us almost every 5 minutes how we were doing or if the food was good.  The place gets packed pretty fast so come early.  This is one of the best Thai places I've been to.
author: j m.

description:
I wanted to like it.....I've heard such good things about the location in the TL.  But I've been here twice, and neither experience impressed me.  

Food - okay.  Good, but not impressive.

Service - meh.  My first time here I was with a birthday party and they brought everyone's dishes out 20 minutes apart.

Atmosphere - pretty awful.  I love the look of the restaurant, but it is so loud!!  I'm not deaf, but in that restaurant I can't hear what the person across from me is saying.  It's like being in a crowded bar.

I won't be back.
author: Amelia B.

description: Not bad, but has some improvements to make. The vegetables with peanut sauce, for example, were bland and overcooked. Literally tasted like steamed canned veggies with melted peanut butter. Other dishes were fine. Good pad see-ew.
author: Chris M.

description:
This is the new Hayes Valley location (the original Lers Ros is in the TL).  I have not tried the TL location so I'm not sure how it compares.  That said, judged on its own merits, this place allowed me to indulge my Thai cravings for a reasonable price and leave happy :)

We walked in on a Thursday evening without reservations and were seated immediately - a positive start to the evening.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant; there was a mix of couples and groups in a pretty wide age group (mid-twenties to sixties).  The tables, chairs, artwork, and even bar engender a very modern, uncluttered vibe (unlike other Thai places, especially in the TL where I feel like spotlessness and grace are missing from the venue.)

The staff was extremely attentive - constantly checking in on us.  We ordered three items which the two of us split: 1) papaya salad with grilled shrimp. We ordered it spicy and it actually was SPICY. They didn't hold back in the kitchen which was a refreshing change from other places that are too scared to give the customer what she is asking for.  The salad was also surprisingly filling (could've definitely been a meal on its own) and  also absolutely delicious.  2) We ordered the black pepper beef; I wasn't a big fan of the beef (too chewy for me, though the black pepper sauce was tasty) but my partner loved the dish.  3) The red curry vegetarian with eggplant was a solid dish, though not good enough to order again? I'd be more likely to explore the menu and try something new.  4) We also had an order of sticky rice. It didn't do a good job of soaking up the curry sauce however... unfortunately kind of a deal breaker for me (I'll probably stick to regular jasmine rice next time!)

Also ordered both sake  and singha beer = the latter paired perfectly with the black pepper beef and red curry. 

Overall, it was an enjoyable (and affordable) dinner -- making it pretty certain that I will be back soon!
author: Kimya P.

description:
Just as good as the Larkin location, but in a better neighborhood.  Although, that also means it's harder to find parking.

Must haves: pad see ew and the green curry. 

Also, they have a cool lunch special.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Had the vegetables and tofu w peanut sauce. Decent. Average. Yummy, but a bit pricey for what it was in my opinion. I would try again though.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Wow. Just received delivery because only one delivering before 5. Just terrible! Had pad thai, which to me is very basic dish. Small overcooked shrimp, roasted BBQ flavoring, noodles way overdone, sauce thick and ketchup-y. Pad see-uw had overwhelming whiff of bad chemical stench when opening lid. Tried the broccoli (very bitter) and rubbery, tasteless  chicken, and starchy/gummy noodles and couldn't finish more than one bite. Mango with sticky rice was good. Delivery was super fast and driver arrived on scooter. Needless to say I would never order from them again!!!
author: Brad D.

description: I am giving 4 stars but I think it's more 4 and half. The food was delicious and the price was very good. I went there for lunch with my co-workers and everyone enjoyed it. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: David L.

description:
Decided to give this new Hayes Valley location a try after having a good meal at the Tenderloin location. Unfortunately it was disappointing. We ordered two staple items: Pad See Ew and Yum Pla Muk (calamari salad). The pad was average, definitely not as good as Marnee Thai in terms of flavor or texture. The calamari was shoe-leather chewy!

We also had the "Fried Tender Marinated Pork Spareribs" appetizer (Kra Duk Moo Tod). The flavor was good but there was nothing tender about these tough-as-nails spareribs.

Hope this is not a case of the second-location expansion blues. Will give them one more try before giving up...
author: R Y.

description: The food at Lers Ros is tasty, but the location is too loud. I did not enjoy having to yell across the table to speak to my boyfriend. I love their Pad Thai dish, I would eat it nearly every day if I could.
author: J.D. Q.

description: We have been looking for memorable thai in san francisco for years, and this is it. It's hot, and spicy, with a twist - the twist comes in the form of alligator and the other unusual meats that they serve.  We will be coming back!
author: Laurence B.

description: Solid Thai food:  Had the asparagus prawns [special of the day]   Shrimp and asparagus were perfectly cooked [not overdone] and seasoned.  Service was rushed but fine.  Very reasonably priced.  I would return for dinner.
author: Otilia M.

description: This place is great, pretty much eat here weekly since I live on the block. Food and service is great. This is a nicely decorated hole in the wall, not the effing four seasons. What more can you expect for a $9 meal. People just like to be whining divas. If all you really care about is the quality and authenticity of the food, like me, then you'll love this place! One of my favorite Thai spots in town.
author: Kyle M.

description: I really liked this place, the surroundings are really nice and simple and the food is authentic. The food is very spicy so make sure you order it milder, or if you are a fan of spicy food this is your place! I noticed the servers are a little hard to communicate with but overall service is great. Definitely coming back!
author: Ariadne R.

description:
A little pricier than your typical Thai take-out place, but it's also a cut above in terms of quality.

Lunch is the best time to go - very reasonable lunch combo deals, and it's not too busy so very little wait.
author: Taylor U.

description: This is a great place for a bargain lunch.   Where else can you sit in a elegant room along the trendy part of Hayes Street while enjoying an authentic Thai lunch of a small salad and a choice of TWO entrees for $9.75?  Great flavors and generous portions.  Enough said!
author: James T.

description: Tried the red curry and it was yummy...wine was good..waiters were in little rush to give us the check for some reason..may be it was quite late but was very happy and of course will come back. The overall experience was awesome..part of it could be the perfect company I had but will credit to food as well !
author: A S.

description:
The food was actually ok.   My Thai friend ordered us a few traditional Thai dishes; stir fry clams, deep fried whole fish and some spicy vegetable soup; all strong flavor dishes.  Service wasn't bad either; the waitress was quite attentive.

My only issue was the noise level at the place.  I could hardly hear my friend talking.  They need to put some fabric in there to absorb the noises.
author: teatzar s.

description: Excellent Thai food and nice room.  Staff is super attentive and friendly
author: David M.

description: Decent Thai. Papaya salad was very good. A little fishy smelly. But tasty. Red curry with tofu was very good. Spinach was spinach. I'd try it again.
author: D R.

description: oh yea... safer hood, busier lunch crowd, but they didn't dumb down the spice on my usual noodle bowl! Would have to go two more times to see it's good at night too. the staff is more unseasoned than TL's store. They probably shoulda sent their best people from the TL store to train these waiters.
author: Emm C.

description: Little fancy restaurant. Liked Pad Thai. Be careful to order "mild" when you order Papaya Salad! That's always the case in most of the Thai restaurant:p
author: Maitai N.

description: They included fish sauce in the vegetarian salad.  Spicy tofu had no spice or flavor.  Won't go back.  Waitress was very nice.
author: Scott S.

description:
I have eaten at the location on Larkin too, and the food seems similar. My husband and I had lunch here, yesterday, a Saturday.  It was not that busy when we came ( less than half the restaurant full),  while the food was fine, the service was so poor.  And I am saying even in comparison going to places that aren't as fancy such as a noodle show, King of thai on Clement, if you get my drift.  It was beyond inattentive, and apathetic.  Got our wine after food came out, consistently had to flag someone down for the usual things, ordering, getting check, menu questions, etc, and when one of the servers cleared our table, there was absolutely no care in how it was done-- all this food and utensils dropping on the table, and it was left there the whole time.   on top of that, not welcoming, and we always felt we were troubling someone.


Food was fine, especially liked the salads.  Will be a good take out place if we can get over the bad experiencd yesterday.
author: R N.

description: Food is OK but overpriced. Would have given a much higher review but for the rude service .
author: Alex C.

description: curry puffs are amazing. pork belly is phenomenal. this place has legit food that never disappoints.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: Spotted the new location unexpectedly before going to the opera.  Had been to the original one on Larkin and this was very slick and sophisticated in comparison.  The servers were all charming and helpful.  Food was enjoyable.  We were rushing a bit to make it in time for curtain call but would like to go back at leisure.  We had the fried beef app - chewy and flavorful with a spicy tasty dipping sauce, the green curry with eggplant and chicken - good and the silver noodles with veggies that hubby was not too thrilled with.  Perhaps a meat with it would have worked better.  It was a bit bland in comparison to the other two dishes.
author: Ash A.

description: My to-go lunch spot in Hayes valley. The lunch specials give you a ton of food for $11, the service is good, the food is great. My favorite Thai food spot in San Francisco so far, by far.
author: Kent I.

description: Avoid the "rabbit" special, which could have been any small animal deep fried until there was nothing recognizable. Our server was unhelpful in suggesting any of the entrees: "everything here is great" is ignoring my question. And the white wines were undrinkable.
author: Eric M.

description:
I love both of the Lers Ros Thai restaurants.  We tried out the new HV location on a Thursday at about 7 pm and waited about 5 minutes for a table for 3.  It took awhile for the server to take our order but once it was in the food came out at a good pace.

We had the: 
papaya salad - love this, esp since they actually make it spicy!  medium was perfect for us, it made my eyes water & nose run but I could still taste the food

green curry with chicken - oh so good, again medium heat was just right

pad thai - it was ok but I'm not a huge fan of pad thai so probably not the best judge

the daily special with Stir-fried Alligator - actually really tasty (yes, like chicken but the alligator was a little tough)

The ambiance is definitely a little on the chichi side (unlike the one in the loin) and fits in well with the vibe of HV.  I found the set-up a little odd.  The tables seemed jammed together but there was still all kinds of space in the room.  But the food more than made up for the layout!
author: MK D.

description: have been there several times and tried many dishes, they were either good or excellent. price is pretty affordable for the decent portion. i personally think their dishes are a little underpriced for the location it's at. and, very friendly service.
author: Paiyu G.

description: Worst Thai food ever.  I love eggplant, but theirs was horrible.  The pad seew noodles were bland.  We ordered takeout and there was only one or two shrimp in our whole dish.
author: M H.

description: Much nicer location than its original location.  My favorite Thai place in SF.
author: KAREN C.

description: Duck larb, pork larb, crispy pork belly. Order it. Right now.
author: Diane D.

description: This is a go-to place to get thai food near Hayes Valley. I'm in love with Thai Green Curry, so this place fits that need tremendously. They also do take out, which works great. Call them up, order the take out and then by the time you get there, it's ready. Seating inside is more fancy than most Thai places I'm used to, and the prices match the decor. So while it isn't the cheapest option, it's quite good.
author: C S.

description: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY. IT WILL NOT ARRIVE. 1 hour after calling in an order for delivery, it hadnt arrived so i called to check on it. i was told that my order was on its way. 30 minutes later, it still had not arrived so i called back. they said they would look into and call me back. they never called back. i called 15 minutes later, they said they would look into it and call me back. they never called back. after 2 hours and 15 minutes, 6 phone calls, multiple requests to talk with the manager, i gave up. the food never arrived and neither the manager nor the person i spoke with on the phone ever explained why or attempted to apologize. the food may be good here but i wouldnt know.....
author: Kristin R.

description: Nice setting for a restaurant. It's very reasonably priced, especially for the neighborhood. For those who complain about the price, check out Hayes Street Grill across the street and feel your heart in your throat when you review their prices. For under $10 at lunch, you can get two items over rice. And that's not all, it comes with salad.
author: Rrr X.

description: Really good clean spicy Thai.  Huge menu so I'e not  tried much (who has!). Lovely place and service
author: bob o.

description: best thai in the city.  they dont water down the spicy level, which is great for me, since i love spicy.  the green curry is delicious.  the spicy tofu is barely spicy though.
author: Nisha K.

description: my dad and i had a meal here and it was delicious. the staff was incredibly attentive and kind. would definitely come back!
author: Elise H.

description: Michael Bauer gave it a Top 100 so we went. What a disappointment. The chef's "special" scallop plate was a mass of canned industrial vegetables with 4 miserable little scallops. The shrimp pad thai had 4 little shrimps (although the noodles were tasty). The famous garlic quail was okay and so were the fish cakes, but nothing special. The service was rushed and cold--not exactly rude, but indifferent at best. And no cocktails! Would definitely not go back again.
author: Steve H.

description: Came here for lunch today and it was soooo yummy! We got the famous pork belly dish and it did not disappoint. Really tasty and my husband kept scooping the sauce over his rice and devouring it. We also had the fried tofu, yellow curry with pork, pad see ew and the tom yum soup with noodles. All were delicious but we would still love to come back and try the other dishes on the menu.
author: Keromi K.

description: Decent food, but I would NEVER order delivery service from this place ever again. After being promised my order within 45-50 minutes, I ended up calling the restaurant after waiting over 90 minutes. Keep in mind that I am about a mile away from the restaurant. No apology until I asked for one. When I got the food, it was cold, and didn't even include utensils, napkins, etc. I hate to give bad reviews, but the service on this occasion was truly unacceptable.
author: Sean A.

description: Great food and service. One of the bed Thai restaurants in the city!
author: Ellee K.

description: Yellow curry and green papaya salad are awesome!!!
author: L B.

description: Best Thai restaurant I've tried in San Francisco! Really good favors and particularly spicy dishes (a plus in my book). Service is friendly too. Consistent and delicious. Too thumbs up! ;)
author: Jerrie D.

description: Really, really good Thai food- very nice ambiance. Surprisingly reasonable starting at $8/$9 for entrees. I had Red Curry Tofu. Deliciously rich, full of flavor, perfectly cooked vegetables and meaty tofu. Very, very good. My partner had Yellow Curry which was also delicious. We were warmly welcomed with a big Thai smile by the sweet hostess that made us feel right at home. We sat outside which afforded a little more privacy as the inside, while very pretty, was a bit crowded.  The only reason they don't get 5 Stars is our waitress wasn't very attentive - maybe because we were outside and they were extremely busy? And they charge a little extra for rice....I'm not cheap, I'm Italian and this seems to me a little like serving Marinara Sauce but charging extra if you actually want it on top of spaghetti.  I'll change my mindset for this place though because the food was fantastic. This will be our go-to place for Thai. That says it all.
author: Richard G.

description:
best pad thai i've ever had - big portion, NOT TOO SWEET! w/ tons of sprouts.
i would go back for that.
author: Kim Y.

description: I had the green curry with prawns.  Very good meal and curry was medium spicy.
author: Frances R.

description: We really liked the place. We came early at 5:45pm for a 7:30pm performance at the Opera (great Tosca production by the way), so didn't have to wait much for seating/food. Not sure what's the deal with complaints about pricing. We shared 4 dishes between the two of us: great Chicken Satay, a dish of raw shrimp split in half and coated with a garlic-chili pepper sauce (miam..), a rice noodle dish with pork (perhaps a bit over-garlicky), and a great dessert of sticky rice with mango. We also had 3 drinks (one beer, and 2 glasses of wine), and the bill came at less than $60. For downtown SF, I don't see how you can be more reasonable. The staff was very friendly. You could tell they were making an effort to be so, but it was actually very refreshing and cute. All in all a great evening.
author: Bruno M.

description: This place is pretty darn good. I unfortunately have only had take out here and wasn't able to experience the whole dining experience of lers ros and I've only had two dishes but I have a good feeling about this place. The first thing I had here was one of their rice dishes that comes with crab. I didn't particularly enjoy this dish because there were still bits of crab shell in my dish, so I wont be ordering that again, but i give them props for using real crab instead of the imitation one. The second dish I had here was the pork shoulder appetizer recommended to me by my coworker and boy oh boy was this dish good. Definitely worth coming back for... and I did. I'm excited to try some other dishes they have. Service seems okay. I never expect great service from Thai restaurants mainly because I never get anything thats impressed me before.
author: Josephine S.

description: Looking for a light bite and stopped in. Fish cake appetizer was very good. I had stir fried clams and was very tasty although there were more shells than clams. My wife had a beef dish and thin slices of beef were very tough. She likes beef but couldn't eat it.
author: Paul D.

description: Cute, good location, tasty, fresh food, good service, but nothing outstanding.
author: Danielle B.

description: The food was just ok, but the service was plain awful.  They wanted to take my plate away before I was finished, rushed us out in an hour and made us feel like never coming back.  Worst dining experience in the city!  Boo :(
author: Yodlee Y.

description: Food was quite authentic, and the spice was quite flavorful - more than just adding red pepper.  The beef in the Original Thai section and Pad Thai were great.  We ordered a 1L of Austrian red wine for $32, which was quite decent for the price.  A couple of the vegetarian dishes were a letdown - they were quite bland.  The place has good atmosphere.  Service is friendly but far from stellar.
author: Andrew D.

description: 3.5 stars. Tried this place because of its induction into the top 100 list. The pad thai, that Michael Bauer recommended, is delicious. The pad kee mao, not so much. BF enjoyed the pork belly. When trying a new place, best to stck to their signature dishes. Service is friendly and ambiance is pleasant. The noise level is high but didn't bother me.
author: Presto G.
